1.content:
The village of Malak was a small peaceful place that rested in a forest of the same name. It wasn't much, but it was the place you called home for all of your life. Well, all of your life up until now. You look over the village one last time as you stand at the front gate and double check your supplies.

"Are you sure about this, Erik?" A girl asked you. She was fourteen years old and had a modest figure. Her curly red hair came down to her shoulder and her eyes were a forest green. You've had a crush on her for the past two years.

"I certainly am, Molly." You tell her as you tie a small sack filled with coins to your belt. You understand her concern for you perfectly well. Her father went out on this same quest years ago; no one in the village has heard from him since then.

"But you're going out there with only a wooden sword!" Molly shouted at you. She was right, the only thing you had to defend yourself was a wooden sword. There just wasn't enough metal in the village to spare for quality weapons or armor.

"I'll buy something better when I reach the port." You tell her as you pat your money pouch.

"Just...Send a letter when you get there, alright?" Molly says when she realizes that she can't talk you out of this.

"Promise." You tell her with a grin as you head off to start you new adventure.

----------------

The sun was high in the sky as you traveled the dirt road that went from Malak to the port. The road wasn't used that much despite the fact that you could travel between the two towns on foot in less then a day. The monster girls of the Witch Queen had spread out to even this far corner of the kingdom; so even a short walk like this became incredibly dangerous.

Suddenly, you hear a noise from the forest. Out of a bush near the side of the road emerges a...

1112111111.content:
"Look, newbie..." The slime girl started. Surprisingly, she didn't make any move to attack you, and she had your wooden sword in her hands, looking it up and down.

"I have a name, you know. It's Erik." You reply bluntly. After the...event in the forest, you weren't exactly on good speaking terms with her. The Slime girl chuckled a bit, putting your sword down and looking at you darkly.

"Right, right. Slime don't have names. Of course, for me to be traveling with you, I'm gonna need a name." She retorted, a devious grin on her face.

Wait, what? "Um...you plan to travel wi-" You started before she interrupted, a miffed frown on her face now.

"Would you prefer a repeat of last time? This is not negotiable. See, I got to thinking...you're doomed. Dead. Helpless. You taking on the big girl on top is actually laughable. But...I honestly am interested." She said, surprising you. She looked up, as if counting the little nicks in the ceiling, and spoke again. "Odd, huh? I wish to kill the witch. See, my kind has gotten a bad reputation. I don't like that at all. Sure, you might think it's deserved after what I did to you today, but...let's be honest. I doubt you could call that your 'first time' given the circumstances. Your pride still has some merit. But as I was saying, it might be a little ODD to you, but I don't like laying low in a cave. Every. Single. DAY. I honestly live in fear with the constant thought a man or woman will one day come into my cave and freeze me with some ice magic. It's...a sad feeling." She said, looking down now, sad.

"My feral urge got the best of me back there, newbie. Now, to be fair, that was pathetic on your part not to offer any meaningful resistance, but that's neither here nor there. You're a longshot, but..." She trailed off, looking at your sword.

"But...what?" As much as she was insulting you, you couldn't help but listen. She seemed to have point she wanted to get to. She turned towards you and walked right up to you.

"While there are bands of warriors out there hunting Monsters, there are few people who wish to fight the one on top. But I can tell YOU do. And while you are still a newbie, with me by your side, you might get some good training between here and the witch. From there, we can part ways, be all buddy buddy, whatever you want. But either way, I'm joining you. Lord knows you need it!" She said, though it didn't sound like she was insulting YOU this time as much as she was counting on the witch being more dangerous.

Sadly, you had to agree with her. She seemed like a good traveling companion, and she was quite skilled. Plus, like it or not, you were not much of a powerhouse yet. "Well, alright then. You can come along."

She smirked, wrapped an arm around your neck, and winked. "Aha, good of ya, newbie! Still...question. Do you have a name for me now, or can you think of something later? I've kinda always wanted one, really, and I can't think of anything good. Aqua sounds nice, but...that's just silly. I want something with STYLE, newbie. Got anything?"

Well...do you?

You begin the process of kick and digging dirt into her back again, your body's muscles beginning to tense with each swing, sweat pourind down from your forehead, but you do not relent in your attack. At this point, you start to notice that her gelatinous flesh no longer has the sheen of a Slime, but now holds a grungy, muddy appearance, and as she turns to try and attack you again, you start to see her body is beginning to slow.

You back pedal from a horizontal Tendril whipping, the attack moving so slow, you saw it coming a mile away. Now is the time to attack. Holding your sword perpendicular to eye level, you take a stance, and charge out, avoiding a right hook from your opponent, ducking under the attack, and using the momentum to spin your body around into a full force diagonal slash. The attack hits, pushing the slime back a bit, surprise showing on her face.

"You hit me? How did you managed to hit me?" She cries out.

Erik takes this moment to take a breather, but keeps his guard ever up. "I figured that if my attacks couldn't connect due to you semi-liquid body, that I needed to change the consistancy to something a little denser. All those attacks I was making at you weren't meant to connect. I was simply getting you covered in dirt. But your smart... You can figure out the rest yourself..."

Her expression becomes one of terror, yet defiance. In desperation, she launches another jab towards you with her left, but you avoid it easily enough. She then takes another jab with her right, and you manage to side step it, taking a step foward as you do. She continues this assault, rapidly trying to strike at you, but her attacks are too slow now to really connect now. You take one last breath, and prepare a flurry of movements, striking her repeatedly all over her body, using basic Kendo strikes and hits, moving faster than she can manage to react. Pumping the last of your adrenaline, you push yourself into slashing out at her horizontally, managing to split her body in half. Even with the wooden sword, her body was weakened enough to easily cut through like a hot knife through butter. The upper half of her body lands on the ground as the lower half melts back into a dirty puddle.

You look to see that her upper half is heaving in breaths of air, her chest rising up and down. Looking at her face, you see a look of despair and defeat, tears rolling down the side of her face. She knows she has been beaten. In her current state, she wouldn't be able to put any form of a fight anymore.

Looking down at her, it was kind of sad to see her in this state. But at the same time, she was the one who attacked you. You can't leave her like this. But what to do? If you finish her, you can put her out of her misery, and she will never harm anyone else again. But showing no mercy to this monster? What would that make you? You could probably help her. Slimes don't need much to heal. In fact, all it takes is some water, which you had a canteen full in your pouch. It would be a simple matter to pour some on her body to help her reconstitute herself. But if you did that, she might try and attack you. Could you really gamble that she might be willing to let you go after all that has happened?

What's it going to be? Fight or Mercy?
1123111.title: The Epic of the Dirt Cutter

11231112.content:
Just because she's a monster, doesn't give you the right to act as one yourself.

Eric takes a sigh, and reaching into his napsack, pulls out a canteen of water. He carefully walks over to the fallen Slime, her eyes peering with fear toward the approaching human. She tries to get up with her arms, but they lack the strength and constitution to support the upper half of her body. She looks up to Eric in fear, and closes her eyes in expectance, awaiting for something to befall her.

Twisting off the cap of the canteen, Eric begins to pour the water over her head, and drizzles it over the rest of her prone upper body. As the water careens down, it begins to wash away the dirt and mud created from the battle. The Slime Girl's eyes open in surprise, not having expected water to come down on her. Desperately, she cups her hands and begins to let the water pool, drinking it down with vigor. As she drank down the water, her body began to regain its gelatinous palor, and upon inspection, the lower half of her body began to reform. Granted, the process of restoring her body stretched what she had out, giving her entire physique a now very petite and feeble appearance, but she was now restored to a movable state. Eric allowed the Canteen to pour completely out until it was empty. Sure, he needed that water to keep hydrated, and he didn't how long it would take to get to the port town, or near any form of drinking water, but the Slime Girl needed the water now more than he presently did.

The Slime Girl began to stand on jiggly legs, stumbling a bit, her expression still confused. "Why? Why did you do that? You could have finished me off, you had your chance... so why?"

Eric thought on his response. "Because I don't see a point in killing you..."

"Then you could have just left me! You didn't have to pour water on me..."

"Yeah... but then you'd be left vunerable for other monsters or creatures... I couldn't exactly leave someone so defenseless..."

The Slime Girl looked Eric in the eyes, trying to scan him for any deceit or deception, but found none. She then sighed, her expression much more calm than it was before. "I'm sorry I attacked you... I was just looking for an easy meal... let's start over from the beginning..." she then smiles toward him, and extends her hand toward Eric. "Hello... my name is Goella..."

(Note: Pronounced GO-ELL-AH)

Looking down at the hand, Eric watches for any hidden agenda, but sees sincerity in Goella's offering, and so, takes her hand in his, giving it a firm squeeze and shake, finding that her hand was gooey yet cool to the touch, almost soothing like a lotion. "My name is Eric... it is nice to meet you Goella."

"Thanks for the water... I know you humans need water like us slimes, so I really appreciate it. And again, I'm sorry for trying to eat you..." Goella states in solemn gratitude with an apologetic smile.

"It's no problem, really. I'll be fine without water for a while..."

"That's good to know... Well, I best get on my way... I have to go find a stream or something to reconstitute myself to full health... If ever you run into any more slimes in this forest, just mention my name, and they'll back off..."

"Thanks for that......" Erik began to think on this. He could ask to come with her so to help find a stream for the both of them. But truth is, he really needs to get back on the road and get out of this forest.

Should he ask to join her? Or Should he go on his own way?
11231112.title: Human Compassion

choices: She wants to and think it might be fun
No, she rather not be on a dangerous journey...
Before she can answer, a monster girl leaps out the river toward Eric and Goelia
112311121.content:
Eric wanted to continue the journey, but he is very tired out after the fight with Goelia. So he goes with the Slime girl to find a source of fresh water.

Goelia and Eric find a river full of fresh water. Eric refills his empty canteen and drinks a little directly from the river. Goelia absorbs a good amount of water which seems to restore her form from the rough fight.

After resting a bit and talking to her, Eric considers having her join you on the journey, even though she tired to eat him. Even though she is not really a fighter, her abilities could prove VERY useful for the journey ahead with all the dangerous monster girls ahead.

Eric asks Goelia if she wants to join him on the journey...
112311121.title: A break with Goelia

choices: A Wizard/witch comes by with a possible solution
Head to a town/village/city for a possible solution
Leave her or some other solution
1123111211.content:
"Sounds like a great idea and a lot of fun" says Goelia, "plus I think you could use someone else to help you on you adventure"

You are glad she is willing to come with you, however you realize a problem, Goelia's weakness to lack of water, "Actually, come to think of it, it might be not a great idea with your need of water."

"Oh..." said Goelia disappointed, "well, is there something we can do about it?"
1123111211.title: She wants to and think it might be fun

choices: Let Goelia wake up the shark
Do you wake up the shark
11231112113.content:
As You and Goelia ponder about a solution to the present an idea lightbulb pops out of Goelia's head startling the crap out You.
"I just remembered I have a Shark friend down stream who knows a lot about stuff and lots of know how;maybe she can help us make something."Goelia exclaims. She notice the fear clear on your face when she said 'shark'. She nervously laugh and says "don't worry she tried to eat a human whole and doesn't find them tasty so she spat him out and told him to run."
You almost hesitantly ask "why did she spat him out?"
She responds "she said something about being too fatty and not salty enough ." As if on que she says before you can ask the question "she prefers bunny girls, I think it's because they can be filling after playing with them."
Knowing you need some stuff and maybe this friend of hers could make you some stuff for free you gather your belongings and follow Goelia down river. Another reason to not leave her is because when will it another opportunity to have a cute slime to help you out. After a few minutes down path your curiosity was piqued just for a question.
"Um...Goelia how do we know it's her?"
She happily replies " just follow the trail of empty alcohol bottles."
"And how did she acquire said alcohol?"
"She made a deal with the river town further down if they give her alcohol she can fix whatever breaks or make some stuff they need."
Bewildered you ask "this town trusts her?"
Goelia ponders about that when her 'foot' slithers over a empty rum bottle. "Hey she's close by."
They follow the trail of empty alcohol bottles until they find the sleeping form of a shark girl. Her body is obviously humanoid but with a fin on both her arms, a dorsal fin on her back and a shark's tail coming from her tailbone. Her color scheme is that of a tiger shark, her hair is purple with blue streaks and her body type is rather curvy compared to some rumors you heard about shark girls but this is really something else.
You ask Goelia "so how do we wake her up?"
"Glad you asked" she happily responds. "Aside from being a know-it-all and an alcoholic he is also a perverted girl." Your heart skips a beat. "So do you want to wake her or do I?"
11231112113.title: that one random moment of brilliance

1123111213.content: What kind of monster leaps toward the adventurers?
1123111213.title: Before she can answer, a monster girl leaps out...

choices: Goelia causes a distraction and Eric takes out the Naga.
Goelia gets defeated and Eric is killed soon after.
11231112132.content:
Before Goelia could answer, a huge snake like body jumps out of the river and lands on the opposite side of the adventurers. After getting a good look at its body, you can now see what's attacking you: a naga. A monster with the upper body of a woman and a long snake tail as its lower body. Her tail is covered in dark green scales that are shining from the water. Her upper body has four arms and looks like it belongs to a warrior woman, wearing only a leather bra and gauntlets on all four of her hands as armor, probably to keep from hindering her movement. She is wielding four sabers in each of her hands and is wearing what looks like to be a bronze crown in her blonde hair. She yells at you "Ah, a slime and a human? This is an odd pairing. Usually one of you would kill the other by now. No matter, this just good news for me, a human for my food and a slime for my entertainment! I won't refuse such a lucky find."

The Naga brings up her swords in a defensive stance, preparing for an attack. Eric's mind is racing, not expecting to find such a strong opponent this early. He turns over to Goelia, maybe she knows how to fight them? But Goelia is no more confident than Eric. Her face has fear all over it and her body is shivering (or jiggling in this case) with fear. "Goelia!" you call out to her, "Are you okay?"

"I-I can't fight this. W-we need to run human. Now!" she cries out in fear.

"Oh you can try" the naga responds, causing Goelia to jump in fear, "But just so you know, I'm probably can move way faster than you on foot, and you have that river behind you too." Eric and Goelia look around, even if they could outrun her, the river severely limits their options. Fighting is the best option here, as bad as that sounds.

Eric turns to Goelia again and whispers "Hey, I think I have a plan. I just need you to get her attention."

"Me? H-how do I know you won't run away?"

"I just need you to trust me. Besides, didn't I just spare your life a few moments ago? You really think I would abandon you after that?"

"W-well, You're still a human"

"Come on, do you have any other choice?"

Goelia hesitates for a moment, before looking back and nodding her head.

"Okay, on my mark"

(What happens next?)
11231112132.title: A Lamia/Naga

choices: Tie up the naga and try to talk to her when she wakes up.
Kill the naga now while she's vulnerable.
112311121321.content:
At your mark, Goelia charges towards the naga who responds by coming down to bring all four of her swords onto her. The blades all cut the slime girl into pieces, but not before Goelia jumps toward her serpentine opponent and manages to wrap her body around then naga's human half. Finding it much harder to move and see now, the naga decides to bring her and the slime girl down and crash into the ground in an attempt to knock the slime girl off of her. She manages to cause a hard enough impact to knock a few bits off, but Goelia still manages to keep her grip. The naga takes it further and begins plowing through the ground to scrap off the slime girl. Meanwhile, Eric desperately tries to keep up with the two while also avoiding the naga's flailing tail in the process.

After a few moments of struggle, there's bits and pieces of Goelia everywhere until she finally has to let go before being separated into too many pieces. The naga is still covered in bits of the slime girl though and looks absolutely livid. She brings herself down up close to the now greatly reduced slime and brings up her swords for an attack. Luckily, this was just the chance Eric needed. The naga felt the human jump off her own tail and turned around to see a him coming down wooden sword in hand. He brings it down into the center of the naga's face, knocking her back down to the ground.

The naga drops two of her swords and brings her upper right and lower left hands to her face to put pressure on the pain. When she pulls her hands back, she sees blood that dripped out of her now broken nose. She turned back to Eric with another angry look on her face, only to be met with Eric brining another blow against her, this time coming down on the top of her head, with enough force to break his wooden sword in two and knocking the naga unconscious.

Eric falls onto his knees, exhausted by the ordeal. Goelia however, after reforming a bit of herself was quick to celebrate.

"We won. We won! HAHA! We defeated naga! Woohoo!" after that early celebration, the naga groans in her sleep, snapping Goelia into a state of fear again.

With that Eric suggests:
112311121321.title: Goelia causes a distraction and Eric takes out ...

1123111213211.content:
Luckily, Eric decided to bring rope on his adventure, and he and Goelia work together to tie up the naga. They both tie her arms down to her body and wrap up her tail around a tree and secure it with extra rope to keep her from running away.

Once they're done, Eric takes the opportunity ask Goelia, "So, have you made a decision?"

"Huh? About what?" Goelia asks.

"About joining my party? You didn't get a chance to answer me before."

"Oh, right. Well..."

"Come on, look at what we did together," he gestures towards the 15 foot long unconscious snake woman before them.

"Hmm. You know what? Yeah, I'll join you. With the two of us together, nothing can beat us! Especially this dumb naga." she proceeds to slap the naga, which only had the effect of smashing a bucket of water on her face, waking her up. "Eek, I'm sorry!" Goelia cowers behind Eric.

The naga sees her two captors and immediately tries to break her bonds. She stops as Eric points one of the naga's own swords towards her neck. Eric sums up all his confidence to try to keep up a tough guy persona to interrogate her and says "Hello, my name is Eric, this is Goelia, and you are our hostage now. How about you start with giving us your name?" Eric cringes at how cheesy he sounds at the moment, but he's too deep to give up the act now.

The naga hesitates but responds. "Sari. M-my name is Sari."

"Oh, that's a nice name. Now, since you are in possession of such nice weapons and seemed so protective of this river, do you mind telling us where you keep the rest of your stash? That way, I might have a reason to not let Goelia eat your right here and now." Goelia responds by putting on a serious look on her face.

After receiving the threat, Sari looks at them both and...
1123111213211.title: Tie up the naga and try to talk to her when she...

choices: Ask her to join the party in exchange
Take something in exchange for letting her go free
11231112132112.content:
Apparently this monster girl isn't as tough as she looks. As soon as Eric and Goelia started threatening her, she started crying. Well at least now, she might tell them any secrets she might have.

"Please don't eat me," she says, "I don't have anything, I swear! I just moved here from home, I didn't hurt anybody either except for a couple of animals and a slime!"

"Wait really?" Goelia asks surprised, "Then what was that act you put on back there? About me entertaining you?"

"And eating me" Eric adds.

"Most of the time, I just say that to scare people off. I swear I don't eat humans, really!"

"So, if you don't have a stash, and you don't fight anything strong, then where did you get your swords then?" Eric asks.

"They're hand-me-downs from my family, I don't have anything else I promise." she cried desperately, "You can take them if you want, just please let me go!"

"Alright just calm down, just let me think about this for a second" Eric says. Assuming she is telling the truth, then her swords were all she has. One would be a good replacement for your broken wooden sword and the rest might be sold for a decent price. Then Goelia interjects and whispers "Hey human, even though she looks totally pathetic right now, naga's are still one of the best melee fighters among all monsters, she might be useful."

"Are you suggesting we recruit her too?" Eric whispers back.

"Why not? It's not like she's in a position to refuse, and she's a four armed naga, those are especially rare. It would be such a missed opportunity to not take her. But if you just want to take her stuff, I suggest making use of her body in another way."

"Wait, are you suggesting-"

"Why not? You defeated her fair in square, you're entitled to pleasure yourself with a body like hers."

Eric looks at the naga again, with tears still on her cheeks, and makes his decision.
11231112132112.title: She starts...crying?

112311121321121.content:
"Wait, really?" Sari asks.

"Why not? You seem pretty strong."

"And you don't exactly have anything else to offer" Goelia adds.

"Hey!" Sari says offended.

"Sorry about her," Erik says. "So how about it?"

"Hmm... I suppose I could work with you for now, you do deserve something as a prize for defeating one such as myself" Sari says smugly, "Although only on the condition that I can leave when I desire."

"I suppose that sounds fair." Erik proceeds to cut Sari's bonds, and she immediately gets her energy back.

"Haha! Erik right?" Erik confirms that she got his name correct. "And Goelia?" Goelia tells Sari the proper way to pronounce her name. "Ah yes, sorry. You both made a wise decision recruiting me! As I am the daughter and student of the greatest fighter in my village"

"You got defeated by the both of us though." Goelia says jokingly.

"Well clearly I underestimated you. In a normal fight, I probably would've defeated you both handily."

"Oh, you wanna test that theory right now?"

"Nonono," she says timidly "I'm fine. You already proved you're worthy of my services" she says desperately trying to maintain her ego. Erik hoped that this wouldn't tire him out too much. "Hey, can I get my swords back by the way?"

"Oh sure," Erik says, handing her three of her swords back.

"Hey, I had four of these" Sari says.

"Sorry, I broke mine fighting you. You don't mind if I borrow yours do you?"

"I...guess it's fine," she says begrudgingly.

"Thanks!"

"He only broke it cause you have such a hard head" Goelia teases.

"Shut up." Sari retorts.

"So anyway," Goelia says to Erik. "Now that you've officially assembled a ragtag party for your adventure, where's the first stop of our journey?"

"Well," Erik says. "I was originally planning on going to town and seeing if there were any jobs I could take to gain money to buy better equipment. We could still head there."

"The town?" Goelia says skeptically.

"Yup."

"With all the humans who don't like monsters?"

"Oh. Well I didn't think I would be recruiting monsters on my quest on the way."

"It's okay. I get it."

Erik thinks of an alternative "Hey Sari, you said your mother was a fighter in your village right?"

"The BEST fighter" she says crossing all four of her arms. "Show my family a bit of respect. What? Are you considering going there?"

"I mean, it's an option. It'll just be for a day at least. Just to rest up and buy supplies."

"But you're a human."

"Yeah, but you guys are monsters, you can vouch for me right?"

"Um, our village doesn't accept all monsters you know" Sari says. "That's kind of racist Erik"

"Oh, I didn't know, sorry." Erick says. "So who do they accept?"

"Well, we do accept... um... Okay we don't accept most monster types, and Goelia would probably fit in too. But that doesn't give you the right to assume."

"Okay, sorry again."

"But I can't guarantee that you'll be let in, even with me and the slime"

"My name is Goelia"

"Yeah, whatever."

It's a tough choice. The human village who might cause trouble for your party members, or the monster village that might cause trouble for you.
112311121321121.title: Ask her to join the party in exchange

choices: The village militia and the village protector herself
1123111213211211.content:
Because of Erik's majority monster party, they all agree to go to Sari's village. It's about the same distance away as Eirik's original destination anyway, and hopefully the two monster girls can vouch for Erik upon entry.

On their way, they learn that Sari comes from a long line of naga who have been assigned the role of protector of the village and lead its militia, as her family have always been the best fighters in the village, according to Sari anyway. The village elder is also an old monster who had been around since before the rise of the witch queen, and had maintained neutrality for the village in the war between the human kingdom and the witch queen.

The three of them make it to the outskirts of the city, and as Erik is thinking of excuses for him to enter the village, they are stopped by...
1123111213211211.title: Go to Sari's village

choices: They encounter a shadowy figure just outside the town
1123111213211212.content:
Erik convinces the girls that going to the human village will be the best option. It'll have more supplies and weapons to buy and it'll have more work options.

As the three of them make their way, they all try to consider options to sneak in Goelia and Sari. Erik proposed disguises, but Sari's body would've been too difficult to pass off as human. Goelia suggested using the sewers to sneak in, but Sari argued fervently against that idea, and none of them knew the sewers that well anyway. Said proposed hiding in a carraige and letting Erik drive it in town, however this plan was made difficult by the fact that none of them owned a carriage.

By the time they were in view of the town's walls, none of them were able to think of a way in...until...
1123111213211212.title: Go to the human town

11231112132112121.content: They are just outside of town and gazing at its walls, trying to find a weak point, but then they are encountered by a shadowy figure, who turns out to be...
11231112132112121.title: They encounter a shadowy figure just outside th...

112311121321121211.content:
Erik is lost in thought in trying to find a way to bring Sari and Goelia into the town. And just as he was about to give up hope, a dark figure jumps out of the trees tackles Erik. Before he or his monster party members can react, the figure puts a knife to Erik's throat and wraps her legs around his body to pin his arms as he stands on his knees.

"Well this is a rare sight," says the figure in a very feminine voice. "What's a slime, a naga, and a human doing in this part of the country?"

"Let him go human!" Goelia yells as she brings her arms up to fight.

"Oh, which human are you referring to ms slime? Me? Or the one at the tip of my dagger?" says the figure, as she presses her blade against Erik's neck. She tightens her legs around Erik and he feels her large breasts press up against his back. "So let me ask you again, what brings you three here?"

"Well now, we're here to cut you to pieces lady!" says Sari.

The figure presses the dagger even harder against Erik's neck "Well, considering that's your goal in the end, I suppose I can slit this boy's throat if I'm just going to die anyway."

Before she can make the finishing blow, Erik quickly says "We just want to get into the town!"

"I could tell that much boy, I meant why do you, a human, want to enter with monsters?" the figure says.

"Because they're my traveling companions. We're on a quest to kill the witch queen."

Erik couldn't see the woman's face, but he could hear her start giggling, which proceeded into a very hard laugh. As she's laughing, she lowers her dagger from Erik's neck and lets him go. As Erik backs off from the woman, he's finally able to get a good look at her. From her outfit, he could deduce that she was either a thief or an assassin. She was wearing black leather boots and leggings that perfectly revealed the shape of her legs and hips. On her upper body she wore a cowl with its hood down to reveal a head of short red hair, and underneath the cowl was a crisscross halter top that exposed a good amount of her massive breasts. She was also missing her right arm above the elbow and the stump in its place was wrapped in leather cap. Her left arm was adorned with leather straps with metal studs on it and was sheathing her dagger.

"Well," she said, "In all my years, I've seen many adventurers come here to kill the witch queen, but never with a party like this."

"W-well, that's what we intend to do," Erik said. "And...um... we-"

Goelia could see the nervousness in Erik's voice and interjected, "And if you wanna get in our way, we'll gladly take you on"

The woman just laughed at Goelia's remark. "My word, you guys are pretty looney, aren't ya? Tell ya what, because you folks gave me such a laugh, I'll sneak you into town. In return for a favor of course."

"Really? Just like that?" Sari says ignorantly.

"What kind of favor are you asking" Erik says, now more confident from Goelia's actions.

"Oh we can discuss the details later. But if you don't want entry, I suppose I can leave you all here now."

Erik looks to Goelia and Sari, and both nod in approval. "Okay, we'll accept."

"Great! My name's Sythia by the way." She holds her arm out for a shake,

"Erik," he responds. He instinctively brings out his right hand, which makes for a weird handshake, but Sythia didn't seem to mind. He then introduces Goelia and Sari, who are both still suspicious of this one armed woman, not that Erik still isn't suspicious either.

After the introductions, Sythia walks by them and says, "Follow me."

The one-armed woman leads the party into an area exceptionally thick with trees and bushes. In it, Sythia reveals a tunnel hidden with fake bushes that she replaces once they all enter. She lights up a torch and takes the lead again. "These tunnels have been used by smugglers for years. The town watch will never find you here."

"Where will we go once we enter the town?" Erik asks.

"Don't worry, I know someone who can help with that too."

After several twists and turns, the party exits the tunnel and find themselves in...
112311121321121211.title: A rogue human assassin

1123111213211212111.content:
The one armed thief has lead the group into what looks like a brothel. They are surrounded by waitresses in skimpy outfits serving customers who look like they crawled out from the scum of the earth. Makes sense as it is connected to a smuggling tunnel. What makes this place even more off putting is all the looks directed at the four armed snake woman and the slime who just entered.

Sythia puts away her torch and turns back towards back to the party, "Welcome to the Salty Succubus ladies and gentlemen. The staff here will be sure to treat you all well."

"Do they usually accept monsters as guests?" Erik asks. Meanwhile, Sira is on the brink of panicking with the looks of everyone glaring at her threateningly, but Goelia seems keen on returning those glares.

"Well, not usually. But again, I know someone. Speaking of which, where is--" before she can finish her sentence, a hand shoots into her top and starts groping her breast, to which Sythia responds by reaching for her dagger, but she's stopped by another hand grabbing her only arm and a seductive, feminine voice that says...

"Sythia, where have you been sweetie? You promised you would be back before my break was over." the speaker was a dark skinned woman who was relatively slim, and was wearing a more modest attire compared to the rest of the staff.

"Dorothea, I'm sorry honey, I just needed to help this guy sneak his monsters through the walls. Speaking of which, Dorothea honey-"

"Oh no," Dorothea says after seeing Sari and Goelia, "I took in a lot of weirdos for you, but monsters are another subject entirely"

"Please honey," Sythia puts on an uncharacteristically pouty face for her lover, "It'll just be for a couple of night, please?"

Dorothea's expression doesn't seem to change, so Sythia switches tactics.

She turns around and puts her hand on Dorothea's cheek and puts on a more seductive look. "If you do, I'll take off work for the rest of the week, just to spend more nights with you" she says while biting her lip.

Dorothea blushes, "Fine. Two nights. One for tonight, and one for tomorrow. But after that they leave."

Sythia hugs her lover with big grin on her face. "That's why I love you hun."

"Shut up you big titted goof. The rest of the week better be the best nights of my life." Dorothea pulls a key out of her pocket and hands it to one of the waitresses. "Show these three to Sythia's guest room." Did she have a room specifically dedicated to people her girlfriend pulled from the streets? Or...forest in Erik's case.

Sythia raised her arm stump to gain Erik's attention, as her arm was still holding onto her girlfriend, "Erik, about that favor" before she could finish that statement, Dorothea grabbed Sythia's head and pulled her into a deep passionate kiss.

Once she let go, the innkeeper said "Oh no you don't. No work for the rest of the week remember?"

"Including tonight?"

"Yes, now come here my one-armed sex slave" Dorothea dragged the thief off.

"I'll tell ya later, I'll keep in touch!" was all Sythia could get out before disappearing into Dorothea's room.

The waitress who would escort the party was a petit girl who was shaking in her heels at the sight of Sari and Goelia. Erik did his best to calm her down and Goelia tried to appear as nonthreatening as possible. Sari however was quick to stroke her ego at the girl's fear, to which Goelia responded by whipping the back of her head. The argument following was enough to get the waitress laughing and ease her nerves enough for her to show them their room. It was surprisingly large, with two beds, a view over the street.

However, the two beds started an argument between the two monster girls over who should sleep in the beds. Erik offered to sleep with either of them, but who should it be? Goelia was nice and all, but her liquid body could make the experience uncomfortable, or she might accidentally dissolve him. Sari was also an option, but she might accidentally squeeze Erik to death. Who should it be?
1123111213211212111.title: In an inn and brothel

112311121332.content: A water elemental? Because of the river?
112311121332.title: Other

112311122.content:
No, Erik couldn't afford anymore distractions. He needed to get to the port Town ASAP before Sundown.

"I guess this is goodbye then." Erik stated.

"Don't look too glum... maybe I'll catch you later on..." Goella commented happily.

"Very well. Until we meet again."

The two then went their seperate ways, Erik going back toward the road, and Goella going deeper into the forest. Erik managed to find his way back to the dirt road, and continued along his path toward the Port Town. As he walked off, he failed to take notice of something watching him from behind the cover of the trees. A Half and hour later, as Erik continued his long trek, he suddenly caught sight of something in the forest to his right before it hid behind the tree lines. Whatever it was was a bright white color, which stood out among the green foliage of the forest.

Out of curiousity, Erik carefully stalked towards what he saw, keeping his footing light so not to draw too much attention. He took a turn, and cautiously peered around the tree. What he saw caught him by surprise.

She tall and slender, with pure white skin and fur that would softly cover parts of her body, and long white hair that came down in curls, reaching the arch of her back. The most noticeable parts about her, aside from being in the nude, was that she had cloven hooves where her feet should have been, long pointed ears covered in fure at the tips, a long white tail with a cloud like puff of fur at the end, and black luster eyes with only the twinkling of stars in their abyss. The last feature though was what tipped you off to what she was, for adorned on her forhead was a long, spiralling, straight horn.

"Unicorn..." Erik said in a whisper, trying not to catch the attention of the beauty before him. Currently, she seemed more interested in butterflies that were passing by.

Unicorns were a rarity, even among the monsters of this world. For a human to see one, it was either a sign of Good fortune, or a mark of ill omen. Erik though started to carefully back away toward the road. Though Unicorns were passive in nature, if one caught sight of a human, then depending on the human's own nature would determine how it would react.

If it deemed a human wicked or vile, than it would chase down that human with its horn, and kill them without hesitation, and wouldn't stop until the human was dead. Even more unlikely, if it deemed a human worthy, it was legend it would grant said a gift. Erik though wasn't willing to take that chance.

As Erik was sneaking off, his foot suddenly stepped on a random twig, the snapping of the branch sounding like Thunder in the area. He looked up to see the Unicorn was already a few feet in front of him, her black eyes staring right into him.

How Does she respond?
112311122.title: An Unexpected Encounter

choices: She attacks him, time for a fight
1123111222.title: She does something Unexpected

11231112221.content:
Erik was feeling kind of worried. If the Unicorn decided to engage him, it would be pretty bad. It was said that a Unicorn could stare right into your very soul, and see the person you are at your core. Erik wasn't sure what it was that a Unicorn searches for exactly in a person, but if a Unicorn didn't find said person appealing, they would attack with such ferocity, like a charging bull. Not to mention, Unicorns were fabled to be impossibly fast. With that kind of speed, and the current distance between Erik and the Unicorn, he didn't have very much confidence in being able to fight it. Not that he wanted to mind you, but just an inkling of survival instinct was kicking in, and if fight or flight was needed, he needed to be prepared for the worst.

Erik slowly hovered his hand over the hilt of his wooden sword. This seemed to have a negative effect, as the moment his hand touched his sword, the Unicorn's eyes suddenly went from a beautiful night sky, to a pitch black void. Warning alarms went off inside Erik's head, and he began to draw the wooden sword, but before he even drew it from his back's sling, the Unicorn's form started hazing out, and before Erik even knew it, a great force hit him directly in his chest, and pinned him into the tree behind. A great pain exploded from his chest area, and as he peered down, shock evident on his face, he saw the Unicorn had impaled him right through the chest, more accurately, through his very heart.

This was it... the Quest was finished before it even started.... You didn't even stand a chance... Your vision slowly began to spot at its edges, the light fading from your eyes. The last thought that began to hit you was the thought of Molly, and how you failed her.

Before you died, the Unicorn's voice suddenly spoke, like echoes in a well. 'Make better decisions next time...if there is a next time... ' And then you were no more...
11231112221.title: Way above your current level of strength

choices: Mysterious power? (Will have to figure out later on in the story)
You have the Power of... (Reader's multiple choice)
11231112222.content:
Erik was feeling kind of worried. If the Unicorn decided to engage him, it would be pretty bad. It was said that a Unicorn could stare right into your very soul, and see the person you are at your core. Erik wasn't sure what it was that a Unicorn searches for exactly in a person, but if a Unicorn didn't find said person appealing, they would attack with such ferocity, like a charging bull. Not to mention, Unicorns were fabled to be impossibly fast. With that kind of speed, and the current distance between Erik and the Unicorn, he didn't have very much confidence in being able to fight it. Not that he wanted to mind you, but just an inkling of survival instinct was kicking in, and if fight or flight was needed, he needed to be prepared for the worst.

Erik was about to reach his hand over to the grip of his sword, but suddenly stopped himself. Something was telling him that in this situation, he needed to not show any sign of aggression. That any form of antagonist behavior would be seen negatively, and the Unicorn would attack without hesitation. Erik next considered fleeing, but then he remembered hearing that Unicorns were said to be so fast, that it was considered impossible for a human to outrun one. Besides, another feeling inside was saying any attempt to run could be seen as a provocation for the Unicorn to give chase.

No, what Erik needed to do was to show no hostility, but at the same time, show no fear to this monster. The Unicorn suddenly tipped her head, as if observing Eric in curiosity. She then began to stroll closer to him, her eyes lazily looking to the side, looking at something else for a moment. Erik stood firm, his heart racing a mile a minute. When the Unicorn was standing mere inches from Erik, she turned her gaze back toward Erik, and slowly began to raise her hands towards Erik's face. She lightly cupped her hands on his cheeks, her Midnight eyes gazing deeply into Erik's own.

Suddenly, as Erik gazed into the Celestial bodies that made up her eyes, he suddenly began to see an image forming in the pools of her eyes. Within the image, it displayed Molly and the Village, who were awaiting word from him at home and for his safe return. Continuing to gaze deeper, he saw his early life; happy and joyful times from his early childhood, when he had lost his parents to a monster raid, being taken care of by Molly and her family, her father eventually leaving on the Quest to slay the Witch Queen, to his time training hard to be able to fight with monsters so as to return the land to peace, followed by many other memories.

Then, the next image he bore witness to was one he couldn't recall or remember. It depicted the Witch's castle, and standing before it was an army consisting of not just humans, but monsters as well, and at the forefront of this army, leading them, was a young man bearing a four pointed star shaped mark on his forehead, a sword in hand, a cloak blowing in the wind.

Erik was shaken from the visions when the Unicorn suddenly spoke, her voice sounding like the echoes from a well. "Your journey will be long and arduous... but if you wish to hold the chance to defeat the Witch Queen, you must first travel to the Island of Thanatos... once there, seek out the Labyrinth of Despair, and take claim of the Mystic's Cloak... it will be one of the pieces you will need for victory." Her face inched closer to Erik's, and before she got too close, she stopped, and then leaned her horn down, touching the tip of it to his forehead. "I leave this gift to you..."

You feel a slight burning on your forehead, like a red hot metal brand, and as you look up to see the Unicorn's reaction, you take notice that she is gone from sight, and yet again, you are left alone. You reach up to your forehead, and feel something different. Reaching into your pouch, you manage to pull out a small hand mirror. You look up to your forehead, and see a branded mark had appeared on you brow. The Symbol of which was a diamond shaped four pointed star.

What did she do to you?
11231112222.title: Gift of the Unicorn

choices: Nothing happened and he got to the Port Town without incident
112311122221.content:
As much as you'd like to try and figure out all that just happened, now is really not the best time. After all, you are still a good ways away from getting out of the monster infested forest, and to the safety of the Port Town.

As Erik continued his way down the beaten path, he failed to notice that from behind the tree, the Unicorn watched as he left before vanishing from view.

It was a good 30 minutes of traveling down the roadway, and though Erik could have thought on what the Unicorn did to him, he really had to pay attention to his surroundings to avoid another monster ambush. Though, his mind did wonder about some key terms that she had said... Island of Thanatos... Labrynth of Despair... Mystic's cloak... Erik had heard about the Island of Thanatos... apparently, it was an island full of monsters, and that in some areas, it was so blighted that the very dead actually arise from their graves and shamble about... Hence why it was called the Island of Thanatos... because for a human to go there would be a death sentence... During Erik's walk, his hand would keep raising to his forehead, rubbing the star-shaped mark branded to his head. Whatever the Unicorn did to him will have to be figured out for later...

As Erik continued to travel along the path...

He was ambushed by something else
1123111222212.title: Something Happened...

choices: Accept her tempting offer (Interpret as you see fit)
11231112222122.content:
Erik could finally see signs of the Port Town in the distance, and could even begin to smell the aroma of Salt Water in the air, along with seeing Seagulls flying overhead. It was not much farther now until he was within the safety of the Port. Suddenly, Erik heard the rustling of bushes, and he managed to jump back in time to avoid a sword coming vertically down on him. He looked up, and what he saw made him instantly tense up. Coming out of the bushes were 15 men, dressed in worn garbs of rags and hand me down clothing, some wielding swords, and a couple further back notching Bows and Arrows. Erik knew what now stood before him. Bandits... Highwaymen... Looters... Thieves... however you wanted to label them, it was obvious they were attacking to steal Erik's possessions. Erik then took notice of something that each of these men shared. They bore bands or bandannas with the same mark on the imprint. A wilting Rose.

"Oi!" Started the bandit that attacked you, speaking in a very rough voice, "That was quite the display of dodgin' ya got there Kid... But considering ya only have a wooden sword... and there be 15 of us and one of you... I'd say ya best option would be to hand over ya valuables... In this here area, there be a toll for passage to the Port Town... Courtesy of the Rose-Thorn Gang..."

Erik gripped his wooden sword tightly, more preparing to hit and run than to try a direct confrontation. Observing the situation, ten of these men were armed with swords and other lethal close range weapons, while five further back were notching their arrows, all of them aimed directly towards him. It was not the best case scenario.

But you can't afford to hand over anything, mainly because who knows how much these rogues might take, and also because you packed only the essentials for your quest, and everything you have is crucial for your journey. That, and you really didn't want to end up wandering into town with nothing on hand. But what to do?

What Eric didn't notice though was that there was a figure hidden in the brush among the bandits, and as the figure's gaze observed Erik, their eyes caught sight of the Star shaped mark on his forehead.

"Hold up a sec boys!" A feminine voice suddenly spoke up, catching Erik's attention, as well as the other bandits. Suddenly, a dark skinned woman dressed in blue silk and black leather tights, and also wearing a dark blue cloth wrapped around her head hiding her identity, had walked out of the cover of the brush. Erik took notice that the cloth wrapped around her head bore the same symbol as the other members of the Rose-Thorn Gang. It was hard to tell, but it looked like she was examining you with her eyes, more than likely evaluating what you had. She then began to speak again, her voice haughty, yet slightly serene.

"If I had to guess... This drip probably just started out today... meaning he probably doesn't have much of value on him..." This caused some of the bandits to bare a look of disappointment. "However... it would not do to leave this young man unscathed... isn't that right boys?"

The Bandits cheered in agreement, someone even yelling out, "Yeah, yur right Boss!"

She soaked in the praise of her men, and then returned her attention back to Erik. "So then, boy... How do you propose we settle this? Since you are going into the port, I will assume you have something valuable... perhaps a purse full of gold might make things worth our while..."

That option was definitely out of the question... you need that gold not only for a new sword, but also for lodgings tonight, supplies for the trip, and to charter a boat to get to wherever you needed to go...

"Or perhaps you'd like to challenge one of my men to a one on one duel... we will only take a portion of your gold, IF you can defeat an opponent of my choosing... but if you happen to die, we will just pick your carcass of everything you own..."

Well, that option would be more preferable... you could probably beat one of these thugs mono e mono, and with them only taking a portion of your gold, you could probably still have enough to purchase everything you might need... though, you might have to skimp on the sword and inn... However... this woman seemed awfully confident to put a potential pay off on the line... You looked around at all the men in the area... you could probably take any of them on one on one... did she mean herself then?

Suddenly, she then stepped closer to you, and began to speak in a sultry whisper, lightly breathing into your ear. "Or for option 3, you could offer me something else in exchange for your safe passage, free of charge, if you know what I mean?" As she said this, hers peered downward, her index finger suddenly running down your chest, her finger leaving once it reached your waist.

Wait? Was she hitting on you? Hm... well, considering the men she is associated with, You guess you couldn't blame her... but do you really have such little pride, that you'd sell your body to this woman just so you wouldn't have to pay a cent? Well, considering that despite her being a Bandit, she was very easy on the eyes... with those sultry curves, firm rear, plump breasts the size of Honey dew melons... It could be worse... But still, what kind of hero would yield so easily?

What to do...?
11231112222122.title: A Rose by any other Name...

112311122221221.content:
"I'll accept the terms, and will duel with your champion!" Erik declared.

The woman, for her part, suddenly looked dejected and disappointed. She then let out an annoyed sigh, shook her head, and whispered in Erik's ear. "You should have gone for Option 3... it would have been well worth your time... but if you really want to play the hero... fine!" She then turned to the group of brigands. "Hey Jumbo! Get out here!" Her men let out a cheer after hearing that.

Wait... Jumbo?

Suddenly, your ears catch the sound clanking metal and heavy footfalls, and from behind a tree line, a massive eight foot man comes stomping out, covered head to toe in a battered suit of armor, only his arms and the areas on his legs exposed with some armor on the knees, but from that little much exposed, you could tell this man was incredibly muscle bound. Hoisted on his shoulder, he held aloft a massive battle ax that from the sheer size of the ax's head, could cleave your whole body half, vertically and/or horizontally. The massive armored man let off a slight growl in Erik's direction.

Erik's jaw opened in surprise, and though the woman was wearing a wrap masking her appearance, he could tell she was smugly smirking just from her tone of voice. "Hero, meet Jumbo... Jumbo, potential loot-able carcass... I'd accept it if you changed your mind... however, I'll only accept option 1 at this point..." and then her voice began to mutter to herself and whine. "Not choosing option 3 slightly stung a bit... damn heroes and their idiotic bravery... I can't even get a good lay anymore..."

As mentioned before, Erik couldn't afford to go with option 1... not unless he was willing to live like a hobo for the next couple weeks in the Port Town. No, he was on a quest, and it wouldn't wait for him to waste such time. Re-steeling his resolve, Erik drew his wooden sword, getting himself into a fighting stance.

"Alright... your funeral... Jumbo! Try to make it quick... I don't want any valuables getting covered in too much blood..." The woman stated, walking away from Erik, getting cleared from the duel about to commence.

Alright, the situation seems pretty bleak. The man in front of you not only had bulking strength, a massive ax, and armor covering the vital parts of his body, and you only had a wooden sword, there might still be a chance. With all that heavy armor, and the massive ax, his movement and attacks will be easily telegraphed, and should give you ample opportunity to maneuver and move. Your body had recovered enough from fighting the Slime earlier, and though you were still slightly scuffed up from said fight, all you had to do for this fight was probe his defenses for weak points.

Without warning, the fight began, Jumbo charging for you with ax raised high, moving quite fast for a man his size. Regardless, his speed wouldn't be able to match yours. Swinging his ax down, you roll to the side to avoid, and then take this opening to charge forward, taking a strike at one of his exposed portions of his leg, striking at his left calf. It seemed to jar the man, but not enough to stop him as he began to lift the massive ax again, stepping his other leg toward you to reposition himself to swing the ax horizontally at you. This maneuver was easily telegraphed, and you could tell that by the sheer weight of the ax that trying to swing the ax with one hand and to move his arm across his own body to hit you was very awkward and as a result, lacked the force, speed, and power behind the swing. You easily duck under the attack, and strike him at his left leg again. One of the greatest of human weaknesses was the fact that during a fight, humans greatly rely on their legs for maneuvering, and using momentum to put force into one's attacks. Without the legs, a human would be a sitting target with limited attacking capability. If you repeat damage to the same area, you may wear him down enough where he won't be able to maneuver anymore.

Jumbo stumbles a bit from that strike, but from the tensing in his arm muscles, you could tell he was about swing the ax again, this time from a position where the force of the ax will come faster and harder. You have to move quick. With haste, you lean your full body back, barely avoiding the backhanded swing of the ax. Just as you were about to make your next move, Jumbo's other arm suddenly launches out and manages to get a hold of your right shoulder, restraining your sword arm. Shit! You were so focused on his ax, you forgot about the unarmed hand.

What can you do? You could try to switch your wooden sword to your left and strike at the opposing arm. Or you could try striking at his armored head and hope you disorient him enough to let go.
112311122221221.title: Wait... Jumbo?

1123111222212211.content:
Acting quickly, Erik reached his left hand to his sword hand, grasping the wooden sword, and then with as much force as he could deliver. This resulted in the wooden sword breaking on Jumbo's thick muscular arm. Before Erik could think of anything else to do to get out of this situation, Jumbo had his ax all set and ready to come down on Erik's unable to move form.

The last thing Erik perceived was the biting steel of the ax coming down on his skull, splitting his head like a knife through a watermelon...

Whelp, seems Erik lacked the strength to overpower the Bandits... guess this is the end... unless you want to go back and try again?
1123111222212211.title: Strike the Arm

choices: Directly engage, wearing her down with bug bites
Goat her some more, and make a Beeline for it
112312.content:
'If I can't even beat a simple Slime right here and now, as I am... Then how could I ever hope to face against the Witch Queen? This is about more than survival now...' His mind then thinks back to Molly. 'If anything, she is waiting for me... I have to move forward and win... I will not be stopped here.'

The Slime at that moment began to make her move, stalking closer to Erik's position.

With goal set in mind, you take one last breath to prepare for your next action. "Hey now... you don't have to eat me..." You start, catching the Slime's attention, her expression thinking your trying to beg for your life. "In fact... if you spared me, I could take you to the bar, and buy you a drink... how does a... Lemon sLime sound to you?" This comment caught her slightly off guard. Okay, not the greatest pun. In fact, it was probably cringe worthy. But considering that your life is on the line, a bad pun is better than nothing at all. Plus, she definitely wasn't expecting her victim to be joking at a time like this.

The left side of her face jiggled in a manner that resembled her eye twitching, and her expression was one of annoyance. "I don't think you get the gravity of the situation human... either that, or you're a dumbass... I'm going to play with you in a manner that will make you suffer... and then I'm going to swallow you whole."

Alright, good, she's getting mad, but not mad enough. Time to press it some more. "Oh come on... I've heard you Slimes like to have a 'Goo' time!" If Molly was here, she'd probably scold me for abusing the English language. Granted, the bad puns were having the right effect, as the Slime girl's entire body was starting to jiggle and vibrate from her annoyance.

"You know what? I'm done talking to you human..." She then transformed her arms into a whip like tendril, and began to lash them out toward you.

You back pedal a bit, making sure to keep your distance out of the range of her whips. Alright, she's angry and on the offensive. That's good. Just got to keep dodging her attacks, and force her to overextend herself.

Perhaps Erik could do something to hasten the process. He could draw his wooden sword, and slash at the Slime's whips, cutting them off. At this range, they'd be stretched out and easier to cut through. Granted, this might put him at more risk, since he'll be directly fighting against her, and dodging simultaneously, splitting his focus, and not to mention the Slime proved to be smart, so whose to say she won't change tactics?

Another thing Erik could do is try to goat her into chasing him and launching projectiles. Slimes may be fast up close, but have one trying to chase a target, and they are not known for being great sprinters. Not to mention, Erik would have the cover of the trees to help in avoiding said ranged attacks. However, if a single shot manages to hit Erik, the slime will hinder his movements, and he'll be caught.

Erik swerved under a horizontal whip attack, barely avoiding the tendril by an inch. Whatever he does next, he better do it soon, because his stamina may not hold out by the time the Slime would start to tire.

Until your foot slips on the slmie that landed in front of you and you tumble across the floor. Before you can pick yourself up, the slime girl jumps on top of you, landing with a splat. 1132.content:
You give in to your fate, a defeatist to the end. The slime girl pulls off your armor and smiles devilishly.
"I'm going to take your fluids!" The slime girl said.
Holding you down, she molded one of her arms into a tentacle, which she slammed into your face. You could feel her slime permeating every hole in your head, your mouth, your nose, your ears, all of them. Slowly, she absorbed the moisture from your face. That was really uncomfortable, but it was nothing compared to what she did with her other hand...

The slime girl molded her other hand into a two pronged tentacle. She ripped off your pants and went to work. One of her tentacles went right into your ass. You screamed loudly as she violated your virgin butthole, drying it out with every passing second. The second prong of her tentacle went into... your penis. The thin prong went down and sucked your urine right from your bladder. It hurt like nothing you had felt before. Then, when she was done with that, she bent her head down and sucked your now erect cock.
"Curse you, boner!" You screamed. This was no time to be excited like that.
The slime girl didn't have to suck long to get that juicy, white fluid out of you. Too much masturbation back at home meant you came without much provocation. When she was done, the slime girl slowly moved off of you to admire your dry, but still breathing body. She giggled.

"That was fun! Since you were so nice and didn't fight back, I'll let you live, okay?" She said. You just sat there covered in slime gasping for air. The slime girl wandered off humming a merry tune to herself.

After catching your breath, you stood up. Now you had no armor and no pants. This just wasn't your day. Also, you were incredibly thirsty. Slowly, weakly, you crawled along the road wishing for water.

...

Several hours later, when you felt ready to give up and die, luck turned in your favor. A passing merchant noticed you on the road.
"Good heavens! What happened to your pants? And why are you covered in slime?" He said, dismounting his horse.
"Water! Do... you... have.. water?" You gasped.
"Yeah, I got some! Give me second!" The merchant said.
He reached into his saddlebag and pulled out a canteen. You desperately drank as much as you could.
"Thank you! I was attacked by a slime girl and she sucked me dry!" You said.
The merchant looked at your wooden sword.
"Oh, yeah, you can't just go out here with only a wooden sword. You're lucky you survived. You could've been eaten! Say... You interested in buying a sword off of me?" The merchant said.
You got out your coin bag.
"I have some gold." You say.
The merchant snatched it out of your hand and gave you a bronze broadsword.
"You had just enough for it." He said, smiling.
"Don't you have anything a little cheaper? I still need to buy food and pants eventually." You said.
"Hey, I saved your life. You owe me one, so you buy that sword, you got it?" The merchant said.
You looked the sword over.
"It's not cursed or something, is it?" You said.
"Heavens, no! It's just that nobody wants to buy it because it's so expensive. Now, if you're willing to part with those boots, I can let you have my spare pair of pants!" The merchant said.
"Forget it." You said.
You just walked off. Pants or no pants, you would continue your quest. This merchant just wanted to take advantage of you. At least you had a decent sword now...

Eventually, you came to a small hamlet on the edge of a meadow.

You started hitting her with your wooden sword. You managed to splat her all over the floor with a few swings. Thinking you won, you smiled and flexed your muscles, until, to your horror, the slime girl reconstructed herself, and now she was pissed off!

You took a few more swings at the slime girl, but she avoided them. Then, she grabbed and dramatically snapped your wooden sword in two. You tried punching her, but she backed away and made a running leap right at your face. The slime girl dove at you and stuffed her entire body down your throat. You stood there confused for a moment.

Then, you felt a terrible pain in your stomach. Then it hit you: The slime girl was going to tear you apart from the inside!

The slime girl pushed and punched at the lining of your stomach. You felt a hole punch through and painful stomach acid poured over the inside of your body cavity. You doubled over in pain.
"OH! OH GOD! OH GOD HELP ME!" You screamed out.
The slime girl smashed through you intestines and crunched your kidneys like a couple of tin cans. You thought about your broken promise to Molly back at home.
"Oh, Molly. I'm so sorry Molly." You whispered.
The slime girl did her final blow. With all the force she could muster, she pushed her way out of your body and burst out of your belly. Your wrecked insides dangled from out form the massive hole she tore. You were killed instantly.

12.content:
A slender woman hopped onto the road. She had short messy brown hair and wide yellow eyes. From her knees to her ankles, her elbows to her wrists, her waist and her chest were covered with chocolate brown fur. On her head were two floppy rabbit ears.

When she notices you, she comes to an abrupt halt. Her wide eyes stare intently at you.

You hear a loud humming as you awaken, and as your eyes ease their way open, you see dozens of vibrating shapes in the air before you.

You hear a familiar, somewhat high-pitched, voice call out "that's the one!"

The vibrating shapes in front of you solidify into the figures of a few dozen tiny fairies.

You recognize the fairy in front from the day before. She's pointing at you with an accusatory expression on her face.

You hear the other fairies muttering ominously...

"...squeezed her so hard it left bruises..."

"...she was just trying to play..."

"...such a brute!"

Before you have a chance to argue your point, the fairies swarm onto you.

They're stronger than you would expect for their size, and with a group effort, manage to pick you up and slam your back up against a tree.

The mob of fairies buzzes around you busily, and you feel something tightening around your arms and body; looking down, you can see you've been tied to the tree with a thick vine.

The fairy from earlier hovers up in front of your face in a triumphant pose, tiny chest puffed up in pride.

"Nearly squeezing me to death after all I did was play around a bit! Let's see how you like getting picked on!"

She halts her tirade to smile at you, a rather evil look in her eyes. "Yea! I'm going to bully you today until you cry as much as I did yesterday! Get him!"

Several of the other fairies swoop down and, with a well-coordinated effort yank your pants away, leaving you naked from the waist down.

Fairies flit about around your legs, some going up your shirt, all of them playfully pinching and prodding you without a hint of restraint.

You also feel the weight of a fairy settle onto each of your testicles. At a signal from the fairy in front of you, they both hug the ball they're resting on as hard as they can, sending pain shooting through your body.

You gasp in pain, and the two fairies both relax their grips after only a second or two.

The original fairy in front of your face smiles wickedly at you, the power she has over you seemingly going straight to her head.

"Hahaha! Your face went all funny like thiiis," she makes an exaggerated grimace, mocking you.

"You didn't start crying yet though, so...again!" The fairies on your balls squeeze, but, better prepared, you manage to hold back from gasping this time, keeping your face as impassive as you can.

Not getting the reaction she wanted, the fairy cries out imperiously, "harder!", prompting the fairies on your balls to squeeze even harder than before.

The fairies hanging out all over your body start biting and pinching at you as well, not drawing any blood, but hurting quite a bit.

You can't hold back a wince and a gasp of pain, which the fairy drinks in, gloating smugly.

"Hey! Stick your tongue out, I want something to stand on while I wait for you to start crying!"

As you lay there crying from the torture these fairies were inflicting on you, it came as a great relief when all of these cruel fairies flew away from your body and began hovering side by side in front of you. You were desperately hoping that they would have mercy on you and leave you in peace now that they had successfully made you break down into tears.

Unfortunately for you, the cruel games of these sadistic fairies were only just beginning. When they all began giggling mischievously at the same time, you knew that your suffering was about to get worse. The lead fairy who had just moments ago been standing atop your tongue saw the fear on your face and began to laugh before sticking out her own tiny tongue at you.

"I hope you enjoyed your little appetizer, human, because we're going to be having a lot more fun together from now on. Now that we've gotten that out of the way, let's get started with the main course, shall we?" The lead fairy said with a teasing wink.

And with that, all of the fairy flew toward you and formed a circle around your head. Linking hands, the ring of fairies began to slowly rotate around your head. At first they did nothing but laugh at your humiliation and suffering, but once the leader made her second pass in front of your face, she held her open palm in front of her mouth and revealed it to be full of a mysterious glowing rainbow-colored dust.

Before you could say a word, the fairy blew this dust directly into your face. As the cloud of powder splashed against your face, you began to feel a strange tingling throughout your entire body. At first you didn't understand what was going on, but then you noticed that everything around you seemed to get ever so slightly larger. No. That wasn't it. You were getting shorter. That little puff of fairy dust had just shaved a full inch off your height. An expression of intense fear filled your face as you realized what was going on. Stifling a laugh from how pathetic you looked, the fairy leader gestured to her sisters to come take a look as well. Once again all of the fairies gathered in front of your face and, upon seeing the pathetic look on your face, began to laugh hysterically.

"Awww, what's the matter human?" one of the fairies asked.

"Yeah, we're just going to have a little fun with you." another one followed up.

"Hehe... Emphasis on little!" a third fairy joked.

And with that, the fairies returned to their ring formation and began circling your head once again. This time every time a fairy passed in front of your face she would blow a cloud of fairy dust onto you to shrink you more, and every fairy that passed behind your head took the opportunity to kick you in the back of the head with her tiny but surprisingly powerful feet. The fairies all giggled sadistically as they watched your size dwindle away, all while enjoying the expressions that were generated by their sisters' increasingly painful kicks.

At first the fairies' kicks weren't that bad, just a minor pain in the back of your head. However, the smaller you got, the more these kicks began to seriously hurt you. Eventually you were crying in agony once again, begging for them to stop, but they just shook their heads and continued their torture. This went on for what felt like an eternity. One fairy was always in front of you blowing shrinking dust into your face, another one was always behind you kicking the back of your head with all her might, and throughout all of this all the fairies in between those two were constantly laughing and taunting you.

Eventually you shrunk so small that the vines the fairies had tied you up with slipped right off, but even then there was no escape. Before you could even move two of the fairies broke formation and grabbed you tightly by your arms. It was here that you realized something that you had been suspecting for a while now; proportionally to their size, these fairies were significantly stronger than any human would be. Despite their delicate girlish frames and the fact that you were still more than twice their size, their strength was more than enough to hold you in place. Struggle as you might, you couldn't even hope to make them budge. Their arms that were so much smaller than your own had you completely overpowered. The fairies giggled once more as they felt your futile struggles cease, you submitting to their superior strength.

"You probably didn't expect us to be this strong, did you little guy? It must hurt being so weak compared to a cute little fairy." the fairy on your left arm teased, squeezing your arm a little tighter and making you scream from the pain.

"That's just another benefit of fairy magic, buddy. Magic-enhanced strength. Nothing, not even a dragon girl, could match our strength at our size." The fairy on your right arm said as she leaned forward and licked a tear off of your cheek.

"Yeah! If we weren't so small, we would easily be the most powerful monster girls on the planet! I bet not even the Witch Queen herself would be able to stand up to us!" The fairy in front of you said as she blew more shrinking dust into your face.

"Oh well, much fun as it would be to be able to be able to grow and show everyone how much better we fairies are at everything, at least we can shrink down jerks like you and put you in your place when you don't show us the respect we deserve." The fairy behind you said as she kicked your head so hard that you felt like it was about to fall off.

At this point, the fairy leader appeared in front of you once again. This time however, instead of just a pinch of fairy dust in her hand, she held two massive handfuls of the stuff. Your face paled in terror as you saw the amount of dust she was holding before your eyes. If just a little pinch of dust was enough to take an inch off of your height, you didn't even want to know what kind of effect this much dust would have on you. The fairy leader saw your expression and laughed.

"You know you deserve this, right? You brought this upon yourself. None of this would even be happening right now if you hadn't been so mean to me before. You don't get to complain now that the tables have been turned and you're the one getting picked on. You're going to be the plaything of every fairy in this forest for the rest of your life, rather you like it or not. Now... Become a toy for us, human." The leader said as she lifted her hands above your head and poured all of the dust onto you at once.

And just like that, you began to shrink rapidly. Where seconds ago you were twice the size of these fairies, you were now dwindling away until you finally stopped shrinking at...

You finish sometime later, finally happy with your work, and set it down upon the nightstand with the intent of sending it tomorrow. Changing into something comfortable to sleep in, and making sure the door and window were securely locked, you drifted off to sleep in the small bed.

You wake up greeted by...
1213.title: Inn 'n' Out
