The new-day sunlight shining through your window and the noises of activity coming from outside stirred you from your sleep. The bed had been surprisingly pleasant to rest in, and it almost lured you back to sleep with it's comfort, but you willed your groggy self up. You dressed yourself back into your normal (and only) set of clothes, rearmed yourself and gathered the remainder of your things, not forgetting Molly's letter, before leaving.

---

The morning passed as you planned it would: you sent Molly's letter, had managed to grab a decent sword from the armoury for a respectable price, still holding on to your wooden one as well just incase something arose, and were currently slipping through the crowds to the docks with a slight spring in your step.

You could feel the tiniest sense of achievement in your heart that the day had, so far, went so well. All that remained now was to board a ship to Joyeuse, the port city closest to where the capital (and with it, the Witch Queen) rested. If it costs as much as you've heard it would, you should still have plenty of money to spare after you've bought a ticket. Sighing slightly while recalling some of your many dreams of slaying the evil queen and becoming a great hero, you hoped the rest of your journey went as well as it had so far.

Drawing closer to port, you notice a rather large group of (what you believed to be) adventurers like yourself has gathered outside a large, old and prestigious church. Curiosity getting the better of you, you take a small detour from your registered path and walk up to the crowd.

"Excuse me." You manage to get the attention of a girl about your age with long golden hair "What are you guys doing?"

The girl turns to face you completely, her amber eyes accompanying the bright smile she gives you "Haven't you heard?"

"Uh..." You don't think you would be asking if you did "No, I haven't."

"The mayor's giving a huge reward for getting rid of a monster girl that's held up in the old place." She glances over her shoulder and points to the church "But, from what we've gathered, she's a real tough one. So we're gonna take her together and split the reward. It's so much money you could split it a hundred ways and it'd still make your eyes bulge."

You rest a hand on your chin "Do you know how she got in the church in the first place?"

She shrugs "Beats me honestly." She retrieves her spear from it's position of leaning against a wall "I just want some money and a good fight!" Her smile gains a cocky layer to it and fire flares in her eyes "You wanna join us?"

The promise of money is certainly enticing, and the chance to fight a strong monster girl, with the help of others, would definitely give you some experience for when you'd probably have to fight one solo. But it could possibly take all day, so you might have to get another inn room tonight and put your voyage on hold for a few days.

"Eric." You respond and shake her hand, a small smile on your face "Until we meet again, Jeanne."

"Until we meet again..." She softly parrots those words, and waves you off as the head towards the docks.

Small clusters of citizens stand a step away, each individual listening to the conversation taking place past the row of bodies and forming their own stories. With your old friend curiosity tickling your nose, you find a suitable spot and push onto your tiptoes to see over the line.

Mermaids, armoured in designs you've never seen before, float in tight formations around the piers. A large, sharply dressed bear-of-a-man stands the closest to the water, before a particularly viscous looking shark mermaid. It's easy to guess these are the two arguing.

"You can't just cut off our main trade routes! You'll run everyone here into the ground! Or worse: under it!" The man tugs on his neatly trimmed facial hair as he continues squabbling with the monster girl.

The hag on your kingdom's throne's played 'er part, now ya play yers and we'll be gone, simple as!" She crosses her arms defiantly.

The man, who you've figured is the mayor, groans before starting up the anger-filled conversation again, riling up the shark mermaid again by doing so. Tired, you shuffle forward and tap on of the guards on the shoulder.

"What's going on here?" You whisper. The man turns his head to catch a look at you, but this body stays firmly in position.

"Apparently, a group of monster girls stole something important from the Sea Ruler, so her army's looking for their hides. She made an agreement with the Witch Queen to find the thieves, and it seems that their ships been found here so..." He turns his head back to the docks, but continues on "Queen's forces will catch them if they leave the city by land and the Ruler's will catch them if by sea, but they want them found as quickly as possible. Most of the able people are trying to get that other monster girl out the church, and us guards of got to keep an eye on the Queen's and Ruler's groups, so there's no one to really look for -."

"I'll do it." You cut him off quickly. You can't leave until this mess is cleared it seems, so you may as well do something useful.

You unwrap it, revealing it's a wanted poster. "The captain o' those stupid thieves: Elizabeth! She's a dog girl. Bring 'er, or anyone from 'er crew if the find 'em, here and the reward's yers." You finish scanning the image on the poster and return your sights to the shark girl, just in time to catch her checking you out. She gives a seductive look when her eyes meet yours again.

The Ultimate Monster Girl and you are defeated and captured.
1213112212112113232.content:
The grind of gears filled the arena as all the gates opened at once. The Ultimate Monster Girl was intercepted before she reached her creator by a Lamia with two sets of leathery wings. The two unnatural Monster Girls crashed into the arena floor as your ally struggled to get free from the coils of her ambusher.

Before you could try and help, you were rushed by another experiment: a Cat Girl whose arms had been replaced by the giant limbs of a grizzly. She wore a dazed expression as drool slipped out of her mouth. With a heavy handed swing, she sent you flying across the battlefield.

Your unwanted flight sent you skidding across the ground. You stopped in front of a Centaur, whose horse legs had been replace with rabbit legs. She immediately reared back and tried to stomp on your face with her soft feet. You managed to roll out of the way in time and quickly scrambled to stand.

A croak drew your attention skyward. The source was a modified Frog Girl who leapt into the air. At the peak of her jump, her ass inflated, tripling in size. Her big bubble butt was heading straight for you!

You blindly dove out of the way and collided with a wall of firm yet soft flesh. The impact knocked you on your ass. You looked up to see a massive pair of breasts. The titanic tits were so large that you couldn't even look past them to see the woman they were attached to.

You let out a nervous gulp as the released experiments surrounded you. "That's it, babies! Fuck him good for momma!" Dr. Kiss and Cum cheered at the scene.
1213112212112113232.title: The doctor releases all her remaining experimen...

choices: In the enclosure of another experiment!
12131122121121132321.content:
Still struggling within the winged Lamia’s coils, the Ultimate Monster Girl heard you let out a panicked yelp. She looked to see a pair of gargantuan knockers slam themselves atop you, trapping you between them with only your head and feet still exposed. Her eyes widened in fear as she watched the other experiments close in on their captured prey.

“No… Don’t…!” She cried, a weak and desperate plea. The other Monster Girls either didn’t hear her or didn’t care, as leaned down to assault what they could of the boy, hungrily lapping and licking away at the exposed flesh. You could only let out a muffled whimper as the owner of the mighty mounds encasing you – revealed to be a cow girl with three long tongues – forced her slimy organs into your mouth.

The Lamia let out a hissy laugh in her ear. “Sssssshush, you traitor. This is what you two get for trying to betray the master. Now be a good girl and watch. Then, maybe, the master will let you have a turn with him… after I’m through with him, of coursssssse!” With another sadistic laugh, the Lamia squeezed her captive tighter, electing a gasp of pain from the ensnared girl. Then she cast her gaze towards the pile of lustful monsters. Stupid creatures, of far lower intelligence than her, they couldn’t figure out how to get to the rest of boy’s body submerged beneath cow’s tits, all of them too greedy and overwhelmed with primal desire to get the cow girl off. If she was lucky, she would end up being the first to take his virginity. She licked her lips at the thought.

“I… said…”

Snake eyes flung back to her captive, head down and limp within her coils. “What wassssss that?”

Her head shot up, her wild green hair flung sharply with the movement, and her eyes snapped open into a glare of pure, unfettered rage.

“I… said… DOOOOOOOONN’T!”

It was piercing scream that sent the Lamia reeling, a sonic blast that tore its way painfully into her eardrums. Coils came undone as the Lamia flung herself away, wings clamped over her ears as she tried to stop the pain assaulting her head.

Free from her bindings, the Ultimate Monster Girl turned her raging voice towards the group atop you. She knew it would hurt you as well, but she needed to act fast before the Lamia recovered. You closed your eyes and braced yourself as the noise drilled into your skull and the skulls of your attackers. The crowd quickly dispersed as the sound bore down upon them.

All, except for the cow girl, who was stuck, unable to lift up her unbearably heavy breasts. The Ultimate Monster Girl helped her out.

By kicking her in the face, sending her careening off you and across the arena.

The undeniably soft weight lifted off you, you open your eyes. You can’t hear anything but a sharp ringing, but you can clearly see your partner above, tears streaming down her face as she keeps saying something. Slowly, the ringing fades, and you can hear her loud and clear.

“Sorry… Sorry…!” Is what she softly cries.

You simply smiled up at her. “It, ah… It’s okay…” You say, and rest a hand comfortingly on her wing. She smiled back down happily at you.

Then came grunts from the other monster girls in the arena. They were beginning to rise to their feet (or tails) as they recovered from the ringing as well.

“Let’s… get out of here.” You weakly say.

The Ultimate Monster Girl nods and, after placing you on her back, with her fox tail curled around you for extra safety, takes flight. This time, her target is not Dr. Kiss and Cum, who is still recovering from the sonic scream, but a window at the opposite end of the arena. She soars towards it, bunny legs primed into into a drop kick, and the…

CRASH!

Is the first thing Dr. Kiss and Cum hears once the ringing has subsided. She glances towards to source of the noise, eyes widening as she finds a broken window. Anger swells in her heart. “What was I thinking giving her the ability to sonic scream?”

“Get them, my darlings!” She screams towards her experiments below, and points towards the broken window. “Don’t let them escape!”

---

Through the mansion halls, the Ultimate Monster Girl sprints through corridor after corridor. That paining looks familiar. Hadn’t she just been down this way? Her bunny legs might let her go fast and far, but they’re no help with not getting lost.

“T-There!” You say, pointing to the giant window at the end of the next hall. “That looks like it leads outside!”

Your companion nods, and takes off down it. In only a few seconds, the distance was closed, and after another powerful drop kick, the pair of you find yourselves…
12131122121121132321.title: Screaming & Escaping

choices: Tell her to fly through the ghastly gang of Ghost Girls.
Tell her to charge through the innumerable Zombie Girl Horde.
Too late! The other experimments have caught up.
121311221211211323211.content:
Looks like you had made the right choice. You breathed in the fresh air of the haunted graveyard as a lone beam of sunlight pierced through the dark clouds to give you a gentle caress.

"Free..." The Ultimate Monster Girl muttered as a single tear trailed down he face.

Of course, it wouldn't be that easy.

"Down!" You yelled as a sudden chill raced up your spine. Your companion dives out of the air without question and is rewarded by the feeling of a spectral hand grazing her.

You look up as your partner lands to see a group of floating women, pale as moonlight. You couldn't get an accurate count as they faded in and out of view.

A chorus of moans drew your attention back to ground level. The horde of Zombie Girls that chased you earlier was still there and their numbers seemed larger then ever. Looks like the Ultimate Monster Girl's shriek had been loud enough to wake the dead.

Behind you, you could hear the thundering stampede of the other experiments as the chased after you.

Your companion looked over her shoulder at you; her eye where filled with a mix of fear and confusion. "What... do?" She whimpered.
121311221211211323211.title: Outside the mansion!

choices: “I’ll take you to them. You can meet my perfect creation!”
“I think I’ll keep you as another test subject!”
12131122121122.content:
Clearly someone not human, since the hand is an unnaturally light pink. Despite it’s lithe frame, it’s a lot stronger then you are, as it refuses to budge even when you tug at it with both hands. It’s aroma infiltrates your nose, a very sweet smells that reminds you of… gum?

“My, my!” An excited voice whispers in your ear. “It’s been so long since a human’s visited this old house; let alone a human male!” You shiver at how she emphasizes your sex. You’re thankfully that she hasn’t tried touching you down there. Yet. “What brings you- oh!” She realizes the futility in questioning you right now. “Silly me! Just let me fix that…” Her hand detaches from your face and hovers downwards, coming to a stop an inch away from your Adam’s apple. It’s obviously a warning not to do anything you’d regret. “What brings you here?”

Taking a breath to steady yourself, you manage to piece together that the Monster Girl is probably a Gum Girl. Gum Girls were a sub-species of Slime Girls who, at the cost of being slower when it came to moving and shifting shape, were made of a much tougher and stickier substance while also being far more resistance to magic. Tales of gigantic Gum Girls told of entire cities and countless people easily being swallowed up in their viscous bodies, never to be seen again, as they giggled all the while.

With sword alone, you highly doubt you could possibly take her, especially when she’s already glued to your back. Might as well explain why you’re here and try stalling for a chance to escape. Maybe she might actually be nice and help you out?

“I’m looking… for Captain Elizabeth…” You answer, trying your best to sound unafraid.

Your captor hums. You presume it’s in thought, but the finger caressing your throat and ghostly feeling of a hungry gaze creeping down your back is making you very unsure.

Gotta keep her on topic. “She’s a pirate… and a dog girl.”

“Oh!” The Gum Girl seems to remember now. “That rude girl and her group who so violently intruded! Yes, they’re here. My pet is currently dealing with those vandals.”

Pet? Does she mean the so-called Ultimate Monster Girl the book was talking about? Is she the one who wrote it? Then she’s-

Suddenly, your entire back is engulfed in her sticky warmth, and before you the top half of the Goo Girl enters your sight as she morphs to loom over you. Her “hair”, a large and long glob of magenta-pink gum, flops down and further obscures your vision of the outside world. Gravity does not seem powerful enough to tug down the Gum Girl’s massive breasts, however, and they remain firmly in place. A surprisingly clean white coat covers her upper body, buttoned up in such a way that exposes as much of her cushiony cleavage as possible. Large, circular glasses are stuck to her eyes, and through the reflective glass you see a simple pair of black eyes staring directly into yours.

Now that you're boxed in on both two sides, as well as above, with your back and sword firmly gripped by a large blob that is her lower half, you're definitely at the Goo Girl’s mercy. The smile on her lips does nothing to nothing to quell your growing fear.
12131122121122.title: Sticky Situation

121311221212.content:
Step by step, you clawed your way up to the door. It took all of you willpower to ignore the hand squeezing your balls. After what felt like an eternity, your goal was in arms reach.

Suddenly, something wet and slimy wrapped around your neck and pulled you back. You tumbled down the steps it took you so long to climb and landed in a heap at the feet of the Zombie Girl Horde. Looking up you see one of them had their intestines in their hands, and you realize that that was what was currently lassoed around your throat.

You clawed at your makeshift collar as you were dragged into the middle of the undead crowd. The severed hand on your crotch was removed and a toothless Zombie Girl head took its place and vigorously began to bite you manhood. The soft gums enthusiastically massaging you manhood were very effective and against your will your released your sperm.

The rest off the hoard took this as signal and dove on you. You preemptively wince as you prepare for them to bite down on you, only for them to not. Instead of taking bites out of your flesh, they began nibbling and sucking on you. Your lips, ears, nipples, fingers; nothing was safe form the Zombie Girl Horde's tender gluttony. Under their toothy assault, you let loose another orgasm.

You were utterly helpless as the Zombie Girl Horde dragged you away. The last thing you were aware of was being thrown into an open grave before you were buried under a pile of rotten female flesh.
121311221212.title: The Zombie Girl Horde catches you.

choices: A shrine maiden diligently guarding the gate.
A shrine maiden beaten and tied to the gate!
121311222.content:
You decided to check out the shrine. You had no way of dealing with ghosts or zombies, no spells or magic to prevent them from possessing you or to make sure they stayed down permanently. A fight with them was not a fight you could see yourself possibly winning. The shrine maidens were a mixed bag, but hopefully, if worst came to worst, they’d be “alive” enough to feel the sting of your sword.

---

It was an old path, the path to shrine. Ancient stones, battered and stained with dirt and time, littered the track alongside the river, the last remaining remnants of the once cherished and holy road of long ago. A few sparse, wrecked pillars occasionally passed you by as you trekked onwards. Most had been reduced to little more than stubs of rock, but some were still standing, looking as if they would crumble in the faintest breeze. A forgotten language decorated these surviving obelisks, but even if you had the ability to understand it, the words had been smudged and worn by the might of the passing years – and the few that had endured had seemingly been scared and scratched, as if something wished they be forgotten as well.

All that seemed untouched by the decay were stone lanterns that split the path and the river from the forest. Each and every one sat alight, nesting within their tops a gentle blue flame. These unnatural flames did not dance nor diminish when the wind rushed across the dusty path, like any normal flame would surely do. They simply burned away contently, oblivious and ignorant to the actions of the world around them. Curious, you brought an open palm close to one of the flames. They radiated heat, just like a normal fire, but seeping into your hand was also a strange, overwhelming feeling of euphoria. It felt good beyond words; so good that you almost wanted to just snuggle up with the lantern and never leave. Thankfully, you snapped yourself out of it, and pulled away from the warmth. You figure these obviously magic flames must part of defense system to keep Monster Girls from attacking anyone intending to visit the shrine. Best not to get too close again – least you end up cuddling with a rock for the rest of your life.

Not that farther ahead, after stomping up a slight incline, you spot a waterfall careening down from a gigantic mountain in the not too distant distance, the source of the river you were following. And below that, a small stone bridge connects the path to a certain large compound: the shrine! Vigor renewed at the sight of your goal, you break into a sprint and speed down the slope.

You stop to catch a quick breath when you reach the bridge. Looking across it, you see a figure at the entrance to the shrine. You ready yourself, wrapping a prepared hand on the handle of your sword, and advance, feeling the cold clack of your shoes against stone with every careful step.

It’s when your halfway over that you can clearly make out what exactly the figure is. They’re…
121311222.title: The Shrine

1213112221.content:
You see a shrine maiden standing guard at the gate. With naginata in hand, you could tell she was ready for a fight if the need arose. Her robes covered most of her body, as well as her face, meaning you weren't able to get a read on exactly what kind of monster you were dealing with here. However, she seemed to be around your size, so there was no risk of her being a giant or ogre.

"Halt. This shrine is a sacred place forbidden to outsiders, state your business." She calls out to you as you get closer.

Well, there goes any prep time to size up a possible opponent. What now? She doesn't seem like she wants a fight, but that could change at a moments notice. You were only here to find Elizabeth, nothing more, so you had no reason to sack the shrine unless you had to. Plus, perhaps the Ryu would respect your quest and give you some form of aid.

Then again, what if they didn't care about your quest? What if they saw you even stepping on this bridge as an act of aggression? Even worse, what if they were harboring Elizabeth in there? If you announced to them that you were here to arrest her, they would have you swarmed and killed on the spot. Maybe it would be best to just attack now.
1213112221.title: A shrine maiden diligently guarding the gate.

choices: “… the pirate has already been dealt with.”
“… I now cannot allow you to leave.”
12131122211.content:
Though, after giving the shrine maiden a once over again, you decided to tell her the truth. Maybe it was because you couldn’t think up a good lie under her piercing gaze. Or maybe it was the way her sharpened blade seemed to cut the very sunlight itself in twain. Whatever it was, it made the chance of being seen through send a dreadful chill down your spine.

Standing up as straight as you possible can, you hold your head high, puff out your chest, take in a deep breath, and begin.

“I’m looking for the pirate captain Elizabeth!” You call out. “The port has been blockaded by soldiers of the Sea Ruler demanding her capture or information of her whereabouts. I cannot leave for Joyeuse because of this, and the longer the town goes without it’s port the longer it will suffer!”

Feeling you need to add a little more oomph to your decree, you politely bow towards the guardian. “All that I humbly request for is any potential knowledge you may have on Captain Elizabeth, so that I may save the town and continue with my travels!”

The maiden was silent for a few choice moments as she absorbed your answer. Then she loudly stamped the dull end of her naginata against the ground.

“You’re honesty is commendable, boy. As is your desire to help those in need.” She said, her voice tinged with clear respect. But as you raised your head to look at her, any happiness burgeoning within you washed away when you noticed a small hint of sadness in her eyes. “But in response to your humble request, I am afraid that…”
12131122211.title: Tell her the truth

choices: "Come into the shrine, we'll help you."
"I'll come with you to back your claims."
121311222111.content:
"I'm afraid to inform you that the pirate Elizabeth has already been dealt with. She and her crew recently tried to overtake this shrine, only to be overwhelmed and killed. The captain's head now decorates the inner walls." The girl calls back. She motions for you to come closer to end this shouting, which you comply to.

Even as you close the distance to her, her robes still conceal any possible features that could help you tell what she was. "That's incredible. An entire pirate crew tries to sack your shrine and you repelled them with no damage to the structure. You lot must be fine warriors to fight together so well." You comment. She laughs as if you had told her the funniest joke she had ever heard.

"You are mistaken, boy. My sisters, nor our master took part in the battle. I fended them all off by myself. No need to trouble our strong with such rabble." Your face goes white and you nearly drop your sword at the thought of not only a single fighter beating off an entire crew's worth of pirates, but that such a warrior isn’t even considered among their strong! You really dodged a bullet by getting on her good side.

"That's incredible. But now I'm not sure what to do about the mermaids. I can't just tell them she was killed by shrine maidens and expect things to go well with no proof." You muse.

"I'll tell you what, boy..."
121311222111.title: “… the pirate has already been dealt with.”

choices: “You will serve the shrine for a week.”
“Deliver this to the mayor of the town up the mountain.”
12131122212.content:
“I have come to pay tribute!” You blurt out. It’s a lie you just made up on the spot, but you can’t risk telling her the truth if she is an ally to Elizabeth.

The shrine maiden’s eyes narrow. “No human has come to pay tribute in over a hundred years. Only the cowardly come now, greedily hungering for riches and flesh, yet turning tail at the slightest hint of trouble.” She exclaims, and loudly stamps her naginata against the ground again. “Why should I expect you to be any different? What is it you seek in exchange for this “tribute”, boy?”

The woman’s intense gaze feels as if it’s melting away your skin. She’s clearly doesn’t believe you, and looks like she’s about to plunge her blade into your chest at any moment. Sweat begins trailing down your brow as your brain flicks into overdrive, frantically struggling to save this situation.

A memory of an earlier time pops forth. You and Molly had stolen some food from her wicked stepmother’s bakery. You hated the idea of stealing even then, but you both had just come back from a hard day of field work, and your family was too poor to afford anything outside of two meals per day, so you made this an exception. And thankfully, whatever guilt you felt hadn’t stopped the cookie from tasting absolutely sublime on your tongue.

As you came down to the last crumb of your cookie, Molly stopped you. “Wait!” She said, and snatched the crumb from your hand. She tossed it and what remained of her’s over the fence, where they were quickly and audibly snapped up a dog. “Now if they ask, we can say the dog ate them!” She proudly proclaimed as if she was the smartest person in the world, with a wink and a flash of that beautiful Molly-smile.

“Remember, the best lies have a little bit of truth in them!”

Back to reality, you swallow down the lump in your throat. “Mer-Mermaids are blocking the port!” You cry out, and drop into a begging position on your hands and knees to add a little more oomph to your plea. “The town will surely suffer without it’s port! I thought that if I came here, I could find a way to make the mermaids leave and save the port! Please, let me pay tribute in exchange for a blessing to drive away the mermaids!”

It was all true what you had just said in your little speech. Mermaids were blocking the port, the town would definitely hurt without it’s main hub of income, you came here to look for Elizabeth as a way to save the port, and if the shrine does per chance hold the power to drive off the mermaids, you’ll pay whatever price tribute costs for it.

From above, you hear the shrine maiden softly sigh. “Very well.” You look up to see her gaze has softened into one much gentler, yet still fairly stern. “If you truly want the shrine’s blessing…”
12131122212.title: The Best Lies

121312.content:
You figure the gains outweighs the losses, and you can wait for another ship.

"Alright, sounds good. I'll help you guys." Your response empowers your new friends smile.

"Awesome! This is gonna be great, I'm sure!" She turns towards her group "Gonna tell Justin you're joining us, so he'll have to change his calculations on everyone's reward cuts. Sure he'll be thrilled at that. Be back soon!" She dashes through the forest of people, and you lose her despite your best efforts not to.

She returns soon though, rubbing her head "Yeah, he's pretty thrilled. Bopped me good!" You thank her with a nod and a smile "Anyway, time for introductions: I'm Jeanne, and you are..?" She extends a open hand.

"Eric." You and her shake "Nice to join you Jeanne."

"Glad to have you, Eric." Releasing you hand, her smile evolves with happiness to show you her teeth "The more the merrier!" She slips a hand into her pouch and pulls forth a scroll "Anyway, we're gonna enter soon so I'd better fill you in on the plan of attack." She unrolls the paper to reveal what appears to be a map of the church. "You're a melee guy, right?"

"Yeah. Was never good with long-ranged weapons..." The bad memories of a younger you trying to use a bow come to mind.

"That's cool. So..." She points to church's front door on the map "You, me and about eight others are going in the front." she moves her finger to a side-entrance "Justin and six more are gonna go in from here and check the second floor. They're archers so elevation is good for them to get a better shoot if she's on the first floor." Finally, she points to a entrance at the back "The rest, about eight people, are gonna check the basement. If they don't find anything, they come up and join our group to check the ground floor." Jeanne wraps the paper back up and tucks it away "If nobody finds her, we all gather on the ground floor and plan again. Sound good?"

"I guess, yeah." Being given the spotlight by going in the front both scares and excites you, but you swallow down the fear.

"Great!" You thing for a second if there's anything in this world that could bring Jeanne's mood down "Let's show this monster girl who's the bosses there!"

---

Time to breach come so soon: everybody's in place, Jeanne flashes you a smile good luck before the front doors are slowly pried apart and you all enter...

To find the monster girl right in the centre of this grand and spacious church, just before the alter.

She's a...
121312.title: A holy place, not a safe one

1213121.content:
A woman stands before the alter. The first thing that catches your eye, and probably the rest of your group's, are the two large bird wings protruding from her back, their pitch-black feathers pushed together in their current furled from. Her short hair, wild and untamed, contrasts against her wings with their snow white colour. The robes decorating her are a mixture of white, yellow and red.

Taking in your foes appearance, it seems no one in your unit knows how to respond to such an enemy, and you all just stay locked in place at your end of the hall. You pass a glance to Jeanne, who is glaring at the angel without a trace of fear in her eyes.

"Have you come to pray, children?" The angel's soft voice snaps your attention back to her as it echoes through the open church.

She turns to you and your group, giving you all a good look at the destroyed alter behind her. A broken sword, it's remaining blade barely that of a dagger's, rests within her left hand. She is certainly shapely and beautiful, but you won't let that cloud your judgement. Her yellow eyes survey her visitors, and when they catch you a chill rides down your spine.

The church's door loudly slams itself shut. There is panic from those closest to it, who scramble to pull the sealed portal open with zero progression.

"I'm afraid your gods will not listen, for they do not love you." The angel turns to face you fully "They do not love anyone but themselves." She begins pacing towards your group, and everyone prepares the best they can for the fight that will soon begin.

The angel's wings are slowly consumed in a shadowy aura, and, before anyone can react, they fling themselves open, sending a magical shockwave speeding across the floor.

It touches you all to quickly: you feel your body lock itself into place, with only your eyes allowed to move and your breathing allowed to continue. You can't do anything about the advancing angel.

"But do not worry..." The angel, wings curled back into their resting positions, comes to a stop before you, and lifts a hand to feel your cheek. Her small smile and gentle voice terrify you to the core "I will listen. And I will love you far more than they ever could."
1213121.title: Cast Out

1213122.content:
A girl is sitting with her back upon the stone alter.

From the messy pink hair atop her head pokes out two red fox ears, and two large red fox tails that prod out from behind her rest upon her lap. She looks to be about the same age as yourself and Jeanne, and her clothes are decorated with cuts and tears, probably from a previous scuffle. Her eyes closed and her breathing gentle, you and your group guess she's asleep and advance.

You get about two steps forward before her eyes burst upon and her head snaps up. Her amber eyes gloss over the group of armed humans before her, meeting your's for a brief moment, before they shrink in fear to go along with the terrified look upon her face.

Her back loses touch with the alter, her tails slowly draw themselves away her lap and your sure you see her muscles tense. You and Jeanne quickly ready yourselves for attack, your group following suit like reflections. The silence that haunts the church hall is deafening.

A bang from upstairs, most likely the archer team, startles your group, and the fox girl takes her chance. She's on her feet in a instant, then springs into the air, backflipping across the alter. The millisecond she hits the floor, landing on her feet perfectly, she dashes to the door on her left and smashes through with amazing strength, speeding off deeper into the church.

It takes you all a few seconds to recover from the monster girl's incredible exit. When you do, most of the group expresses relief that a brawl did not ensue, while Jeanne huffs with disappointment.

"A two-tailed Kitsune? All that money for a two-tailed Kitsune! " She crosses her arms in anger and scowls.

"Shouldn't we be happy?" You tell her "An easy job for a lot of money?"

"No, Erik! It's supposed to be challenging so that we can get stronger!" She responds, tapping the butt of her spear on the floor. You give small nod in agreement. If you didn't get stronger then you'd never reach the Witch Queen.

"Yo, Jeanne!" You and Jeanne are ripped from your little conversation bubble by a new voice from upstairs. Looking to it's source, you see rather built man with a fedora on his head.

"Yeah, Justin?" Jeanne replies to the man.

"Hurry up! We're chasing after her!" Justin hurries out of your sight.

"Well, you heard him folks!" Jeanne raises a hand in the air "Let's go get that fox!" The rest of your group gives a "YEAH!" in response, and you all follow Jeanne as she herself follows the panicked kitsune's small trail of destruction through the church.

Eventually, after many twists and turns and split-ups, it's just you and Jeanne left. You enter a room similar to the first room, but it's much colder and darker. Before you can get the best look around, your partner tackles you into the shadows. She clamps a hand over your move and gestures you be quiet, before letting go and pointing in a direction.

You look and see...
1213122.title: Fox Trail

12132.content:
"Wake up."

You stir slightly, but ultimately your lovely dream of your future acts of heroism and the comfort of your borrowed bed lures you back to sleep with ease.

"Wake up."

Something slams into your cheek, hard, giving off a loud smacking sound and violently forcing you into a half-awake state. Slowly adjusting to the world, you feel a weight on you that wasn't there before, one far too far and concentrated to be your blanket. Your eyes barely grasp the outline of a figure in your room.

"Awake now?"

Recognising the noise that stirred you as the whispers of an intruder, you quickly shake your head to force away the desire of resting. You blink a few times. The unwelcome visitor soon takes form before you, identity illuminated by the midnight moonlight.

It's...
12132.title: Intruder

choices: She takes you away with her
Guards burst in and she flees
121322.content:
A beautiful young woman sits on you, her derriere pressing down on your crotch. She has long, dark blue hair and a blue mask, like one you'd see at a masquerade ball, guarding her eyes from sight. Two cat ears stick out atop her head. She wears a skin-tight suit that covers most of her body, it's colours dark blue, dull green and pale brown.

She tilts her head slightly as you take in her form, her lips curled into a smile, "Have a nice sleep?"

Your mind kicks itself into high gear escape-mode at her little snark, a burst of adrenaline shedding off your tiredness. You try to move, but find your arms and legs tied to the bedposts. You try to scream, but find a gloved hand quickly and firmly clamped over your mouth.

Your desperate and futile attempts to escape earn a quiet giggle from the Cat Girl. She leans forward, bringing her face closer to your's, her average-sized breasts now smushed against your chest.

"I let my target escape for this chance, Erik..." Your eyes widen even more at her words. An assassin? And how does she know your name? She bites her bottom lip softly, then continues, "So I deserve a little teaser taste, right?"

In a swift movement, the seal on your mouth is removed, but before you have the chance to yell, another one in the form of the Cat Girl's soft lips firmly seals it up again. She gives you a long and passionate kiss, her mouth completely dominating your own for a few minutes, before she pulls back with a satisfied smack of her lips and her hand blocks your mouth again.

"Oh yes..." You shiver at how pleased she sounds, "You are so worth it, my dear." Her free hand caresses your cheek, and though you can't see them, you guess there's probably be a loving look in her eyes to match her smile.

She goes in for another kiss, but a commotion outside the door grabs both your attention.

"Already?" The assassin huffs. Whatever's happening out here mustn't be good for her. "Sorry, Erik, we'll just finish this elsewhere, okay?"

She frees your lips, but much to your annoyance she instantly silences you again by shoving a gag into your mouth. Undoing the ropes to trap your arms to the bedposts, she ties you wrists together with amazing strength. She does the same with your legs.

Then...
121322.title: Kitty Assassin

choices: ... talking with a group of hooded figures
... arguing with some strangely dressed people
12133.content:
Moonlight was casting a pale dew upon your room when you awoke, your unconscious mind stirring to reality by the bumps of many feet against the wooden floor and quiet words muffled by the distance coming from below.

'Just leave it, Erik. Go back to sleep." The part of you yearning for rest and dreams whispered in your head. A tempting offer, truly, but the rest of you disagreed completely: curiosity, the very same that had killed the cat, was now scrapping at your heart.

You move as silently as possible getting out of bed, and discarded the notion of changing clothes: you'd make to much noise doing so, and what you wore right now was adequate enough. Picking up your weapon from it's resting place, you slowly and quietly push your room door open, then closed, and creep towards the stairs leading to the inn's ground floor.

The staircase offered your ears a much better reception to the noises as you tiptoed down, steps steady and free hand firmly grasping the railing. It was two voices talking with each other, one your sure was the inn owner and other was definitely new to you, with some third unknowns chipping in every so often. The bumps seemed to have stopped entirely, but you the occasional creaks of the wooden floor as you draw nearer the bottom.

As the stairs end, you quickly nip into the shadow the wall provides against the ground floor's candle light and let your back gently touch it's form.

You carefully peak out to see the inn owner...
12133.title: Bumps in the night

121331.content:
"I take it everything is in place, yes?"

A seductive, yet threatening female voice comes from the hooded figure before the innkeeper. Her dark violet robe covers up most of her body, highlighting her shapely form while also hiding it, and her black cloak seems attached to it solely by the grey fur draped across her shoulders. While her hood guards most of her head from your sight, you can see a small smile on her purple-coated lips, along with a few locks of light blue hair and her pale skin.

Behind her stands six people, each one hidden by a different coloured cloak. You can at least make them all out to be female.

The next one closest to the innkeeper wears a sandy-brown colour, and prodding out from it, at around waist level, is -

- the body of a scorpion. You quietly gulp.

"Yes. I've set up everything like you asked me to." The innkeeper responds, causing the smile on the woman's lovely lips to grow "What do you want me to do now?"

"Oh, simply run this place as you normally would, but be absolutely sure to keep people away from the basement." She waves a hand to the other members of her group, who all proceed to and down a door you guess leads to the basement. Save for the Scorpion Girl, who stands firmly at the her side. "But I guess..." She puts a hand to her chin and is silent for a moment before continuing "... if, perhaps, a decent male who no one would miss were to stay here for the night, could you inform us of him?"

The innkeeper nods in silent obedience, and you see gears turning in his head.

"Good. That will be all. Thank you for all you've done." She concludes and moves herself to the downwards stairs, her right-hand scorpion-woman following behind.

"Master Morgen, wait." The innkeeper's voice stops the two in their tracks. They both turn in your direction to look at him, so you pull your head completely behind the wall as quickly as you. Your sight of them gone, you listen as intensely as you can. "There was a young lad today..."

Your eyes widen.

"Oh?" The voice of the woman, you now know as Morgen, in tinted with curiosity.

"An new adventurer, most likely, considering what he was armed with..." Your fingers scrape into the wall as the innkeeper speaks.

"And what room is this young adventurer staying in?"

The innkeeper gives them a room number. Your room number. 'Oh no...'

"Serket." Morgen must be speaking to the Scorpion Girl now "Go and bring the boy down to us. We'll see if he strikes any of our fancies."

"Sure." Serket's response, and the advancing tapping of her scorpion legs against the floor fills you with so much fear. You gaze around frantically, desperate for anywhere to hide. A Scorpion Girl isn't something even the most experienced monster slayer could take on easily, and you're hardly experienced. Underneath the stairs is the only option you have right now. So you take it: rushing to it and staying as quiet as possible.

The patter of her heading up on the stairs above sends chills down your spine. Eventually they become too quiet to hear, so at least she's away for now. Slowly and quietly, you push back the door and peek out, just in time to see Morgen's back disappear down the to the basement and the innkeeper pass into a back room.

You silently ponder how to go about this.

Going after the innkeeper seems somewhat pointless: he's clearly a small fry compared to the other two.

Leaving was a definite no-go: the inn doors would no doubt be locked, so you'd need to swipe them off the innkeeper or find them, and wasting time doing that when a Scorpion Girl is after you is very unwise. Not to mention the streets at night are crawling with Imps and other Monster Girls: doing all that work just to get molested and raped on the streets is unappealing.

Going down to the basement after Morgen, possibly finding out what she's up to, sounds more productive. But you can't forget that you don't know what she's capable of: she could, and probably would, have many powerful tricks up her sleeves. Not to mention that the rest of the group is also down there, and heaven knows what they're capable of themselves.

Ambushing Serket, if successful, would drop the basement group's numbers down to six, and you won't have to worry about her ambushing you in the basement. But if not, if you fail or she sees you first, it's pretty much over: she'd be on you instantly, and there's not a snowball's chance in hell you'd beat her in a straight fight.

You don't have much time left. You decide to...
121331.title: Group of Problems

1213311.content:
... follow Morgen and head down to the basement.

Cautiously, you push out from your cover and quietly slip across the room. Reaching the top of the basement stairs, you sneak a glance at both the door to the back room and the arch you had just crossed over from. With no current sign of the innkeeper or Serket returning, you start your descent. Hopefully there'd be somewhere to hide at the bottom.

Sinking deeper with each gently step, you find this stairway to be far different than the one that leads upwards. The space struck you first: while the other's stairwell was wide and changed direction along the way, the walls of this one hugged it almost suffocatingly-tight and forced it to stay on a straight path. Next, you found, was the material: cleanly carved wood had met with your feet multiple times on your first descent of the night, but here all you felt beneath your soles was cold stone.

Eventually you see light, signalling the end of this cold descent and the beginning of the basement.

The final step passes under your feet, and you quickly search out a place to hide. All you find is a large wooden box casting a deep shadow from the light, so you take it and dart behind it as safely as you can.

You take a moment to recover, then lightly poke out to see Morgen and three others at a table, just under a lamp embedded in the wall. The one closest to her wears a white coat, while the other two wear a green one and a blue one.

Morgen and the female in the white cloak discuss something you can't hear from this position, but from the look of things, Morgen hardly seems happy with her. You watch them argue from the darkness for a good while, till Morgen finally seems to have had enough and storms off, taking Blue Cloak with her. White Cloak seems to simply shrug before twirling around, wandering off in the opposite direction with Green Cloak in tow.

You figure it'd be best to keep an eye on one pair so they don't ambush you later, and maybe they might even lead you to something important.

So: left, after Morgen and Blue Cloak, or right, after White Cloak and Green Cloak?
1213311.title: Go to the basement

choices: Wait and continue to follow them.
12133111.content:
You decide to follow Morgen and her companion. After all Morgen appears to be the head honcho of this whole operation, so maybe she’ll lead you somewhere important or let some classified information slip.

Quietly you trail the pair through the darkness. Ahead of you Morgen stomps along the stone floor, clearly frustrated over that squabble back there. The figure in the blue cloak makes no effort to keep pace with her and simply follows behind her slowly.

“Damn that brat!” Morgen barks angrily as she comes to stop, allowing her companion to catch up. The witch paces back and forth and nibbles at her thumbnail. “She should have more faith in me. I’m the one you got this plan off the ground!” She huffs and crosses her arms. She reminds you more of a spoiled child than a cunning witch.

“I’ve hit a few snags here and there, sure.” She turns completely towards the wearer of the blue cloak, who has now caught up with her. Though she’s looking in your direction she thankfully doesn’t notice you, both due to the shadows concealing your presence and her attention being focused solely on her companion’s face. “But now…”

Reaching out to the smaller figure, Morgen pulls down her hood. Curly red hair spills out and flops down to her shoulders.

Your eyes widen. No, it can’t be…

Morgen cups the girls chin with one hand and runs a finger along their check with the other. “Now that I’ve got you, my perfect little sacrifice…” You see the witch’s lips curl into a nefarious smile and an evil glint shines through her hidden eyes. “It’s all within our reach!” With her joyous exclamation, she twirls the girl, like they’re dancing. You get a brief look at the girl’s face in the dimly-lit corridor. At a familiar pair of forest green eyes, now surrounded by unnatural purple scleras, and the zombie-like expression on her face.

Your fear is confirmed; it’s Molly, and she’s under the control of some sort of spell.

You grit your teeth. Blood boils with anger and your grip tightens on your wooden sword, threatening to splinter it into pieces. Your soul demands you attack the witch right now. With all her cohorts, you might not get a better chance than this. But your mind intervenes. You have no idea what Morgen is capable of. What possible good could a wooden sword do against her? What if she puts you under the same spell as Molly with a snap of her fingers? What if she uses Molly as a human shield and you accidentally hurt her?

The pair begins moving again. Do you attack, or continue to follow?
12133111.title: A Familiar Face

choices: … obeys and turns you into a strawberry.

121331111.content:
You rush out from the shadows, planning to knock the witch out by smashing her head into the stone wall.

Morgen easily hears your feet slamming onto the hard ground and quickly whips around. She points a finger directly at you, and from it a dark purple beam shoots out towards you. You block it with your wooden sword, which starts to glow and shrink into something smaller under the effects of the spell. You toss it aside and charge on, managing to close the distance before the surprised witch could fire off another one. Grabbing her face, you use all your force and momentum to push her against the wall.

Her head makes contact with a sickening crack! But it’s not enough to knock her unconscious. “Y-you!” Morgen snarls like a wild animal. “YOOOUUU!” She tries to aim at you again but the impact has made her delirious, giving you enough time to pin the taller woman and her arms to the wall. You’re honestly quite surprised it was actually this easy to detain her.

Pushing against her like this, you see her face clearly now as you catch your breath. With her dark blue eyes shooting daggers down at you and her purple lips twisted into a disgusting scowl it’s not a pretty sight. Only her long, light blue hair is anything close to pretty right now.

Sure that you have Morgen held too tightly for her to escape, you turn your attention to Molly. Your hypnotized crush stands there, looking at you with a vacant expression and making no attempt to move in the slightest. You have to break that spell, and break it quickly!

“Molly. It’s me, Erik.” You speak to her as firmly as you possibly can, trying not to be too loud and possibly attract attention. “We need to get out of here. Please, fight her control. I know you can win.” You stop to swallow down the lump that’s formed in your throat under Molly’s unbearably unresponsive gaze. “I know yo-”

“Transform him!” Morgen shrieks, catching you off guard. Molly’s scleras flash brightly at the command and slowly she begins to raise her arm. “NOW! Strawberry! Turn him int-AH!” You shut her up by angrily kneeing her in the gut, knocking the wind out of her.

“Molly, don’t! Fight it!” You plead as she points directly at you. Looking your friend dead in the eyes, you can only hope Molly has the strength to break free.

Molly...
121331111.title: Subdue the Witch

121332.content:
"I'm telling you, we've never met! I don't know who you ar-"

The innkeeper doesn't finish his rant, as long trails of bandages shoot from the woman's outstretched arm and tightly ensnare him from head-to-toe. With only his nose free to breathe, he falls out of your sight behind the inn's desk with muffled protests and a quiet thud.

"You raid my tomb, snatch away many of my prized possessions, steal my very sarcophagus, and you don't even know my name? How more insulting can you be?"

The pure power in her voice sends a chill down your back. You take in what you can of her appearance from this angle: dark skin, dark purple hair that passes her hips, revealing black clothes, lots of exotic gold and blue jewellery, bandages coating her wrists and lower legs. A staff of gold and sapphire rests in her right hand, and a large red cobra with piercing blue eyes keeps itself close to her. Her very atmosphere makes you uneasy to the core.

You glance at the two females behind her. Besides their eyes and mouths, they're covered in lose bandages. From the crooked way they're standing, the empty look in their eyes and the agape mouths, you can easily tell they're Mummies. But the only thing that can create and control Mummies is...

A Pharaoh.

Your uneasiness transforms itself into full-on fear, and you grip your wooden sword tighter as you turn your attention back to the Pharaoh, who has made a seat for herself on the desk. Now you can see her ruby red eyes and ample breasts.

Her snake disappears for a moment behind her desk, and soon surfaces with a book in it's mouth for it's master. She takes it, rewarding the reptile with a gently rub of the head, before opening it and flipping through.

An uncomfortable silence slowly passes as you watch the Pharaoh intently, the only noises being the distant snoring of other inn guests above and the mouth-breathing of the Mummy Girls. The Pharaoh soon finishes the book with a loud snap and rests her chin on the back of her hand, her eyes closed and a gentle smile on her face.

"Sorry if I'm boring you, young hero."

As her words enter your ears, she opens her eyes and locks gazes with you.

Your heart almost stops in terror.

"There is no need to spy on me. If you want answers, come out and ask." The warm smile never leaves her lips.

You quickly glance around, and find the snake and the Mummy Girls are also staring at you.

"Now, come out of the shadows..." She beckons you with a finger "Or must I drag you out myself?"
121332.title: Queen of Kings

choices: You need answers! Where the heck are you and why?!
Just relax and take in all Akila has to offer.
1213321.content:
You briefly contemplate dashing away, but from the display earlier you figure that you'd wind up mummified like the innkeeper.
As you step out of the shadows and approach the front of the desk, you clutch your sword close to you as you visibly shake with each step.
The woman at the desk, still wearing the same smile never moves an inch until you finally stop in front of the desk.
You stand in place shaking for the longest time, staring into this woman's eyes. Knowing full well that you most likely won't speak up without some encouragement,
the woman speaks up. "You must be getting quite a few splinters in your chest with the way you're hugging that hunk of wood." the woman says with a bit of a giggle as you look down and realize that you're not holding your sword anymore, instead you've been hugging it close to your chest like a stuffed bear!
"I-uh I'm s-sorry for staring at you earlier, Ma'am." you finally manage to stutter out, trying to be as polite as possible so you don't end up losing your head.

"It's alright dear, I made quite a bit of noise. I'm surprised I didn't wake up the rest of the people here." The woman adjusts herself in her seat a bit before speaking further, her breasts happily bouncing as she does. "So I assume you want to know why I just mummified the innkeeper?"

"Uh if it's not too much trouble for you, yes please." The woman laughs a bit at your response. "So you're as polite as you are cute! I like that."

"I'm here because this man has stolen not only my sarcophagus, but a number of treasures that are quite important to me. His book lists the items he stole, but not where they were hidden."

You frown a bit. If someone stole your bed and various other things important to you, you'd probably want to find the person who stole them too.

"I'm not sure if you figured it out young man, but I'm not entirely human. I'm a Pharaoh, and I rule over the desert not far from here. Without my Sarcophagus, my powers are much more limited. And without my powers, my control over the desert weakens. And that means it will soon descend into chaos."

So that was why she was so angry. Your hero senses quickly push aside the fear and a memory hits you. You saw something glinting underneath the floorboards in your room, underneath your bed. "I'm sorry about what happened to you, but I think I might know where some of your stuff is..." you mutter out as you're still in deep thought. The woman's eyes widen a bit as she leans forward. "Really? And where might it be young man?" she asks as her snake also leans forward with a bit of a hiss. "I saw something glittering under the floorboard underneath my bed. My room is the last one to the right upstairs." you say as you point towards the stairs.

The woman lets out a hum as she clicks her fingers. Her two mummy servants quickly rush up the stairs, one of them picking up her snake as they trudge along. The woman then gets out of her seat and walks over to you, intimidated you back up a little but end up hitting a wall. "Don't be afraid child, I just want to get a better look at the young man who's trying to help me." she says with a coo as she inspects you. "I don't believe I ever introduced myself, my name is Akila." she says as she bends down so that her face lines up with yours. You resist the urge to look down her robes as you let out a small smile in return. "My names Erik."

Before the conversation continues, a loud thunking noise alerts both of you as the mummies carry down a large golden sarcophagus. Akila's eyes light up as she walks over to her sarcophagus and hugs it. She turns back to you and walks back over, quickly snatching you up into a hug. "Thank you Erik! With your help I can stop worrying!" You zone out a bit as your face is pushed against Akila's large breasts. After a few moments, you attempt to pull away from Akila but her grip on you is very tight. Akila lowers her head a bit and purrs into your ear "If you don't mind Erik, I would like to reward you for your devotion and help."

Before you can respond, you feel something slither up your leg and quickly make its way onto your shoulder. You quickly realize that this is Akila's cobra, as it sinks its teeth into your shoulder. You let out a yelp which is stifled between Akila's breasts. "Sorry dear, that was just a little something to help you relax." Akila says as you begins to feel your legs give out on you. You feel yourself quickly pulled forward as Akila drags both of you into her Sarcophagus, the lid shutting quickly behind you.

Akila hugs you tighter against her as she begins to undress you, the venom from her snake leaving only your head moveable. Akila begins to undress herself shortly after undressing you, both of your clothing falling to the bottom of the sarcophagus. You feel a shift in movement as the container begins to move. "Don't mind them, Erik. They are simply transporting us back to my home." Akila says as she begins to fondle your member. After getting you hard, she finally begins to have sex with you, wrapping her legs around you tightly before she begins thrusting you into her almost madly. If you could think clearly right now, you would probably guess that Akila has been physically starved for quite a long time given how she's acting.

You look around the room a bit more to see the same sarcophagus you were trapped in earlier leaning against a wall inside of what appears to be a tomb. From your knowledge, ancient tombs were generally just stone corridors leading into stone rooms decked with artifacts and gold, but this room appeared no different from any other persons room. A bed, a stone desk with a mirror on it, and a bathroom a short ways away with a large hotspring inside of it.

"Royalty sure has it nice..." you groggily think to yourself as Akila begins to stir. Her eyes flutter open as she hugs you tighter to herself. "Glad to see you're awake, Erik dear." she yawns. "I hope my reward was to your liking. Perhaps maybe you'd like another round?"

As much fun as sex is, you contemplate whether you should try to get some answers out of Akila or accept her offer.

The bunny girl, confused, ponders her next move. You're armed, and could injure her at worse. But at the same time, she's always wanted to share her body with one of the heroes who stumbled into her neck of the woods. She narrows her eyes as she makes her decision. She lets her "paws" massage and play with your face, kneading it, moving it about, and rubbing their scent across it. Making the most of the situation, you attempt to focus on the good things. The sweat didn't smell bad, but it definitely had a strong scent to it. Her feet did feel kind of nice...

Stopping, you try to rid your mind of such thoughts before you give up your journey at the first monster you see.

A slightly larger bunny girl hops out from the edge of the forest, even at just a glance you notice the similarities between the two, they even shared the same color of their fur. When she spots the two of you she quickly hops over, a slightly worried look on her face.

"Why did you run off on your own again? You know it's dangerous to travel by yourself, what if something had happened to you?" Her sister kept on with the worried questions for a full minute, it was hard to focus on the conversation with the younger bunny girl's feet still on you but you could tell how nervous she was by the way she was fidgeting around.

"S-sorry, I didn't mean to make you worry, I-I just... I don't...umm..." The young bunny girl struggled to come up with a good excuse for her absence, she could barely maintain eye contact with her sister.

The older bunny girl's eyes suddenly set on you and you practically shiver under the gaze of the more experienced hunter. She kneels down as her sister moves her feet aside to get a better look at what the younger bunny girl caught.

"Well, what do we have here? Did my little sister actually subdue a young adventurer all on her own?" She moves your head to one side with her hand to get a better look at you.

"I-I did my best, I know I'm no real fighter like you...I guess my instincts just got the better of me..." She's still shuffling around nervously on top of you as she explains how the fight played out...That's right, now it's starting to come back to you, a young bunny girl who barely knows how to fight dominated you, without you even getting a single hit in...A rather embarrassing way to start off your adventure.

"I'm impressed lil' sis, you won your first fight without taking so much as a scratch!" "O-okay, I think I remember how to do this." The young bunny girl reaches into a little pouch that hung from a leather belt that you now notice she wore. From it she obtained a strange looking berry that you have never seen before. She pulls one leg close to her and carefully places the berry between her toes before moving her foot back over your face. After the sisters rub their feet on your for a little bit you are back under their spell and gladly let the berry holding toes into your mouth. 12211.title: It's the bunny girl's older sister

122111.content:
You awaken with a start inside what you can only assume the bunny girl sisters call home. Suddenly the crowd that was jeering her was in stunned silence as she bounced from foot to foot happily dancing. The judge stood up and declared the bunny girl victorious!

The Goblin Girl was escorted out of the ring by her master by collar, and Sylvia ran to her side of the arena bouncing up next to you hugging you tightly squeezing you a bit tighter than you'd like but you could tell it wasn't malicious.

"So what do we do now?" She gleefully asked "are we gonna go right in to the next round or do we have to wait our turn?

"We wait our turn of course, you need to rest and maybe we can gather some info on the competition." You congratulate her patting her head. This got you some snickers but you didn't care you had claimed victory. (Growling) you turned to face a fox girl snarling in your face.
Pulling her away from you was a grizzled old man who towered above you baring many scars from both man and monster.
"A little upstart like you has no place in this tournament, I suggest you withdraw before your little girl friend there gets torn limbless." The way he said this made both you and Sylvia quiver and buckle. This was no hollow threat every inch of those words held miles of truth.
The fox girl began to stare done the shaking bunny girl eyeing her from head to toe.
"You lappins are quite proud of those legs I'm gonna start with them first besides I don't want you running away" she coyling played with Sylvia's before tugging them pulling her close to her face. "Let me get a quick taste of whats to come" licking the soft flesh the fox girl turned her attention to you making a quick biting motion clamping her teeth together.
"I've warned you boy drop out or you will be leaving here with a body bag." Seeing Sylvia shake you begin to think that's not such a bad idea. You hesitate...
12322221.title: For you

123222211.content:
You step between the trembling Sylvia and these two, striking the most intimidating pose you can, and starting the two down. They don't relent however and even edge closer giving you a duel death glare. You feel Sylvia pressed against your back shacking. Fortunately your struggle to come up with some sort of response was mercifully cut short has two guards came to break you up.

Sylvia peeked our from under your arm has the two walked away. Placing your hand on your shoulder you squeezed her against your side. Again struggling to speck to her your thoughts where interrupted when she spoke in a very quit voice “so… know anything about fighting fox girls?”

A small smile came to your face has you squeezed Sylvia even tighter “ya”. Guiding her to a spot in the stands you said “the first thing to know is that their ears are very sensitive”. Your next three battles where all very easy for Sylvia, and she managed to get some support from the crowed. There was a two hour intermission before the finals, and you had a promise to keep.

“What was that” asked Sylvia has you where leaving the post office.

“A letter. I promised to write my friend Molly when I got to town. With all that happened yesterday I didn't have the time.” With the fair going on the streets of the town where almost completely empty. You delayed in returning to enjoy a break from all the noise.

Sylvia was walking besides you taking sparing bits out of her treats. “Are you and her close?” The question surprised you and you turned to look at her, but she was purposely looking away from you.

It's possible she could be jealous, but you decided not to say anything and just answer her question. “Molly was basicly my shadow for most of my life. I was a little disappointed she didn't come with me, but I guess her fear of monsters was just that great”

That got Sylvia's attention “Why is she afraid of monsters?”

You scratched your chin “well scared might not be the right word. She never would venture very fare from town, and took every moment she could to tell be how dangerous monsters where, along with a the horrible perverse things they would do to me if they had the chance.” Eyes falling again a faint “oh” escaped Sylvia's lips. Laughing you rubbed her head and said “in fact her stories where so detailed, I would tease that she actually had a monster fetish. Anyway we have to hurry if we are going to make it to our match”.




“Welcome to the semi finales of our locale monster girl tournament” bellowed the announcer to the crowed. “in the blue corner with have a surprising contender, Erik and his bunny girl.” At the sound of your name you steeped out into the arena. Sylvia happily bouncing in front waving to the crowed, to no small amount of cheers. “Yes a young boy oh looks like he just walked of the family farm and petite little bunny girl have made it all the way to the semi finals, I fear their luck has run out has their next opponent is Russle and his slime!”

“What!” The rest of the announcer's words fade from your perception has you stare across the arena at your opponent. The man was wearing a set of robs that just screamed HAY I'M A WIZARED! At his side has a bright blue slime, extremely plump with a massive plum of simulated wavy hair that covered half her face. Both wore a smirk of self assured victory.

“B-but you said there wouldn't be any s-slimes here!” said Sylvia her voice cracking slightly.

“The symbol on those robes, this guy is clearly from a magic school. The only reason this ass hole would be here is for an easy victory. The symbol in question vaguely resembled a water drop within a gout of fire.

The battle began and the slime slowly advanced a sly smile on her face, and a messily exaggerated sway of her hips clearly not taking this seriously. Sylvia backed up away from her “master what do I do?” The obvious fear in her voice hurt you. You couldn't bring yourself to answer or even watch, eyes focused on the ground. There was nothing that could be done. There was no way to fight slims without magic. Your palms hurt your fists where clenched so tight, has you struggled over whether you should forfeit or not.
123222211.title: The slime

1232222111.content:
“It's okay master” at sound of Sylvia's voice suddenly so calm you looked up. She was smiling at you “I think I can handle this, so don't worry okay?” She seems so calm now, you don't understand. Stunned in surprised you watched has the slime got even closer, before Sylvia turned around, placed her hands on the ground hiking her but high in the air, and began to dig.

A massive stream of dirt flow between Sylvia's legs right into the slime's face. The slime let out a murky yell while trying to block the dirt, clearly distressed. She pressed on trying to grab Sylvia, but there was no chance of that happening, has Sylvia just bound to a new spot where the same thing happened again and again. That was when your eyes widened in shock. The dirt was being absorbed into the slime. Over time her color was turning a dirty brown, her movement’s more lethargic, and her form less defined has she started to droop all over.

In spite of this the slime continued to peruse Sylvia, driven at this point my immense rage. Just has it seemed the slime was about to get her Sylvia jumped completely over the slime. After running to the other end of the arena, she sprinted back shoulder down, and talked the slime has hard has she could. The slime was sent back a couple feet far enough to be knocked out of the arena.

The announcer screamed your victory and the crowed cheered for you has well, but you where to stunned to move. You where so certain there was no way to win, but then. Sylvia bounded up to a grate big beaming smile on her face. All you could do was stammer out “how?”

With a soft giggle she explained “it was how we protected out burrows from slimes. They don't like it when you get dirt on them.” I continued to stare bewildered. Sylvia looked back at me with concern. Just has she was about to speak again I hugged her, knowing I wouldn't be able to answer any question she asked. I didn't know what I was feeling right now myself.

“Your filthy now Sylvia” I said wiping some mud of her shoulder. We didn't have time to clean her up has we where immediately rushed off to the final round. It was no surprise who our opponent was.

The man from before and his fox girl. The announcer introduced him 'the viscous Mordici, and his killer fox girl'. The term killer was an appropriate description for how that fox girl was looking at you. Before the matched started Mordici jeered at you “thanks for taking out that slime, boy. It might of actually been a problem for me.”

The moment the match started the fox girl crossed the area and struck Sylvia across the face before either of you could react. While still reeling from the impact the fox girl garbed Sylvia by the throat and throw her into the center of the arena. She tried to stand but before she could, the fox girl grabbed her ankle and twisted her onto her back. One foot stomped onto Sylvia's arm next to the shoulder, she tightened her grip and began to pull. Sylvia was screaming in pain. The fox continued twisting, and pulling all with a wicked smile.

Next thing you knew the fox was much closer to you. One hand gripping her side where blood dripped between her fingers. Your bloody knife was clutched in your hand. She turned to face you. There was no more joy on her face, only hate, eyes burning red with anger. She slashed at me, but I side steeped the blow and slashed back at her arm. You have no idea how you manage to keep dodging her let alone get some cuts in of your own.

While doing that you are also vaguely aware of Sylvia trying to stand, only to fall flat when she puts any weight on her right leg. You make sure to keep the fox away from her. There is also the growing sound of Mordici yelling at the fox girl to stop. And the thought of why the guards haven't intervened yet.

Growing even more enraged the fox girl lunged recklessly right at you, slaming into your chest, and knocking you to the ground. She straddled your abdomen a vice like on your wrist burning with pain till you dropped your knife. Her other hand scratching deep into your chest. The anger superseded from her eyes has sadistic pleasure again took it's place. She licked her lips, then opened her mouth, showing of her many sharp gleaming white teeth has her head slowly descended towards you.

Your visions of doom where cut short by the sound of a whip. The fox curl arched back hissing in pain. Behind her you could see Mordici with a whip shouting angrely. Again growling in anger the fox girl stood up to face her so called master, still shouting in at her. With one swift bunch the fox girl spralled him on the ground where he did not move. The fact that she did not advance on him tooled you she was still after you. You had less then a second to act while her back was turned before she would again be on you.
1232222111.title: The finals

12322221111.title: Attack!

choices: Take Sylvia back to your home to recover and watch over her
Leave Sylvia in care of the medical staff and adventure out
123222211112.content:
It is becoming too much for you to take on the fox girl.

But despite Sylvia's injuries, she sees you in danger and maybe getting killed. Her adrenaline kicks in and in a few swift kicking moves, she kicks the fox girl out of the arena and knocks her out cold winning the fight and saving your life.

The crowd is stunned a Bunny girl was able to win, but some cheered seeing this and some disappointed who betted on the fox girl.

Regardless you and Sylvia receive the huge winnings and Sylvia is happy to see you still alive and hugs and kisses you. "I was so worried about you, will you be OK?" asked Sylvia worried.

You are still a little surprised the Bunny girl saved you, but you are happy this happened, plus you won a huge sum of money, "I will be Sylvia and thanks for saving me" you answered her, "But right now, I need to take care of you" You notice she is still injured and take her to a doctor/hospital.

Thankful a doctor is willing to treat the Bunny girl, even though she is unfamiliar with a body of a Bunny girl. Thankfully she did not have to do much research and figured Sylvia's injuries are very treatable. Sadly Sylvia will not be able to do any fighting or traveling for a while...
123222211112.title: Saved!

choices: And run into some trouble along the way.
1232222111121.content:
You asked the doctor "is there anything more they could do for her." The doctor shakes their head no "Not really, all she really needs is some rest. You would be surprised to know that monster girls tend to be fast healers." You mulled over your options on what to do. You could leave her in the hospital but that just didn't feel right to just abandon her at the hospital. She risked her life to save you and she even won alot of money as a boon to your journey. Besides what could be a better place to rest up than your home. If she wanted to part ways after that would be fine.

You felt that you owed her to her to treat her until she was fine. You scooped up the Sylvia into your arms. "What are you doing? You have enough money to replace the wooden sword I broke, we're even." She asked somewhat confused by your actions. "The doctor said that all you is to rest and you be better in no time. I want to take its the least I could do for you. Besides, my home not that far away and it's not like the witch queen is going anywhere anytime soon."

Sylvia wanted to argue that it was ok but when she looked into Erik's eyes and saw how concerned he looked she relented. "Okay I will come with you." You smiled cradling Sylvia in your arms and chest. You bid the docter well and went on your way with Sylvia in tow. You felt her burrow into your chest a little trying to hide her blushing face but you didn't mind at all.

You head home...
