Find easy quests to earn money and weapons
123222212.content:
Seeing Sylvia shake in fear, you decide to maybe drop out. The fox girl laughs at both you and Sylvia and walk off.

The Bunny girl comes to you and hugs you, "Thanks for doing that for me, but why did you do that?"

You thought for a moment then answered, "I just could not stand see you in fear nor get injuried or killed, plus you are too new at fighting anyways"

"I see..." said Sylvia, "But how am I going to pay you back?"

"Actually, you don't have to do that" you said to her, "Maybe you can become my partner, I could use one"

"Really, are you sure?" asks Sylvia surprised.

"Yes, I can see you could become a great fighter, just need some training and experience" you said to the Bunny girl.

"Yeah, your right" said Sylvia admitting it, "so...what shall we do next?"
123222212.title: Drop Out

1232222122.content:
"Well we are low on coins, equipment, and just basic supplies. So we need to earn some quick cash." You look around as she bite her lips.

"I'm not sure what you think I am but I'm not going to just open my legs and......." I put my finger on Sylvia lips to stop her .

"As much as that would be a quick way to make some coins, I'm not a brothal owner or know if the guard would look kindly on that. I was thinking of just some easy quest and jobs to make some money." I walk over to a bullion board and look it over as Sylvia huff and shifted from one foot to to other. "There two jobs here that we could do with are little bit of supply. one easy retrieval of a packages from the post office and delivery of it to the tailor shop, it could get us enough to cover sleeping in a inn or a meal or two. The second one is something you might not like Sylvia. We're to capture a imp who been seen around the outskirts of town that been a harassment to people and kill her in front of the town guard. It would cover getting me some armor and put us up for the weak." I look at her knowing it wouldn't be a simple choice for the second one. "I'll let you pick what you are ok with."
1232222122.title: Find easy quests to earn money and weapons

choices: She was sent out to find a mate. You look like a good choice.
She's being chased by an angry and hungry Ogrenette (Ogre girl)
124.content:
The two of you simply stand there and stare at each other, each waiting for the other to make some kind of move. Eventually, you grow board of the standoff and slowly raise a hand up as if waving. You give no outward sign that you noticed the Bunny girl tense and look like she was a hairs breath from fleeing. Most Monster girls wouldn't take kindly to such actions after all. Still, you feel much more at ease at meeting your first monster girl. Now if you had the misfortune of running into a Goblin girl, or something of that nature you'd most certainly be much less calm.

"Hello Miss.", you say in greeting. Out of all the Monster girls in the world, Bunny girls were the ones Humanity had the most knowledge on. They were rarely aggressive outside of a playful manner and seemed to generally enjoy human interaction. Most bunny girls tended to be happy and even a bit bubbly personality-wise, though there was the very rare accounts of some being more shy and timid; much like this one seemed to be if you were reading her right.

Now just because the Bunny girls weren't normally violent unless provoked or cornered, that didn't mean they weren't dangerous. When hungry a bunny girl was just as ravenous as any other monster girl. A bunny girl of her size could easily swallow you down if she grew hungry enough. Still, you were less likely to die from a bunny girl then any other Monster girl.

After giving a greeting you simply watched her, waiting to see what she would do. The bewildered look on her face made it clear that she hadn't expected you to attempt friendly conversation and was now very unsure about what she was suppose to do. Thankfully, the young bunny girl eventually gave a friendly, if hesitant, greeting back.

"H-hello.", answered the girl as she shuffled in place; she was clearly afraid of you and likely ready to start running at a moments notice. She seemed nice enough though, so you pondered on trying to make conversation with her for a bit. Figuring you had no real reason not too, you continued talking to the girl.

"This road is a bit of a distance from the closest rabbit warrens, isn't it? Mind if I ask why a young bunny like you is hopping around here, especially since you seem rather jumpy?" You hoped the questions wouldn't set her on edge, but they were rather valid questions as the warrens were on the other side of the village you'd just left.

The girl fidgeted a bit, glancing around like she expected something to come jumping out at her any moment. You weren't that scary were you? You pondered this while giving the girl a more through look over.

She seemed to be about 5' 6" in height (not including the foot long rabbit ears at the top of her head) making her just a few inches shorter then yourself at a height of 5' 10". Her frame was small and thin with a moderately sized chest. Nothing to big, still bigger then most of the other girls you know from town. Her legs were long and looked they'd be smooth to the touch in the areas her pelt didn't cover. It went without saying that her legs were also dangerous, all that hopping making her muscles strong and toned. You'd be willing to bet that she had a nice firm, yet soft rump topping those legs. She had a set of well proportioned hips that were not too wide yet wide enough that one could clearly see they’d be well suited for one day carrying and birthing young. They lead up to a thin but, fit waist and a firm stomach that could be seen despite her pelt covering it.

All in all, her build gave her an enticing hourglass shape with thin arms that still showed hints of toned muscles underneath soft skin. Her face is what really caught his attention though. It held a soft look to it due to it retaining some of its roundness from childhood. It gave her a look of childlike innocence while still managing to look like a beautiful angle. Her lips, though not overly large or full, were soft and could easily draw one in for a kiss without any thought on the others part. The cute nose and large eyes that on closer inspection where not a pure yellow, but a golden amber color only helped to make this young bunny girl very attractive.

"Um..." The hesitant sound of the bunny girls voice quickly broke you from your observations of her form. "Well... I-I'm here because..."

Why is the Bunny Girl here?
124.title: Peaceful Meeting

1241.content:
She says, "Well truth be told I wanted to find someone to be my mate and seeing you I can tell you are a good choice. Don't worry I'm not like most of the other monster girls I still have my free will." Hearing she wasnt under the control of your target was quite surprising. You said, "Yes I will mate with you. What's your name?" The rabbit said, "Names Alice and thanks for allowing me to mate with you. After this I will assist you in any way I can." You shoot your seed into Alice and you shoot out a lot into her because it makes her stomach swell to the point where she looks like she's due with a single child. Alice says, "Dang that was a lot of semen you shot inside me. Now I have this technique that ensures the semen goes into a sort of storage sack where I can constantly ensure your sperm can be guaranteed to fertilize me. Its where all semen goes in for a bunny girl in heat." She then gets up and says, "Now shall we be off?" You agree and suggest that you head to either a cavern you heard of, the town you were intending to reach, or head into the forest which is technically a rainforest but thing is you know that in such a place things will be difficult if you get unlucky

Alice the Bunny Girl has joined you in your quest! Her skills are based around agility.
1241.title: She was sent out to find a mate. You look like ...

choices: Something bursts from the treeline in front of you.
Velvets belly rumbles letting you know she's getting those hungry urges.
Nighttime. No surprises so far. Time to set camp.
1242.content:
"W-wait. Did you say an Ogrenette is after you?", you ask. You had to have heard her wrong because the Ogre tribes lived in the mountains. They had no place here in the wooded valleys and plains. Your hope however was shattered at seeing your new bunny friend nod her head before looking around like she expected the beast to just jump out at them at any moment. "Why is such a beast even here? They l've in the mountains. Your can't possibly be saying you went up there and pissed one off, that would mean you've been running for days, maybe over a week!"

"N-no! There've been some fights over territory between the ogre clans. This one got pushed out of her lands and forced all the way down here. I-I didn't even know about her till she tried to eat me two days ago." She explain, barely holding herself together near the end. You can't really blame her either. Ogres were pretty stupid but, Lord were they persistent little fucks. If you had a hungry predator that was normally over twice your own size and needed specially forged weapons or super strength just to hurt, you'd be pretty freaked out yourself. That made you think for a moment before doing what would either be the best decision of your life, or the action that would cause to come to a screeching halt.

The bunny girl, who you still didn't know the name of, was broken from her attempts at holding back her sobs and frightened cries by you grabbing her hand and soon practically dragging along behind you. "W-what are....?!?", you cut her off before she could likely start to panic. "If it's only been two days then that Ogrenette won't be too far behind. We need to start making tracks. I was on my way the the nearest city, a port town before meeting you. If we can get there before the Ogrenette catches up with us, then we can force it back through shear numbers." You look back at the girl to see she is giving you an odd look. You can clearly see confusion, fright and the barest hints of hope in her golden-amber eyes, as well as a myriad of other emotions swirling around inside of her.

"You know, I never did get your name. I'm Erik, just turned sixteen a few weeks ago.", you offered with a friendly smile. Your heartbeat quickens a bit at seeing a small smile make its way to the girls pretty face. "V-Velvet, my name is Velvet." "Well Velvet, stick with me and I'll do everything I can to get you out of this alive, I promise.", you say as your turn your eyes back towards the road. Your only response is a slight tightening of her hand around yours and her trying to match her pace with your own. You help out a bit with at last part as though her feet are remarkable human-like, they still have those pads on the bottom, making them better suited for hopping then walking.

As the two of you continued on your way, you can't help but wonder what sort of crazy adventure you just got yourself into.
1242.title: An Ogre is on my tail!

choices: It's a human Hunter and their eyes are locked on Velvet.
It's another monster girl. What's she here for?
False alarm. It's just a small animal. (Reserved)
12421.content:
It had only been a few hours since your fateful encounter with Velvet, the bunny girl. In that time the two of you had covered a lot of ground towards the port town. In another 2 hours the two of you would find safety behind the walls of the small port town. Seeing the distance the two of you had managed to cover, coupled with surprisingly loud, bestial growls coming from a very embarrassed Velvet's stomach, you figured a quick snack break was an order. Besides, Velvet may be really cute but you had no desire to end up filling her belly. You were likely already pushing things seeing as how you doubted the poor bunny had any time to eat while fleeing the Ogrenette.

Still, who would have guessed that a hungry monster girl would be so picky in what she ate.

"I'm sorry Velvet, but that's really all I've got right now." You can't help but feel bad at learning how little of the travel food you brought along actually appealed to her. This was only compounded by the dejected pout on her face as she miserably nibbled at some dried fruit.

"Just because I'm a bunny girl doesn't mean fruits and vegetables are my preferred foods," the girl muttered while forcing herself to chew and swallow what you had given her.

"Again I'm sorry. I didn't pack with having a pretty bunny girl companion in mind." You hoped the compliment would help lift her mood. Judging from the slight pause in her chewing and the light pink dusting her cheeks you'd say it worked. "Besides, you've already tried the dried meats I brought and you remember how that went," you say, waging the jerky in your hand. You make a mental note to look into what meats you could bring on your trip that Velvet would enjoy. Human meat was after all not something you planned to serve without good reason.

"How about this. The inn I'm planning to stay at has a tavern on the bottom floor. Once we get all things we need, armor, weapons, supplies, etc. I'll get you a big helping of meat at the tavern. Then you can rest in the room we rent. I doubt you've been able to get much sleep after all."

Velvet seems to perk up greatly at hearing this and before you know it your back on the road with an excited bunny girl pulling you along. Despite how hard it is keeping up you can't help but smile at your companions back. This trip would have been far more lonely without her.

Unknown to you, Velvet is also thinking about her companion and how grateful she is at having met him. Her mind is running with countless possibilities of what the two of you might go through together. One thought however causes her cheeks to redden and her heart to speed up. She inwardly promised herself that if you did keep your promise to her, then no matter what others might think of her for it, she would take you as her lifelong mate.

Seeing as how Velvet was getting lost in her fantasies of romance and adventure, she failed to notice the shifting in the foliage just ahead. Thankfully, you manage to pick up on it just in time to plant your feet and pull back. This caused Velvet to come crashing out of her thoughts as she stumbled and nearly fell backwards. She was only still standing due to you grabbing ahold of her before positioning yourself between her and whatever was hiding in the bushes. Drawing your wooden sword you stand at the ready for whatever might jump out at you.

What jumps out at you?
12421.title: Surprise Encounter

choices: Step aside and let him deal with Velvet

He replies "I am Yuta the hunter and I have come to rid the world of the blight of monster girls by destroying every last monster girl that I find". He looks behind you and sees Velvet. "Ah, there is one of them now step aside while I deal with this pest".

The ogre wins, eating Velvet and taking you prisoner
124212.content:
Bursting through the shaking brush is a brute of a beast. About nine feet tall, it is a rather imposing monster girl covered head-to-toe in olive green flesh. Her body shape is fairly human, save for the large pair of tusks protruding out from her lower jaw. Even her breasts are proportionally average, even considering her extra few feet.

A quick look at her fat wooden club and her leopard bikini set confirms it; this is an ogre.

''Kyaaaaah!'' Velvet cries. ''She found me!''

A big, dumb smirk grows on the ogre's face as she takes a few steps forward.

''Me am found you now, little rabbit. Me am so hungry...''

You take a deep breath and ready yourself for the coming fight. There is no reasoning with a hungry brute...
124212.title: Velvet and the Ogre

1242121.content:
The lumbering semi-giant strides toward you with an air of dominance. Like a lion cornering a mouse, she knows she's won. But you're not ready to give in. Hands shaking, you dash forward and jab your weapon straight into her muscular abs. The flimsy woods bounces off, blunting its edge and leaving nary a scratch.

The ogre laughs at your strike and raises one of her massive, dirt-covered feet. She slams it towards you and you barely managed to dive forward, landing just beneath her ass. Velvet, who was behind you, takes the attack instead. The bunny girl is pinned to the ground as the giant bitch starts to twist the ball of her foot, grinding your friend.

With her attention drawn away, you stare at the ass above and come up with a strange idea. For the second time this battle, you jab at her, this time aiming straight at her asshole. Her leopard bikini is unable to hold back the wooden rod from blasting straight into her asshole.

''Gwaaah!'' The ogre yells, falling to her knees. You twist the rod, hoping to cause some pain, but the following pants are more... pleasurable in nature. She seems to be enjoying this.

''Oh oh, you want fuck me human? she asks, turning her head back. ''After this, me am gonna shove you way up!''

That was all the time Velvet needed to act. Unhinging her jaw like a snake, she leaps forward and takes the beasts entire head into her mouth. The ogre struggles, but a few more twists of your sword ruins her coordination. Its your first time witnessing a devouring, but you are amazed at how quickkly she manages to eat her victim; in only a few second she has passed her shoulders and a few beyond that she is already at the hips.

You dislodge the sword before Velvet swallows it and stare in awe as she sucks down the filthy feet like a pair of noodles. As soon as she does she tumbles back, her distended belly looking comically large. You would have laughed if not for the distinct ogre outline and its violent thrashing.

''Waaah'' Velvet moans and you immediately set to making camp. After all, you aren't leaving her for a few hours at least. Velvet is gonna digest that ogre, and when she does, it all goes...
1242121.title: Velvet Beats (and Eats) the Ogre!

choices: You arrive at Port Minvera without any further issues

12421213.content:

133.content:
You werent stupid. You knew an obvious trap when you see one. That 'girl in need' was really a monster in seek of easy prey. However, you werent reckless either. It wasnt like you go up to her and slay her right then and there. Not with the weapon you currently have. Wood swords wont do much damage to monsters that have specialize in that specific element. The best you could do now is just ignore her only you can get a better sword. You felt the plant-girl's red eyes glare your direction in disappointment as she continued her phony struggle, but you dare not give her any eye contact. Just leave that venus guy-trap to the next sucker.

The rest of the path was pretty clear. Not a single monster in sight. Either it was a bad season for them or other more experienced hunters got to them first. Either way, it made the trek to the port much easier.
It wasnt a long walk to the port, anyways. The lighthouse on the hill guided the way.
The port consisted of a small bazaar in the streets selling several kinds of important goods acquired from the trade ships at the dock. The bazaar had a wide range of goods to sell ranging from imported fruits & vegetables, exotic foods, herbal medicines, jewelry, even special repellent sprays to keep monsters in heat away.

As expected, there were loads of fellow adventurers crowing the port, set out to accomplish the same goal as you. There was a wide variety of them, too. Males and females, big and small, fat and skinny, while most looked to be in their late 20s-early 30s, there were some as young as 7 or 8 and as old as 70 or 80! This was a highly competitive job, but only the best can get anywhere with it.
Focused with your mission, you ignored all the others and made your way to the big fancy armory shop. The ONLY armory that sells actually steel weaponry within hundreds of miles! You couldnt buy a lot, cuz you'd still need some cash left over to rent a boat.

The armory had a huge selection on display. Heavy armor, sturdy helmets, sharp axes, fierce hammers, crossbows, the works. Unfortunately, you've only been training thoroughly to use a sword, so a sword would be your best bet. However, the section that displays it's legendary killing blades was empty! No sword in sight.
Curious, you head to the cash register to inquire to the big bulky bald cashier casually reading his newspaper.

"How can I help ya?" he asked in a thick, broad, attentive voice.
"I wish to buy one of your swords," you explained, "and I dont see any of them on display."
"Sorry kid. We're sold out of 'em."
"!!!" The words struck you like a... sword! "YOURE OUT OF SWORDS?!!"
"Yep, theyre in high demand," he casually explained, ignoring your freak out, "sold out the last one about 3 hours ago." DAMNIT!! TOO LATE!! If only you had gotten up much earlier. Like the crack of dawn, maybe. "We still got a lot of the other stuff if youre interested. Got plenty o' crossbows we need to get rid of."

You lowered your head in shame. Swords were practically the only weapon you spent most of your life training to master! You dont really know how to use anything else! Why couldnt you have trained to use various weapons?! You sighed hard, pondering what you should do.

*DING!!! DING!!! DING!!!*

Suddenly, the port's alarm bell rang!

"MONSTER ATTACK!!! EVERYONE GET TO SHELTER!!" shouted someone outside. You could hear screaming, blades clinging and loud fast footsteps as villagers and fake 'heroes' ran for cover to avoid the upcoming monster raid!
"Barricade the doors!" the manager ordered his employees.
"Yes sir!" they blocked both the doors with heavy suits of armor as their boss locked the bars on the windows! After securing the armory, the employees whipped out their trusty crossbows while the big man behind the counter reached for his silver warhammer... JUST in case!

The port was under attack. Serious business. And the worst time in the world to be without a proper blade! If those beasts trash the port, you wont be able to leave the island! And your dream of defeating the Witch Queen will come to a sudden halt.

"How many of them are there?" the big man behind the counter asked.
An employee through the window and squinted his eyes, "Er... just one."
"Just one?!" the big man raised his eyebrow in disbelief.

"Yeah... and it looks like she took out about a dozen adventurers!" DOZEN adventurers?! "Holy crap... she's staring down Captain Carpenter!"

Sparked your curiosity. You looked through one of the windows to see two figures staring down eachother in the middle of a pileof fallen barely conscious adventurers. To the right, you saw a grizzled grey haired, slightly built (for someone his age) and battle scarred sea captain showing no fear as he smoked his pipe. Facing him was a figure nearly completely covered in a black cloak and cowl, wielding two long exotic-looking blades, one in each hand, stained with fresh blood from their victims. Most of her was covered, but part of her head showing looked human, with black hair with little red streaks, and silver eyes with black slanted pupils. her long-nailed hands had shiny silver scales and you could see a long scaley silver tail sticking out the back of her cloak!

"H...H...HOLY CRAP," you whispered in horror, "IS THAT.... A DRAGON?!"

"Captain Nathaniel Razor Carpenter," she spoke perfect english despite a hint of scottish dialect in her accent, "you stand accused of violating Rule #321 of the New Asun Code of Conduct. Do you or do you not still own idols and artifacts relating to the banned worship of the pagan false god, Zados?" Oh crap. Somebody STILL practicing that strictly outlawed religion?! That's a death wish under New Asun law!

"I am a true blooded follower of Zados's Word," the captain didnt so much as flinch when he answered, "no law has changed that. Nothing will."

"You know the rules," the hooded woman warned, "any and all idols related to Zados worship must be seized and destroyed immediately!"
Captain Carpenter took a puff from his pipe and sighed, "I am sorry, Hera. But I will do no such thing. You cannot ask me to abandoned my principals."
Hera pointed her sword to the pile of fallen fighters, "Take a good look at those around you! These foolish warmbloods couldnt stop me from taking your head! Nothing at this point can save you except for you swallowing your blasphemous pride and doing what youre ordered!"

"You think I'm afraid to die, lizard?" the captain crossed his arms
"Captain, please! Just throw away that stupid doll!" one of his sailors begged.
"You heard your warmblooded servant," Hera spoke, "take it out and burn it. And I will leave you and your precious port be."
But the captain stood his ground and repeated, "I will do no such thing."
"HIIISSSS!!!" Hera actually hissed in anger, "would you rather I burn the rest of this damn port instead?!"

Geez! It looks bad out there! As a self-proclaimed hero, you couldnt just stand there and let Hera kill him and quite possibly burn down the port! You had to do something! Anything!

But you dont have a weapon that can take down a dragon!! And if those fairy tale stories told you anything, dragons are one of the most powerful monsters in existence... second/third only to fallen angels and death machines from the future!
You sweated like crazy thinking what to do.
