13311.content:
You almost rush out there wth just your wooden sword, before quickly catching yourself.

That would be a bad idea. You can't cut wood with your fairly dull sword. Monster girls are one thing, but solid materials are another. You'll need something more sharp or with more force behind it to properly destroy that thing.

You quickly glance around the shop for a weapon to grab, and three glimmers catch your eye, though two are at the back of the shop, and you can't see them quite well...

So? What do you choose?
13311.title: Sneak out and destroy the idol

choices: A naginata with a long, curved blade that looks razor-sharp
A gleaming, beautiful silver dagger with a sapphire embeddd in the cross-guard
133112.content:
(I am so sorry for this one-liner, but I don't have a basic membership, and this is this is the only way I could do the three-part choice I had in mind for this chapter. Again, I'm really sorry.)

Scooting a little closer to the back of the shop, you can make out the two other weapons whose glimmers caught your eye earlier.

Which one do you choose?
133112.title: One of the two weapons at the back of the shop

choices: Make a mad dash for it.
1331121.content:
Not wanting to waste any more time for risk of people getting hurt, you grab the naginata and slip out of the back door of the shop, going around the building until the idol is directly in your line of sight.

Now, you have two ways to go about destroying the idol. Do you continue sneaking towards your goal, being careful to make as little noise as possible? The captain's back is turned, so you'll be out of his line of sight...unless he senses your presence, and from what you've read about hand-to-hand fighters, they have increased senses, as well as a sixth sense that lets them detect the "aura" of living creatures. Masters of hand-to-hand combat are even said to have strength and skill that allows them to stand on equal footing with all but the strongest monster girls. But he can't be that skilled...can he?

The other choice, of course, is to abandon all manners of stealth and make a mad dash for the idol. Sure, the captain probably has at least pretty good reaction speed, but he'll likely be distracted by the dragon to do anything about any presences behind him.

So? What do you do?
1331121.title: The Naginata

13311212.content:
You rush at the idol with all the speed your young legs can muster, your surprisingly light naginata trailing behind you.

The captain whirls around in surprise, but your blade has already whirled over your head, slicing cleanly through the idol with a satisfying CHOP.

You let out a breath of relief that you didn't know you were holding, not fully believing that your plan actually worked.

"Holy shit..." one of the sailors breathed.

It was then that you became aware of the hundreds of pairs of eyes staring at you in shock, wonder, and, for some, appreciation.

Your felt your face heating up in embarrassment. You were never good at speaking to large groups of people.

But you could at least do your best.

"E-Everyone!" You shouted, immediately wincing at your stutter. "O-Or, um, I guess just you two. Erm, the Captain and Miss Dragon, t-that is."

"Um, as you can see right here," you say, gesturing at the idol that was sliced cleanly, almost perfectly in half, "the, uh, idol has been destroyed, s-so there's no reason to fight anymore, I think...S-so could you stop fighting? Um, please?"

Agh, why is talking with people you don't know so hard!?

The captain and the dragon lady look at each other. Sparks seem to fly between the two, before they nod at each other.

The captain lowers his fists, and the dragon girl retracts her claws.

"In accordance with the Civilized Monster Girl Code of Conduct, Section One Page Five, as the source of the issue has been dealt with, there is no more reason to fight, and therefore, all fighting a monster girl-that is, myself - shall cease immediately. Your city is safe."

You and everyone else stood there in shock for a solid five minutes or so, before wild cheering broke out. The dragon girl snorted softly in satisfaction, while the captain walked over to the broken pieces of the idol.

"I'm, uh, sorry about your idol, Mister Captain, Sir."

The captain ignored you, reached into his pocket, and brought out...was that a sardine? Gross. He then turned to the ocean, and chucked the sardine into the sea.

A mermaid leaped out of the water, flipped several times, showing her gleaming blue scales off to the world, and caught the fish, waving happily at the captain before diving back into the water.

"Blue, huh...?"

Slowly, a small smile made its way across the captain's face. He then turned to face you, and you felt intimidated by the large figure looking down on you, smiling though he was.

"It's alright lad. Turns out you did the right thing." He picked up the pieces of the idol and gave them to you. "S'pose milord's tryin' to tell me that I gotta keep my faith here," he said, gesturing to his heart, "rather than here," he finished, pointing at the pieces of the idol that were in your hands-or rather, arms, seeing as how you were clutching them to your chest, the other hand holding the naginata.

"And in any case," the white-bearded sailor grinned, "Brief though it was, that fight was one of the most enjoyable ones I've been in in years."

"As it was for me," a voice came from right behind you, making you jump in surprise, whirling around to face the dragon girl that had somehow appeared directly behind you.

"Ah, my apologies for startling you," the girl said, bowing. "But, as I was saying earlier, I agree. You are quite talented...for a heretic."

"As are you...for a zealot," the captain retorted good-naturedly.

"Perhaps we could continue our battle another time?" She offered.

"Sounds like a plan." The captain replied. "'Course, it'd have to be somewhere outside of civilization. Don't wanna hurt innocent people, now, 'else we might have to have this young lad step in again," he added, ruffling your hair at the end to accentuate his statement.

"Naturally," the dragon girl replied. "And speaking of this 'young lad,'" she added, kneeling down to be at your eye level, "According to Rule #53 of the New Amun Code of Conduct, as a civilian selflessly helped to resolve a problem that they were not directly associated with, a reward is due for your actions." She left off putting a hand to her chin in thought.

You wanted to protest and say that you aren't a civilian, you're a hero, but before you could get a word in, the dragon girl lifts up a finger.

"Ah, yes, that will do. You weapon, please?"

You hand her your naginata and take the moment to pack up the pieces of the idol you've acquired, watching the dragon girl mutter some words under her breath, causing the naginata to glow white for a few moments, before the glow fades away.

"Here," she says, handing you back your weapon. "I've enchanted it. Kids like you tend to like magical weapons, yes?"

Ignoring the remark about you being a kid, you inspect the naginata. "What spells did you put on it?"

"Just a few minor spells," the dragon girl admitted. "Self-Maintaining, Eternal Sharpness, Stone Slicer, Unbreaking...I'm no enchanter, but I do know a few of the more useful spells of that school of magic. The most powerful one I know is Unbreaking, which I naturally added to your weapon. Ah, and it does have an Auto-Return spell cast on it, so if it's ever knocked out of your hands, you can call it back at any time."

Your mouth was wide open at this point. That was a lot of enchantments! Guess now it's time to learn how to use polearms...

"Ah!" You exclaimed, bowing deeply. "Thank you very much, Miss Dragon!"

"Please, call me Cynthia," she replied, waving a hand. "Miss Dragon feels too generic."

"Thank you, Miss Cynthia!"

"You're very welcome," she replied, beaming right back at you.

"Well," the captain began, "I don't have any fancy magics or anything to give you-I mean, I have things I consider treasures, but they ain't anything you would consider valuable-at your age, at least." He then puffed out his chest and pointed his thumb at himself. "But what I do have are my memory-" he tapped at the side of his head, "-and my good name: Captain John Carpenter. Should we ever meet again, and you need help of any kind, I and my crew'll try to help you out the best we can." He knelt down so he could whisper in your ear. "And if you ever get into a fight with one of the many water monster girls out there, tell 'em you're a good friend of Sehdrinn. It'll help you out, trust me."

You nod at the captain and thank him as well. He rises up and turns to his crew. "Come on men, off we go!" The men cheer and pile on to the boat, and Captain Carpenter ruffles your hair again. "You're definitely a special one, lad. I hope we meet again." And with that, he turns back and boards his ship.

You wave at the sailors until their ship disappears over the horizon, and then turn to face Cynthia.

"He's right, you know," she says. "There is something special about you. I'm not entirely sure what it is, but it's there." She smiles. "I hope we meet again as well-all of us. That way you can keep us from getting too out of hands when we fight again." She spreads her wings. "Take care, child, and good luck." And with that, she soared up into the sky.

Well, that was exciting, and you definitely felt a thrill when the people started cheering. But it was getting late, and you really wanted to crash at the local inn.

However, looking at the naginata in your hands, you feel bad for stealing it. You only intended to borrow it for a little while, but now it's enchanted to automatically return to you. You feeli like you should go apologize to the blacksmith before heading to the inn.

But on the other hand, you don't think anyone saw you steal the naginata, so you could pass it off as it having been yours the whole time...Maybe?

In any case, it's quickly growing dark, so you may want to decide quickly what you want to do before it gets too late-at least, if you want a restful sleep.
13311212.title: Run, Hero, Run

choices: Drop your sword and start licking.
1332.content:
Any normal sane man wouldve stayed in hiding and not risked their ass in vain against a powerhouse that your folks used to tell scary bedtime stories of. But you were no man. You were a boy! And an abnormal insane boy that strives to become a hero wouldnt sit around and let innocents suffer! But even if you might have even the teensiest tiniest chance of winning a fight against a dragon, you still had to find a way out of this weapon shop first. What with the place being barricaded due for the staff's safety as well as your own, it's not like theyre gonna let you out just cuz you say so!

You quickly look around for an alternate way out. The front doors were blocked as were the windows. You notice a small window behind the bulky man at the counter in the room marked 'Employees Only'. That was isnt barricaded! Since youre pretty small yourself, you reckon you could squeeze through that tight space.

"I will ask you again, human," you heard Hera threaten the captain, "I'm going to give you to the count of three to hand over your idles of heresy!"
"You can give me to the count of 100!" you heard the captain snapped back, "I'm not giving them to the likes of you!"

While everybody was too distracted by the action outside, you make a quick dash past the big guy and dart to the small window.

"Kid, what are you doing?!" the manager shouted, "get back here!" You ignore him and squeeze through that small window, "Kid, youre gonna die out there! Andre, stop him!" The big guy rushed to try to drag you out, but he was too slow and you were too agile! With one quick squeeze, you were out of the weapon shop!

"ONE!!" Hera roared.

You ran as fast as you could toward the dragoness and the captain. You realize last minute that you forgot to get a weapon, but thankfully RIGHT on cue, you spot a perfectly good unused sword aside a fallen unconscious soldier. It was a little heavy, but thanks to all the practice swinging you had, the weight was no problem for the likes of you.

"TWO!!" Hera roared.
"C'mon, sir! Just give her the damn doll! It's not that big of deal!"
"Watch your tongue, Simon!" Carpenter snapped.

Youre almost there! Quick, get their attention!

"THREE!"
"L-"

"!!!" you didnt even get to finish the shout before the monster in the cowl twitched in her head, as if sensing something nearby! Before you so much as blink, the figure in the cowl zipped around and pounced at you! You could barely see the shocked look on the Captain Carpenter's voice for a millisecond before the cowl came down on you!
"Yipe!" you let out a yipe and fell on your face as you felt your throat between two incredibly sharp blades that could no doubt slice yours into metal confetti! Hera's slanted pupils widened with surprise and intrigue as they glared down at you!

"Another hero, hm?" the rage in Hera's voice lightened, as if slightly joyed that another warrior dare challenge her.
"L...L...Let the captain go!" you stuttered, barely keeping a grip on your sword. You almost gulped when you felt the blades press a little closer to your neck!
"Youre a little young to throw your precious life away," Hera spoke, "so young... and youre raising such a nasty weapon against a messenger of the Queen?"

You gritted your teeth, but because of the swords, you dare not say anything out of fear you might cut your neck on them! It was tough enough trying to breath without moving your throat muscles too much!

"Obviously such rebelliousness comes from bad parentage," she continued, "how shameful of your miserable species to train your own kin to sacrifice their lives so meaninglessly!"

"Hera! Your battle is with me! Leave the child out of this!" Carpenter shouted in your defense, but to no avail.

"My battle is with all who show such disrespect to the Queen," the dragoness remarked, "obviously this whole cursed city seems to walk over the generosity that her Lordship greatly provides." She lowered her blades from your throat. But just when you were about to be relieved, she continued, "...And even worst of all, they teach their own children at such a young age to defy order!"
You wanted to say something, ANYTHING, but at that very moment, you couldnt get a single word out. All that built up courage, determination, and adrenaline you had only an hour or so ago vanished without a trace. For the moment, you were at the mercy of this dragon. For this moment, you were no hero... just a victim.

Hera could smell your fear. You could almost see her salivating under the guard. You wouldnt be surprised if she wanted to sink her jaws into you! Worst time in history to get slowly drawn in by her pheromonal scent! You didnt wanna think sexy thoughts out of fear she’d tear them out of your brain wrinkles, but it was too hard.

She squinted her reptilic eyes as she gazed with pure intrigue.
She stepped closer and you stepped back, until she put the edge of her blade to the back of your neck! You stopped right before you could draw blood from it!

“Little boy…” her voice sounded slightly less intimidating as she extended her leg, “lick my feet.”
“W-w-what?”
“Lick my feet, child,” she spoke generously, “and I promise I wont kill you.”

You tried to keep your cool and not look down at her foot, but your brave façade was broken. You were getting the jitters, the sweats, the flashbacks of highlights of your life… you were a cornered mouse hopelessly wielding a twig against a big bad hungry rattlesnake! If you couldnt so much as slay this high ranked knight, what in your right mind makes you think you'd stand a chance against the Witch Queen?

“There’s nowhere you can run, child,” Hera spoke, “I’ll gut you before you so much as get a yard away from me. I will only offer you this one chance to give up your foolish fantasy as a Hero and accept your true fate. Drop your sword and lick my feet.”

What will you do?
1332.title: Dont start what you cant finish...

choices: She decides to overlook the Captain's idols, in exchange for you.
She suddenly throws her sword, killing the Captain, and makes you a example.
13321.content:
You can feel the sweat running down your entire body, but the just past your own personal grim reaper you see a mother cowering with a child cradled in her arms. It reminds you of why you crawled your way out that window and into what was probably your inevitable doom, to save what little innocence there was left in the world. So, you keep your sword up and stare at her.
         Slowly, you bring the sword to the back of the dragoness's, where they are crossed, and pull the swords. Her cold, sadistic grin changes as you tighten the swords grip on your throat, then you speak up.
         "I have a reason to fight. It is not for my own gain, but at the same time... It makes me feel like I belong in this world, like I was born for a reason... Again, I have a reason to fight... Do you?"
         The dragoness just stares at you. Her face void of emotion as a trickle of blood leaks down your neck. All you can do is look at is the woman on the other side of the road and pray that this woman before won't slit your throat.
         The dragoness emotionless mask breaks, showing a crooked grin, and she begins to chuckle. Soon, she drops her blades from your neck and just stands there. Laughing, just laughing.
         Even the Captain was thrown off-guard, then...
13321.title: Speaking Up

choices: Death and hope that the village can defend it self.
133211.content:
She let's out a quick laugh and closes in on your face you could feel her hot breath it had a rather pleasant but smokey smell and looks you dead in the eye.
" I like you not many men have the brass to challenge me head on and declare such a fool hardy line! I'll make a deal with you come with me and be my personal slave and I'll leave this man and his heretic town alone. She narrows her eyes and you glance at the old man standing in the distance.
"Or..." She says i can finish you off here and I'll be on my way. ill hold up my end of the first bargain but I will be back, it should give them enough time to think about what they have done so how about human? You glance back at the old man who gives you a stern look. You think about the pros and cons of each. Mulling it over there's really no way you can refuse she has you where she wants you and could easily end the fight...
133211.title: She decides to overlook the Captain's idols...

choices: Scream it loud in her face!
133212.content:
She does not stop laughing. That's typically a good sign, right? Maybe she's the bold hardass type that's always serious and never laughed a day in her life and her body aint used to a silly thing called 'humor'. Regardless, it IS a good sign, isnt it? Maybe it's sort of a sign that you somehow moved her. Youre hoping that maybe she admires the way you've stood up to her despite having little to absolute zero chance of defeating her and decides to let you go.

"Hahahahah...." Hera put her somewhat scaley hand to her forehead and continued chuckling, "...haha hAHAHAHA! *SNOORT!*" Holy crap. Did smoke just come out of her nostrils when she snorted? "HAAA HAHAHA!!!" she tilted her head back and laughed hard. You gazed horrifically at the set of big shiny razor sharp jaws and long forked tongue barely concealed behind her veil! "Hahaha!! Do I have a reason to fight? Do I... have a reason... to fight?"

Oh dear. Her aura was intensifying even more than earlier. Even some of the surviving knights gave frightened stares at her.

"DO I!" not even looking back, Hera chucks one of her swords over her shoulder... and the flying blade stabs Captain Carpenter right in the chest! "Captain!!" his fellow sailor rushed to his aid, practically clueless out to save their boss while a sword is stuck incredibly deep into his body.
"HAVE A REASON!" Hera threw her other sword right over your head... decapitating one of her own knights a ways away! The dragoness, not giving a ratgirl's ass that she's now unarmed, continued glaring down at you with enlarged slanted pupils and a humored smile.
"TO FIGHT?!" she pulled down the hood of her cloak and undone the ponytail, letting her black hair coated in red streaks down. It took an awful lot of courage to look past her to see the Captain's fellow mates try to resuscitate him while carefully removing the sword, but he was losing a lot of blood really fast. Looks like you not only failed to save the Captain, you've expedited his untimely end!

Worse even, his murderer had her undivided attention to you.
"Such bold ARROGANCE!" she chuckled as she removed her veil... her lovely serene face tarnished by the sadistic reptilic grin, "From simple prey!" You began to back away as her scaley clawed feet scratched through the ground she stomped on. "A delicious little baby mouse with a tongue so fowl! How INTERESTING."

Through the corner of your eye, you could see that poor mother hiding behind shattered debris, hoping she wont be spotted by that unstable dragon descending on you.
"Brave little HERO! *snort!*" she ended her sarcastic commented with another smoking snort, "I DO have a reason to fight!" She undone her black cloak revealing her thin but slightly muscular body clad in a dark sari dress with several little shiny jewel decorations and little insignias of the Witch Queen Empire. Most of her body looked humanish despite a little too pale skin and even paler colored white scales. You really REALLY tried hard not to stare at the way her hips swayed invigoratingly as she walked to you, but even the long smooth yet scaley tail behind her swayed just as energetically.

“My reason is to purge this world of such disgusting arrogance in the face of Law!” big white scaley dragon wings ripped out from Hera’s back. Somehow the two swords seemed less threatening. “and to see such arrogance against Law spouted from an adorable little baby mouse-”

You barely had a microsecond to see the lightning fast uppercut which sent you flying like a football through a goal Plenty of dirt and grass was there to break your fall as you landed with a roll!

“I expect such tongue from these disgusting rat men!” even as you lifted your face from the dirt, you could hear her clear as day! Like the world suddenly gone absolutely silent! You gazed up at the sky to see the dragoness high above you with her wings spread out wide!

“But from an adorable little mouse pup…”

You quickly rolled out of the way of her foot dive… her claws ripped right through the earth that was beneath you! Such is the might of a dragon

“It makes…” she began to twitch as she panted, “something… inside me… BOIL!!!” Like in those old fairy tale stories come to life, with one deep disgruntled exhale, a huge burst of sheer flame erupted from her mouth! Unbelievable. The stories were true. Despite narrowly avoiding the outrageously hot breath of fire, you froze up at the sight of the charred earth and corpses devoured by the flame!

The horrible realization of truth came to mind. If you want to be a hero, THIS is what youre up against! THIS is only a small fraction of what youre up against! Could you honestly stand up to this kind of threat and still call yourself a hero?

Hera snorted again, emitting smoke from her nostrils and kept smirking your way. The next split second a few hundred pounds of scales, claws , teeth, and insanity lunged at you, causing you to tumble in the dirt again. This time, when the roll ended, you found yourself pinned to the ground by your dragoness adversary straddling you! The mixture of incredibly hot flame and potent pheromone tortured your nostrils!

Her claws dug into your arms, resulting in only pain should you dare budge them! Her long slimy tongued licked up the runoff from your bloody neck!

“Ask me again, Mouse pup!!” she panted with anticipation, breathing hot smoldering breath in your faces, “ask me again if I have to reason to fight!" You wanted to tremble, but even that took some nerve and your nerves were shot! Part of you wanted to crawl into a little corner and hide there for the rest of your life. But in your head, you could still see that mother and her baby.

"Do it!" Hera practically begged you to push her further, "Please do it! Do it do it do it DO IT!”
133212.title: Dont Rock the Dragon

choices: Hera rolls off you choking from laughter, she never expected you to speak up.
1332122.content:
The feeling of fear and a dragoness's weight crushing your will to do anything. The smell of smoke blowing into your face and drowning the sound of cries somehow. The sight of sadistic smile and harsh eyes bearing down on you. You're helpless.
         Slowly, you open your mouth and try your best to speak. Nothing comes out. Nothing. The dragoness's smile grows even wider, showing how such a charming face could be twisted beyond recognition by an evil grin. Laughter began to hiss from in-between her razor teeth in the form of smoke, she knew she had broken you.
         Hera began to inhale air, preparing the scorch your existence from the face of the planet. You could see the light behind her teeth building up, as well as the smoke oozing out of her face. Your life was about to end.
         Smoke drifted from the flames building in her mouth and into the sky. You looked away from Hera's face and to the sky you could see the bright blue outshining the smoke's darkness. It is really beautiful. The one though that you have right before your death. The sky is really beautiful.
         "Do you have a reason to fight? Do you?" You paused and took a deep breath, then went off.
         "IF SO, KILL ME!!! DO IT!!! IF YOU REALLY HAVE A REASON!!! SEND ME TO FUCKING HELL!!! YOU COLD HEARTED LIZARD BITCH!!!{/b}" It felt like your throat was ripping as you roared your final words into her face, spitting blood into her face as you began coughing from the smoke.
1332122.title: A Warrior's Cry

13321221.content:
Any other rational sane monster would most likely tear your throat out for hacking blood in her face or at the very least smacked you around a few times. But this dragon was all kinds of special! She didnt even so much as wipe the blood off before she started cracking up again! Honestly however, you were having doubts that you were in a safer position with her than any other monster girl with a short temper!

"*Snort!* HeeeHAHAHAHAAHAHAA!!" suddenly, the big badass dragoness harshly rolled off you (which the intense weight and friction almost fractured your ribs!) You cringed in pain, but it quickly subsided after paying too much attention to Hera rolling on the ground laughing her scaley ass off! Her forked tongue rolled out of her mouth as she laughed and laughed.

"HAHAHA! AGAIN!!" she shouted with intensity, "AGAIN, the mouse pup shows such arrogance! Hahahaha! Interesting... most interesting! More mouse MORE!" Hera roared with impatience and excitement... which made you feel more and more weak and timid deep down, "SHOW ME MORE OF THAT DELIGHTFUL ARROGANCE!!!" Oh good god, she's crawling toward you with that barely-veiled creepy reptilic grin on her face, "I want to feel the harsh breath of that fowl tongue blow blasphemy in my face once again before I chew it off!" You almost gasped in horror that she's getting such a thrill out of your outbursts! Do ALL dragons have this sick mindset?!

But you've come this far! You cant back out now!
'Fear is the mind killer,' you think to yourself, 'fear is the mind killer.'

You swallowed hard and looked the dragoness right in the eyes once again, staring hard at your glaring reflection.
"I bet I know what your REAL reason to fight is, you cold-hearted, slimy, filthy, big-nosed, high-and-mighty, hyena in dragon scales!" her fellow knights let out gasps as Hera's smirk widened. "Your reason to fight is just like your reason to live: ...to lick the cunt of your precious QUEEN!!"

...Queen! ....Queen! ...Queen! the echo of your roar could possibly be heard for miles.

"HERA!! THERE!! IT'S BURNED!!" just then a sailor cried out to the mad dragoness as he dropped a doll into the fire of a burning corpse."We burned the heresy doll, ok?! It's done!" The dying Captain gazed in horror at the sight of his precious little cute female templar plushie burning. Before it completely burned to shreds, you read the stitched wording on it's stomach. 'Happy Birthday Daddy! Zados Volt! Love, Nina'

Oh damn. So THAT'S the reason he refused to burn it.

Hera finally stopped laughing. Her laughing fit didnt gradually dimmer, it just stopped instantly. Like someone flipped Hera's switch back to 'Cold, serious badass'. If some random bystander just popped up out of nowhere to witness, he'd never believe this cold stern dragoness had a psychotic giggle fit!

She stood back up and dusted herself off. "You couldve saved yourself a dozen soldiers and a thick-headed captain." She picked up the sword that beheaded a fellow knight of hers and said a quick prayer for her. One moment she didnt give a damn she killed her own subordinate and the next she's praying for her soul to find rest! She then stepped toward the panicking sailors gathered around their captain with her other sword sticking into his rib! An eerie silence except for silent jittering.

"You may keep that blade," Hera generously offered, "it should afford your captain a proper funeral." You gritted your teeth at this beast of a female but only until she turned her attention to YOU again!
"As for YOU..." you froze up when she zipped only inches away from you! "you are now known to me, mouse pup." She sniffed the sweat from your forehead, "Your SCENT is known to a Commandant of New Asun and esteemed messenger of Queen Morgana I. I would suggest you rethink your 'reason to fight' while you still have a life to live." They were words of advice you would not forget until the day you die. EVERYTHING you have just witnessed in this city is something you would not forget until the day you die!

Stone cold, you were as you gazed while Hera extended her wings again, let out a loud high-pitched reptilic shriek and she and her fellow knights ascended into the air. They flown off, abandoning what was left of the city. No experience points were gained. Just painful memories that would linger.

“You! Boy!” one of the sailors aiding his fallen captain shouted to you, “C’mere!” You were still a little froze up for a moment. “Now!” You ran to him like a good boy.

The sailor looked to Mr. Carpenter. Despite his terrible condition, the captain looked you square in the eyes as if he possibly moved by your speech and willingness to stand up to Hera. He let out a loud hacking cough and reached into his pocket.
He pulled out a silver stringed medallion with the symbol of the templars on it. According to what you studied from school, those medallions were worn by honorary members of the Resistance. With a shaking twitching hand, he was offering it to you.

“Help her…” his eyes turned to the remains of the burning plushie, “…please…” With his dying breath, he had offered you one hell of a life-changing invitation. If you were still bent on being a hero, this would be a both a great step forward and a huge risk on your life. It wont be long before the Witch Queen knows of you and your fate aint gonna be a pleasant one if she knows youre on the side aiming to destroy her! Then again, with the help of the posse that Mr. Carpenter’s daughter is a part of, you just might be able to destroy her.

SPEAKING OF WHICH, how exactly are you gonna explain to Nina the fate of her dad?
13321221.title: A Dying Man's Last Wish

choices: Its one of the sailors who brings you a uniform with the medallion sticking out
Its a older women with some food for you and some hot tea.
133212211.content:
You walk over to where old man was and kneeled done taking the medallion in your hands. With his dying breath he tells you to give Nina a message, a simple but endearing "I love you and your mother would be proud." Grasping his hands you gave him a silent nod, with that the once admired soldier rested his head done passed away leaving his men once and for all. The soldiers and soon the town gathered around where he was lifting him up and carrying him to the inn where they would begin preperations for his wake.
The sailor that had called you over walked up to and placed his hand firmly on you shoulder. "Son you have made quite a spectacle, and quite a powerful foe Mr. Carpenter was the only other man to ever gain her ire but not as much as you have. Listen I know that you must be tired from all of this but you should stay for the funeral."
" I think I will i.. I I'm not sure I could make the walk from here right now as is. If its not too much to ask..." Before you could finish you pass out in to his arms.
A little while later you awake as night rolls on through to hear what sounded like a eulogy being spoken. You lay there and listen not being able to move with your muscles aching from the fight. You manage to move out of your bed and move toward the window to see the funeral taking place you watch as the town one by one places flowers next to his body and the sailor from earlier places the on Mr. Carpenter's chest and the places his hands over the doll. When a knock at the door causes you to jump aching you even harder. "Come in" you say...
133212211.title: Take the medallion.

choices: You send back home and set out on the voyage..
Send back home and prepare yourself before anything.
1332122111.content:
The door opened quickly and you saw one of the older sailors walk in with a uniform, the medallion shining against the dim night light. You sat still and he set it on the bed. "I wish you luck.. when you depart." It sounded like some fear in his tone, you just felt fear for if you could win or not. "Thanks, I'll need it." He smiled some and walked out, closing the door behind him.

Taking the uniform you unfold it despite aching bad, it was a buttoned short sleeve and knee-length shorts with pockets on both.
Folding it roughly you put it under the bed, laying down back in bed aching horribly. Carpenter wanted you to tell Nina..
You fell asleep thinking of preparing for the fight ahead and not to give up, but the experience with the dragoness and what other powerful monsters awaited you made you fear for life.

In the morning you woke up and it was late into the afternoon, body aching not as bad, you were able to walk normally. Taking off your ragged clothes with your back and arms aching the worse, you slipped on the sailor uniform and went out to tell Nina what Carpenter needed to say.

Walking down the hall there were two sailors in the lobby of what looked like an inn. "Hey.." one got up and pulled out a scabbard & gold sack, "Got you a sword." You were shocked but not surprised to much, gladly taking the sword and sack.

"I'll win." That's all you said leaving the inn, determined to do this.

You'd attach the scabbard to your side and put the gold away, Carpenters old residence was visible just down the street where he passed away. Choking up and feeling some regret for hastening his demise, you entered the home to see a sailor walking behind a young girl, looking about nine. She saw the medallion and your face, her smile dissappeared.

"Nina, your dad has passed, and has told me to convey you this.."
You told her and she burst into a fit of tears, the sailor with her looked rather depressed. "At least.. you'll revenge for him." She let out between her fit, you just left the home and made way for the post office full with dread of what's ahead.
1332122111.title: Its one of the sailors who brings you a uniform...

choices: Deny them and rent a boat instead.
13321221111.content:
I walked into the post office and saw a elderly man leaning against the counter reading a novel, I approached him. "Excuse me-" He looked up, "Have you paper and a quill?" He smiled weakly and brought out a blank scroll, ink & quill from under the desk. "That'll be ten gold." He said as I'd start writing..

'To Malak, To Molly.
I've arrived at Linsolei and have aquired a real sword, but I ran into a dragoness. Sailor Captain Carpenter had his death hastened by my attempt to attack her, but has givin' me his Resistance medallion, so now I am determined to avenge his death and do the same to the Witch Queen.
Love Erik.'

A bit hasty, but good enough.
Sliding the scroll to him I opened my gold pouch and gave him ten gold, hastily leaving as he'd let the ink dry in the sun through the window. A few big ships were in dock with smaller merchant ones to, I'd approach a smaller Spooner with many green-vested sailors and start walking on.
"He'y there boy!" A masculine woman's voice, I didn't see her exit the ship's small under-deck.

Wearing a dark green short trench coat and same colored leather armor, buzzcut black hair and standing at nearly six feet, she looked like quite a warrior. "Hello, may I ask permission to stay aboard?"

"Sure, and what a feat we saw you do yesterday. None of us expect' that out of you..r name?" She had a slight Scott tone, "Erik." I said. "I'm Molisa, CREW!"
Four male & two female sailors quickly came down from setting the sails out and preparing to Saul somewhere.
"I am Konos." Said a bulky old-looking man in leather, then two scrawny rapier swordsman. "I am Jack, I am Mack, brothers if you cannot see." Molisa shot them a glance.

A four foot man was what I least expected, he had a small bow. "Lin." One woman looked disinterested & wielded a black greatsword, matching black eyes and metal armor, "Grace."
Another wore leather armor and armor helmet, as tall as Molisa. "Higen."

"Nice to meet you all, though we just met, I'd like to ask where you all are sailing to." I'd try to see if they were going somewhere I needed to go, Molisa looked curious. "We're all going to Kilofill to take part in a exploration effort, quest taker, judging from your appearance." Slowly nodding, this was a bi intriguing, she smiled wide. "Come with us, if we succeed- you'll get a cut of what we find and wherever you need to go as a favor."

The other sailors seemed to be in delight seeing their captain hiring a sellsword, it definitely would save me money in renting a boat I might never return.
13321221111.title: You send back home and set out on the voyage..

choices: Hope the ship can outspeed it!
133212211111.content:
"I'll gladly go." I replied to her, Molisa turned and hastily the crew did to. "Get to your positions sailors! With me Erik!" I quickly caught up to her, I'm a bit surprised I caught them before they're mission. Grace followed to as we went under the deck, having to walk through the narrow how to come to the steering room.
Opening a medal door, this room had medal covering everything except a bolted down steering wheel and bars, a wide window was barely above the water line but gave perfect view of the dock and ocean ahead.

-Nearly losing balance, the ship slowly started moving out of dock as Molisa took the wheel. "As a warning, many don't come back from Kilofill." So it's dangerous, I felt that already.
"Has anyone?" I asked. "Very few, ones that have warned of a coastal beast."
"Likely Scylla." Grace said after the captain, Molisa looked visibly uneasy, I thought.

The open ocean took vision and I stood still after the boat started sailing quickly, the window rising above the water as the boat started moving at what was probably thirty knots?
She slowly turned it East, the rest of Malal Island & my homes coast was gone in a few minutes. "It has to be a good half day at this speed." Molisa said as the wind carries the boat at a constant speed- then my stomach rumbled.

I barely ate a breakfast being so intent on sailing out. "May I ask for some food, captain?" "Grace-" Grace was quick to leave the room and go down the hall, vanishing. "I can believe my crew will vanquish this 'guardian!" She said suddenly and with fury, admirable. Soon the ship was sailing by more islands in the distance and soon to open ocean as Grace came in with a basket of fruit..

"The crew's eating, ones on lookout, all is good." She said somewhat stoticly, holding the basket to me after Molisa. I thanked her and took three apples, she walked out with the basket and vanished again.
"She isn't eating?" I asked Molisa, Grace was unlike any adventurer I've seen. "No. She's actually a magic-golem, barely has interest in food."

"For real!?" I blurted out, I couldn't even tell she was one! "Yeah! Had her since Asun was under the king.." she looked out at sea the entire time she spoke. "That history-" Grace came back In as she started without the basket, I was almost done with my last apple and just put the cores in my shorts pocket.
"Now we need to make new history by landing on Kilofill!" The sailing felt like minutes but the day had passed by nearly halfway, in the distance some spiked rocks pointed out from the sea.

"Feel anything Grace?" Molisa asked as the ship came quickly at them, alot stood ten feet out of the water. "Nothing big, shall I tell them to slow?" Molisa shook her head no while the ship bolted past the rocks, some were starting to point wildly around and the coast, cliffs with the same rocks.. the pointed inwards to a rapid wide river with smaller ones going off! No wonder many didn't come back, with what's left of boats, big & small, sticking barely to rocks..

"I sense something! Left!" Molisa jerked the boat right and I held onto the bar, seeing two massive, black scaled tentacles come and slam the boat between rocks!
I was thrown and didn't see it, but Molisa straightened out as Grace sprinted out of the room and the tentacles went under, it was painful to hit the medal.. got up though, I am not gonna let this Scylla defeat us!
133212211111.title: Accept the offer.

1332122111111.content:
I staggered to the door and the boat jerking left didn't help, almost falling at the wall as the ship barely missed a rock, the current flowing into another wide river, and it looked quick! "I'm going to fight it- off!" Fighting against the boats movements while entering the hall, "Tell Grace to distract it!" She yelled, I barely heard it coming up the stairs.

Konos- three tentacles approached the back of the boat and he jumped, he punched one to the side and barely landed on deck. Knocking it into the other as the third slammed into the boats right side, Lin was rapidly firing his arrows.. the boat nearly capsized from the impact and Mack flew off!
He was moving with the current as Grace ran to the right side, I ran over there and held tight to the side. "Grace, Molisa told me to tell you to distract it!"

Grace store at me blankly and nodded, I turned to the water and looked back to see a monolithic humanoid beast, it's six eyes stacked over eachother and it's arms turning into two huge tentacles bigger than the ship letting it gain speed!
It's lower body was countless smaller tentacles, the black skin color making her building sized teeth even more terrifying- damn!

"Mack! Try to swim back!" Jack yelled and leaned over the boatside while Migen climbed the sails, the upcoming jagged rocks and a downstream drop was visible, and this river just got bigger! "Ma..-k!" Lin turned to the other part of the boat while Grace sprinted to the front-
It all happened slow..
I unseathed my sword and charged to the front, the monolithic beast suddenly came up from under Jack and ate him whole. In the air for a second as Lin pelted it with a magical arrow, one of its massive tentacles flipped at the boat as the arrow hit it!

Digging my sword into the deck and holding tight, Migen attempted to steer the boat back on it's bottom as the Scylla slammed in the water, Mack flew off and Konos held onto a sail!
Grace was in front of the boat, somehow sliding on the water as her sword glew dimly!
1332122111111.title: Try to help Grace fight!

13321221111111.content:
..The water took my vision as the boat capsized, Konos dropped into the river and I barely held onto my sword, the raging current loosening my grip under the boat! I screamed in vain as the boat started to turn on its own, I tried looking under the water to see the light blue eyes of the Scylla zooming close in from behind-

My sword broke out of the wood and I was thrown underwater, seeing the massive Scylla rushing at me in my spinning state!
Reminiscent on my life at this moment, it looked like my life would be ended by this monster..!!
A rush of will hit me like a train as I held my sword in the water, the Scylla came at me bearing her rows of teeth and I aimed my sword-

The force from me holding my sword and digging it into her rough tounge made my arms feel like they fractured, a ear-destroying wail came from the Scyll-

...
It's mouth came closing in on you, the creature jerking it's body around in its shock, it ended up flattening you as you flew down the muscled gullet with its enraged state.

Bad End.
13321221111111.title: The boat capsizes!

13321221111112.content:
The boat stood sailing on its side for a second and Konos flung himself at the deck, Migen managed to angle the sails in time and Grace darted forward on the water, her boots transformed into ski's!
The boat slammed on its bottom and when Konos hit it with Molisa's steering, it jerked right and narrowly avoided a rock, Lin was yelling in fear and holding tight to the wooden pole before it all settled..

He aimed his bow forward and I yanked my sword out, seeing Grace wield the greatsword and the Scylla jumped out from the water-
A massive light accompanied a ear deafening screech as the sword sliced it's side open, the Scylla slamming it's body onto her as our boat soared right at it.

Lin fired an arrow at the Scylla's back, the glow from it pierced it's body- then the creature hit the boat and we went over it!
The speed we were at made the boat soar into the air, when it landed- "Grace!" Lin yelled, I ran to look over the boat and saw her skiing at us, her sword using a black energy to propel

It looked like the Scylla was injured as I saw nothing but dim blue eyes staring up at the ship, Migen jumped down as did Lin and Konos, running inside. Jack had already ran inside, seeing the rapids approach quickly with jagged rocks, I slammed my sword back in the deck, leaning over the side to catch Grace!

The ship flew over the rapids as she used the swords weight to make her fly at me.
Her weight made me lose grip, but she swung from my grip and demolished one of the rocks ahead. "Stay front!"

Running to the front, she climbed and ducked- the ship bounced high and I flew-- she grabbed my leg and lulled me down, the shop slammed on flat water..
Faceplanting the deck hurt bad, but what I saw was well worth it.
The river drained into a huge lake and the coast was visible, behind some massive vined trees. Looked like a abandoned stone pathway, seeing some stones there. "That was impressive." Had to say.

"Thanks." Nonchalant, the members came back up including Molisa, comforting a mourning Jack.. "Mack! DAMN Treasues!" He yelled, not much to say.. "Atleast we made it, it's good enough a cause." Yin said, Konos staying silent & Migen smirking some.. "Whatever.. let's continue." Migen closed the sails as we approached the shore quickly, then slowing, the boat softly landed mostly on the sand.

"Land ho!" Molisa yelled happily, despite the loss it still was a bit good to survive. Keeping my sword out however, this land is new, everyone had their weapons drawn when jumping on the sand.
I followed the same and saw a ruined path, I stood behind Lin and Konos behind me as Molisa led. "Grace, got something?"

We all slowly walked in. "Nothing, just a structure." Heading down the path, the sword dimly lit ahead and the sun, to. Many of the stones were covered with moss and the land grew, no trees on the path, everything felt ancient though.
"Cautious."
Over the hill was a long, vine covered stone wall. It had to be twenty feet tall, a massive hole surrounded dents in the stone and gave entrance to the weird ruined fortress, symbols etched the bottom.

We all walked down & through the hole, there was a center tower.
Torches were lit inside. "Still no auras." Molisa grunted, continuing in. Looked behind to see nothing around the corner but bushes..

Inside smelled like wet grass and wasn't pleasant. The hall split into hallways, one leading to stairs and the other turning right.
Molisa went down the hallway into the building, "Eerie place, seems kept up." The floor did barely have moss, the building was very quiet part from our footsteps. "Somethings here." Molisa said while the end of the hall opened into a circular room, a ring with some kind of altar met between eight even lines..

Roof had torches, illuminating images of ancient cyclops beast fighting against armies of men. The cities destroyed, and what looked like a god approaching them with a sword.
The rest obscured by foliage and two hallways, both turning right, I approached the altar. There was a dark blue liquid in there and barely any of it, it didn't move but reflected my face. Somehow.

"Erik! Come!" Molisa yelled, and touching the altar.. crazy thought to drink it.
13321221111112.title: The boat evens out!

133212211111121.content:
I dipped my head into the altar and sniffed it, "Don't do it.." Molisa muttered, I crazily decide to drink it. The texture is syrupy and it taste.. a bitter sweet, no chunks of anything. It didn't taste to bad, there was a decent bit in there.
My stomach roared, it felt weird and my chest hurt some. Dang, feel a bit light. "Idiot! Least your not dead.." I followed the group as they walked down.

"Why'd you drink that, Erik?" Konos asked me, glancing behind him, being alert. "I felt like I should." Was all I mustered, the feeling died down slowly.. the hall turned and was short.
Infront of us was a massive open room, pillars with weird inscriptions on them circled weird bone-looking spikes jutting out from the ground.
At the other end of the hundred-foot looking room was a bigger door, a complex mosque was somewhat covered by foliage.. Torches were lit.

"Anything Grace?"
"No-" (Credit to friend for idea)

Stepping into the room, the ground rumbled weakly and the middle began to crack. "Creature, stone!" I ran to the side as Lin went to climbin' the vines on the wall, Konos fanned on my side as Grace & Jack followed Molisa.
Whatever this thing was, it stood out from the ground and had white slots as eyes. It's body had a silver gleam, the tail had to be eight feet long and had four arched spikes at the tip!

"ASSAULT!" Lin fired a yellow arrow at the creature, a wide gash deflected it, the thing charing at Molisa. She jumped back as Grace swooped in with her sword, yelling as a flash of black light made the thing fly several feet away.
Grace had her armor blackened by the explosion, her face somehow unharmed. Lin pelted it from atop a pillar-

It's tail stood up before it, firing a barrage of light at Lin!
133212211111121.title: Drink it.

1332122111111211.content:
Lin jumped from a pillar onto another while firing at it, the thing focused on a attacking Grace while it's tail tracked Lin! Konos ran in from the side, I quickly sprinted past him and drew my sword-
Mack flew by and scraped it's eye to no e- blinding light!
Stumbling back, my ears rung as this thing roared and the ground shook, I jumped back and saw a arrow pierce it's leg.
It hit a specific spot, one where it lines sound the body.. it looked like we had a advantage over it!
"Strike the lined spots!" Molisa came swinging in and her sword glew dim, I ran at it to!

Swinging it's claw down at her, she chipped one claw off with her strike- my ribs felt almost broken- my breath was knocked out of me, I was hit into a pillar by the tail, it.. "Konos!" Molisa yelled, Konos's arm was shortened as the things leg was broken off by him and it's tail through his chest!

"Damn.." standing hurt, Grace swooped in behind it as it aimed at Molisa. Striking the rune connecting it's tail, it let off a burst of energy that knocked me and Mack down, who was circling.
Lins arrows deflected-!

"Charge!"
I stood my best and ran into battle though slower and aching alot, it screeched as everyone approached it. It ran after Grace, who despite the blinding light-!
She went flying into the wall as the explosion hit her back, the creatures eyes were cracked with its other leg crumbling..

Lins arrows missed and Grace was recovering, coughing horridly? "MOVE!" Molisa yelled looking at me. Being eight feet from it, it turned- swooped off my feet as she shoved me feet away, no!
Lin kept missing as its eyea shone, then Molisa's sword pierced it's eye.

My ears rung and my vision whitened, I felt- a rock pelted my chest. Did I go blind.. noa- ok, it's slowly fading-
Molisa layed under a chunk of its now-black eye, alot of blood.. more lost souls, surprise.
"My hearing barely came, but Mack and Lin were already close and Grace jogged over looking panicked.

"..Er..ik.."
"Grace.. wi..n-n."
She went pale and motionless, Grace ran over to her and knelt down, still a stotic look. "I won't fail."
Standing up and walking barely- "Erik, I follow you now."
Molisa gave Grace to me, why? Who knows..
1332122111111211.title: Help fight it!

13322.content:
Here you are, your first time away from home, and in under day you've managed to get yourself into this hellish situation. Pinned between two swords, your choices are either die or accept public humiliation and possibly eternal slavery. Your hot headed cockiness has completely melted in mere seconds, but you succumb nonetheless.

Your puny sword clatters against the cobbled street, the only sound in the now tense harbor, and every eye is upon you and the dragon. She allows a horrifically malicious grin to spread across her face, now lowering her swords to her sides, allowing you to drop to your knees. You take a large gulp, not daring to look her in the eyes. Your knees give way under her cold stare, and you fall in between her massive reptilian soles. The smell of sweat swallows you, but there's no turning back now unless you wish for an early death. A timid tongue eventually finds courage to explore the scaly tops of her foot, and barely holding back the urge to vomit and run away, you manage to work your way down to her toes.

"What a smart, smart human." She taps your head with the foot not being serviced and turns to face whoever hasn't gone into hiding yet. "Do you see this!? This is a merciful end to disobedience from your new rulers! If you wish for you and your loved one to live, you WILL obey!" She annunciates that last part by roughly flipping you and smothering you with her new foot. "What a good, smart human. Sniff, lick,serve." You can't see her face from underneath her massive sole, but you can only imagine a nasty smile with a glint of sadism in her eyes.

Before was bad, but now being underneath her was truly gut wrenching. The stench of work penetrated all of your senses, its damp and suffocating fumes sniffing out any resistance left in your already exhausted brain. Tears began to pour out of your eyes and you feebly started to raise your hands to push her off. Of course, this wasn't appreciated and she delivered a swift kick with her clawed toes to the side of your face. A gash was torn open and blood started to flow freely from your cheek, it's scent definitely started a whole new kind of frenzy in her. Her toes, hanging off your chin, now clenched and held you even closer to the bottom of her slick foot.

Upon the demise of your futile and small rebellion, you again poked out your tongue and started to explore. What were small beads of sweat made your tongue recoil with great speed, their saltiness and putridness casuing decimation upon your taste buds. She felt this and a small moan finally escaped her huge frame, taking you and everyone in earshot off guard.

She swiftly recovered and coughed. She kicked you out from under her, and you came to a sitting pose a couple of feet away. In a voice loud enough so hat everyone could hear it she began to speak. "Now, tiny human, do you still feel the need to rise up against the rightful owners of this world?" You shook your head quickly, wanting this to be over as quick as possible. "Good, good. Now, should the people give regular tribute to the monster girls of this regions as an apology for what happened here today?" You nodded before even thinking about what that meant, and with a cacklle, she threw her head back and came back with a look that froze you where you were. "Then the first tribute shall be you!", she moved towards you as quick as lightning and snatch you up in her powerful arms, "I will be back in a month to pick the next tribute! He will be for the amazing grizzly girls at the edge of town, they've been looking bored."

With that final damnig sentence to this poor port town, she held you tight and thrusted off the ground, flying towards the heavens. Once you were in the clouds, she started taking hungry glances at you, always quickly looking away when you noticed. After half an hour or so you had the bright idea of speaking up. "H..he...hey what are yo-". You didn't even get to finish because she dropped you, and you plummeted like a stone towards the ocean below. You started to scream and flail, your big mouth just got you killed. The bright blue that once spelled relaxation for you was now about to crush every bone in your body. You closed your eyes, hoping at least to die without knowing.

You began to feel flecks of saltwater hit your open wound, causing immense pain, just as two telephone pole like arms snatched you up and carried you along. "Don't ever speak up to me again! You are mine and I will do as I wish to you without question! Do you understand me!?" She looked deep into your eyes and after a moment seemed to get what she was aiming for. She stared at your petrified face for a moment until she snapped back into sadistic mode. Her tongue now was the one that left her mouth, finding its target on your salted wound. It lapped up the blood around your wound, causing both a sense of pain and of calm. Her body shuddered after finishing this, and you tried to turn away. A burst of red flame lit up your world as it made contact with your cut, sealing it with the utmost displeasure your nerves could comprehend.

A scream almost came out of you, but a hand clamped itself hard over your quivering self. "That will scar up, but it's healed. Consider it...a mark of property, slave." She drew that last word out with a long stroke of her tongue along your eyes. You cringed and she laughed, once again throwing you away from her. You didn't panic for long, your body roughly coming into contact with hard stone before tumbling down a hole. After getting a wall, you look around. It's a massive chamber carved in what can only be a mountain, its walls and floor covered in gold and treasure. Only a single path was cleared, and it led to an elaborate throne, behind it crudely fashioned room entrances. Your gaze went to go see where you came from,but she was upon you.

Being tackled by a dragon wasn't on your list of plans today, but you get thrown around like a doll regardless of what you want. She now studies you meticulously from her perch on your stomach. "Hmmm, yes you'll do. I was originally going to auction you off, but we'll see just how well we get along huh?" She extends one claw from her huge hand and drags it along your undamaged cheek, careful not to damage you now. "Erika, and you?" She stares in your soul through your eyes, daring a lie.

"E..er...Erik." You stammer out.

"Hm. No, footboy I like more. Follow me." She dismounts you and walks over to her throne, plopping down besides the protests from the age old chair. A chest of gold is grabbed by her foot and dragged over as a stool. You stupidly think it's for you, but she stretches herself across it before you can even get close. You suppress a sigh and kneel before her, already knowing what's she going to ask for. She smiles and points regardless. Her scaly soles are incredibly intimidating. Each toe ends in a claw that could kill you with ease, possibly centuries of filth form tiny hills between each of her toes, her actual feet slimy with sweat and grime from work and adventures. This is the first time you're properly seeing them, and it makes the whole experience much worse. You take a hard gulp before offering you face as a sacrifice to these behemoths.

She eagerly accepts and starts massaging herself with your face, her smell now forever intwined with you. It's nauseating, but you oblige, you've seen her mad and you're stuck thousands of feet away from society. Erika now moans and squirms freely, enjoying every waking moment of your humiliation between her reeking pair of twins. You get brief glimpses of her face from between the rubbing frenzy, and such lustful sadism strikes fear deep into you. Any hopes of escape become dashed, and she suddenly squashes with a sole. It drags you off the chest and pulls you in towards her.

You look up with a pit in your chest, her eyes glinting with playfulness. "See the entrance over there? I haven't closed it off for a special reason." She leans forward, her hot breath hitting your face in pants from her excitement. "You make it out of this cave and you have a chance at a free and new life. I'll even fully equip you if you make it, I've got a ton of armor and weapons here, dragons promise no tricks. Go ahead, stand up." You stand, weary of her. "I only needed to make an example out of you so the towns people would fear me. I mean, you would sweeten the deal, but I can get another one of you anywhere. The other girls on this mountain come by boys a lot slower than me though. Anyways, does this sound like a deal?"

You eagerly nod and stretch, wariness gone. "Okay then, one last to seal the deal and we'll be good to go." She smirks and extends a foot, rolling her ankle in a circle for added effect. "Big toe please, she feels like she hasn't gotten much attention lately." She scrunches her toes then splays them wide open. You nearly groan and pick her leg up to your level, giving a quick peck to it, setting it down, and getting a few feet away for any added advantage. She evaluates the situation with an expert eye before speaking. "Three, two, one, go!"
13322.title: Drop your sword and start licking.

133221.content:
As soon as she said go, you knew that there was no way you would honestly be able to reach that distance before she was upon you, so you dived to the left into a pile of coins. This took her entirely by surprise, and she tackled the cold, hard ground. You desperately looked for anything that could help you in the pile of gold rubbish. Coins, necklaces, a vase or two, rubies, diamonds, nothing, and then you found it. You grabbed the hilt of a small sword just as Erika grabbed onto your ankle and yanked you out.

You lay on your back, your armed hand still hidden under the dragon's wealth, staring up into the vicious eyes of your captor. She grinned a victorious grin, and you became unsure of your ability to win this game under her withering gaze. "Well would you look at that. Dumb human didn't even make it an inch, typical, but expected." She rolled her eyes and sat down on your chest with all her monstrous weight, crushing any air you had out of you. "It's really a shame, I know a whole family of pandas not from here. You could've made it in a day if you went straight west. They would've loved you. Instead you went straight back into my captivity." She drove the point in with a rough bounce on your chest, causing quite the cough from your little body.

Erika giggled as if she wasn't a century old dragon, but a little school girl. A toe rose to your face, danced its way across, and eventually returning to its original perch next your ear. It's unpleasant fragrance wafted up to your nose, causing utter discomfort on a primal level. She watched all this emotion play across your eyes with a far off, lustful look. Then, in a flash, the toe was brought back, this time the whole foot came with it. It completely encompassed your face, drowning out anything from the outside world when combined with the other foot, when she so graciously added.

You push away from the quickly fading behemoth before her corpse crushes you and stand up amongst the centuries old gold. Hey, maybe if the other monsters smell dragon on you they won't take you as their own. That's a positive thought and with that, you head out into the mountainside.

The coldness of the high peaks tear into your being, quickly sapping you of energy. You're nowhere near the top, nor nowhere near the bottom. Ten years had passed since that day. Thanks to your frequent love sessions, you and Erika had gathered a small army of about twenty dragon daughters, every single one you loved unconditionally. During their schooling, you told them about your rather brief adventure before meeting their mother. But then, something strange happened.

A couple of weeks after your latest romp with Erika, you had expected her to lay another egg to add to the family. But it never came. Instead, her belly started bloating, and continued to do so. There was only one conclusion you could come to.

She was pregnant... the human way. After the initial confusion of how this happened died down, you guided your wife through how this type of pregnancy worked. You stayed by her side while your daughters worked together to provide for the family. You held her hand up until the fateful day.

Finally, after nine months, Erika had given birth to... a boy?! And a human boy at that! Both of you, as well as your horde of daughters questioned this outcome, believingit impossible for a monster girl to give birth to a boy, let alone a human one. This was unheard of throughout history.

But, human or not, he was just as loved among you and your family as any of your daughters. Erika allowed you to give him the name Frederick since he was the only boy. While he was human, you soon found out that there was dragon blood in him, as he was much stronger than any human baby you'd ever seen.

*****

Almost two decades had passed since Frederick's birth. While his dragon blood made him stronger than any human, it still didn't put him over his dragon sisters, a fact they used against him along with the steep girl/boy ratio to always tease him. He still loved them, but he could do without constantly getting pinned by one of his younger sisters you had after him. But, there was one thing that worried you.

Like the others, you had told him about your adventure. But where your daughters cooed and awwed at the love story ending, Frederick was angry when you got to the part about abandoning your quest to start a family. He called you a coward for not seeing things through. He made his own vow to save his fellow humans from the monster queen's army.

One night, while everyone was asleep, Frederick got up and began to sneak around. Finding your old sword and armor, he dawned the gear and prepared to depart through the snow down the mountain, his dragon blood keeping him warm. Before he left though, he wrote up a note to you and the girls, apologizing for leaving, but saying he had to do this. With that, he began to trudge through the snowy mountain.

"The ruby ring will help you get off the mountain." Erika explains. "It's been enchanted by fire elementals, meant to be given to their slaves and lovers so they can withstand the heat they give off. As long as you wear that ring, you'll be immune to any extreme temperatures like the fire elemental home or even the snowy peaks of these mountains." Without hesitation you slide the ring onto your left ring finger. The effects are almost immediate as you feel your body's strength returning and the cold fade away.

"Thank you."

She wanted me to give it to my mate in case he ever got lost or was in trouble. Simply wear the ring and rub the stone, and I'll be able to hear your thoughts and know where you are. If you get into trouble or have second thoughts about your feelings for me, use it and I'll come find you." You can't believe she's giving something so personal to her.

"Are you sure you want me to have this? What if you ever find a mate other then me?"

"Then I'll find the witch that enchanted this one and get her to make me a new one. Oh right, one last thing. Here, to help you after you leave the mountains." She pulls out a medallion. It looked like one of those serpent-like dragons you heard actually co-existed with humans in the eastern lands, this one white as snow. It was coiling itself around a green gemstone that it held in it's mouth.

"This is a dragonstone." She continues. "Normally, it is meant to further enhance a dragon's natural abilities, but it turns out that if used by a human, it actually gives them watered-down versions of dragon anatomy. You skin will become more durable like our scales and your strength will increase tenfold. Some have even been said to sprout their own wings. It'll take more then a few orcs to stop you with this. Just clench the stone in your fist and it'll do the rest. You only get 30 minutes transformed however, then after that you have to wait 24 hours before you can use it again." You accept this along with the rings.

"Thank you for everything Erika."

"You're welcome. Remember what I said though, if you ever change your mind, just summon me and I'll come. Goodbye." She flies off, back towards her cave. So far you had taken two nasty kicks which may have cracked your rib and all you had to show for it was a cut on one of the seven Bunny Girl's legs. Things were not looking good for you at all.
133312212.title: Go down swinging!

choices: Cut down the evil Bunny Girls who tried to kill you!
Quickly leave before they recover their eyesight.
1333122122.content:
The stone you had looted from the fallen adventurer began to glow in your pocket. The glow actually permeated through your pants. What in the world was going on you wondered.

The Bunny Girls were also a bit wary as they didn't followup with another attack, instead they warily watched to see what the light would do.

A voice enters your head. The voice is confident, powerful and female.

"Your courage makes you worthy of my gift young adventurer!"

'W-what? What is going on?" You ask the voice inside your head out loud.

"I am an Angel Girl, a variety of Monster Girl from a plane higher then thine own. However I was slain by a pair of Dragon Girls who bested me, the stone is all that is left of me. It can grant a worthy wielder holy magics. I have been carried by adventures that I would not deign to grant this gift to. But you are worthy, your courage in the face of certain death is admirable and I will aid you."

You were shocked and stunned but grateful for the unexpected aid.

"First let us deal with this rabble, the first spell that I will teach you is Shining Light. Gather your thoughts and speak out the word of power I have given thee."

"Shining Light," you shout and bright light blazes the area with radiance. It doesn't hurt you but it blinds the Bunny Girls. The voice has gone silent for now and it looks like you have two options. You can quickly cut down the Bunny Girls or you can use the distraction to get away from them. What do you choose?
1333122122.title: The stone in your pocket glows strongly... what...

choices: Head to the village up north!
13331221221.content:
You werent stupid. Ok, you might be a LITTLE stupid, but nonetheless you learned your lesson. You were generous enough to give a crazed bunny girl the chance to flee for her life only to get ambushed by a whole gang of bunny girls in return! If you cut and run, they'll probably just send out MORE mean sadistic bunny girls after you! Hell, they might even get the attention of one of the Big Four and SHE'LL get involved just cuz there's a cute defiant boy pretending to be a Hero on the loose!
No siree Pete, you are not making the same mistake twice!

A tremendous power was surging through your arm. A power unlike anything you've felt that was of this world. Your hand began to twitch uncontrollably! At first you got a bit nervous that this unfamiliar foreign magic was emanating through your body, but the soothing voice that was allegedly the voice of an angel itself coaxed your tension away.
You trust your faith in the angelic voice until your hand stopped twitching and you found yourself wielding a long bright shining surge of divine energy like a sword! It wasnt a steel sword, but it'll do.

"Sorry, rabbit," you apologized, "I gave you the chance to flee. I cant afford to give you and your sisters another." You bring your arm back, ready to deliver the most epic godly swing of your entire partial adulthood! "THE BLADE OF PENANCE RELINQUISHES YOU!!"

*FWA-SHOOOOOOMMM!!!*

With but one single swing of the heavens, The Blade of Penance strikes not one, but ALL of the sinful rabbit girls in one blow! Though you saw not physical damage, their frozen timid expressions quickly changed to completely emotionless as you saw glowing auras emit become sucked from their bodies and into your arm! The strange feeling you had to absorbing these odd auras was beyond anything you've ever felt! It didnt necessarily hurt, but it didnt feel like something you could get used to anytime soon!

Immediately after the absorptions, every one of those bunny girls fell to the ground and their bodies morphed into little actual bunny rabbits! Did you just devolve them or something?!
Luckily for them, they didnt die. Upon realizing this and the fact that this dumb boy aint weak, each of those bunny rabbits scattered! Hopefully that'll teach 'em to bully humans!

The divine surging quickly vanished and the holy power was gone. You took a couple of breaths as you reflected on what just happened. You just took down a whole gang of monsters in one go!
"I... won..." you panted, "I won! I won!! I WON!!!"

You heard the angelic voice in your head clapping, giving you applause!

"Congratulations, child! You truly are worthy of the gift! The world is surely saved after all! Praise Zados!!" Ignoring the forbidden Z-word, youre still uneasy about what just happened.
"What was that, earlier?" you questioned the angel voice.
"What was what?" she asked.
"When I sucked up those glowing things from those bunny girls and then they turned into actual bunnies!"

"You have just consumed their soul energy," the angel explains, "it is the very essence drawing from within their very soul that makes them the beasts beyond what their natural animal brethren become." Kinda complicated, but you think you get the message... you know, because you werent stupid (or at least THAT stupid!).
"You mean I just sucked up their magic that's making them actual monster... people?"
"If that is how you wish to word it," said the voice, "this very energy you have consumed can also be used to make you stronger beyond that of any normal human being. In other words, their loss is your gain."
Now youre getting it, "So, I'm now stronger than I used to be? Does this mean I can take on the dragon that's attacking the port now?!"

"Eeeeeerrrrrrrrrrr...." she held that syllable for quite a long time, "...perhaps not! Hera, like the other generals of the Witch Queen, is quite a high ranking above any earthly monster girl." You shouldve figured beating a dragon wasnt gonna be easy. "Destroying her may require much more energy than you currently have."

"So I'm gonna have to slay more monsters to get on the same level as her?" Whelp, you made it your vow to defeat the Witch Queen. And if you cant beat a dragon, there is no possibly way you can slay the great Queen of Monsters herself. So for the time being, it looks like your role as a Hero will also double as an Exterminator.

Hero Erik the Great Exterminator! ...No, that name sounds stupid. Unlike you.

Eh, you'll think of a more fitting title later. Right now, you need to begin your extermination duty. Question is, where should you go?
You recall reading in a Help Wanted ad last night about a town up north that's having problems with child abductions by wild harpies. That's a good place to get your name known!
Then again, you can see a big fire coming from the direction of the port. Guess the Captain got too stubborn and Hera made good on her word. There could still be survivors in dire need of your help too!

Time was of the essence for our Hero! Where should he turn heroic heroicness towards?
13331221221.title: Exterminators be Exterminating!

choices: Climb a tree to get away from grown predators.
Hide out in a cave until dawn.

Even though they were bloodthirsty creatures killing them now seemed cruel. Instead you quickly dashed away clutching at your rib hoping it wasn't too damaged.

The voice coming from inside your head... err it sounded like it was coming from your head but it actually was coming from the stone you supposed. In any event the voice had stopped. Maybe teaching you the spell had sapped some of its energy? You couldn't be sure but right now you had to get moving.

You continue journeying away from the port town and darkness begins to descend on the land. It is getting late and you need to find a place to camp. Hopefully the evil Bunny Girls had stopped chasing you.

Where do you try to spend the night? In a cave or up a tree?

You decide the safest course of action was to climb a tree and cover yourself with the branches to blend in. Then you would get some needed rest and get to the mining town on the next day.

You climb up the tree nimbly and do a quick check to make sure there are no Monster Girls around and get some shut eye.

Of course you are interrupted before the dawn - but what interrupts you?

You didn't even realize that there were that many Bunny Girls in the area! What did they do? Breed like rabbits?

It was obvious they had spotted you as they surrounded the tree. What the hell were you going to do? You try to communicate with the Angel Girl stone but she doesn't respond. You have your one spell that you learned but you doubt you would be able to catch them all in it. The Bunny Girls are starting to climb the tree and you draw your sword.

"Back off! You might be able to kill me but I'll take a bunch of you down with me! Just go away!"

The Bunny Girls shout at you a mixture of threats and curses.

You start to sweat in fear as the first Bunny Girl's nimble body starts getting near your branch. They were trying to surround you so when they did leap at you they could come at you from all directions.

How were you going to get out of this mess?

Was there no reasoning with them?
