"If you wish to apologize to one you must apologize to all."

"OK fine I'm deeply sorry to all of you."

"FOOL!" She yells at you and the other Bunny Girls look angry.

"Apologizing to a Bunny Girl means cleaning her feet. Licking every bit of dirt, mud and filth from them."

Gross you think to yourself. But if you had to do it to survive you supposed that would be the better alternative. Oh but wait you needed to apologize to EVERY one of them? Crap there were probably a hundred down there.

"You mean I would have to clean every Bunny Girl's foot here?"

She laughed sadistically, "Yes arrogant man. Clean all of our feet and we will let you live but you must clean every Bunny Girl's feet that is here within 24 hours!"

This wasn't looking good at all you think. Cleaning that many feet would take time could you even do it in 24 hours? And then you had to trust the Bunny Girl's were dealing with you honestly. What would stop them from making the deal and then betraying you? And all that dirt and filth would probably damage your health. Could you even eat all of it? You feel nauseous and uncertain on what to do.

"Well human? What is your answer?"

When you are on the ground they order you to drop your weapons and gear. You obey as the massive group of Bunny Girls close in on you.

The stench stings your eyes and makes you light headed but you persevere and continue licking like a machine. You suck up dirt like a hoover vacuum you do your best to block out the humiliation and degradation and get on with it.

Finally after a terribly long period of time the foot pops out of your mouth and the Bunny Girl proclaims it is clean!

"Haha so you have one down human, now do my other foot!"

Her second foot is just as filthy as the last. Dirt and who knows what else is stuck to her foul smelling foot. You cringe inside as you realize it was going to be just as bad as the first foot. You briefly quail at the thought of licking another foot and realize that it won't just be one more foot but probably around 200 more! You give out a whimper and the Bunny Girls crow with victory.

"Aww does the pitiful human not like our feet?"

"Does it smell human?"

"You'll never make it worm!"

"I can't wait to kill you!"

Their taunts spur you on to keep licking. You won't fail their game! Your anger at their cruelty makes you redouble your efforts. You lick like a speed demon, taking off the first coating of dust in record time. Than you begin sucking and inhaling the dirty scum off the bottom of her foot. Your nostrils burn from their foul foot stench but you ignore it and plow on.

You are making quick process, though a few stubborn stains are well bedded in the soles of her feet. Lick, suck, suck, lick, lick. You swirl your tongue and consume dirt, dust and muck. You're on a time table and you cannot fail! You keep licking the foot and soon enough it is clean!

"I believe it is clean, bring on another foot!" You bold proclaim.

The Bunny Girl inspects her foot and smirks, "Not yet you still have to do underneath the toe nails!"

Ah crap you think that will be hard. The cruel Bunny Girl leader presents her toes to your mouth. You work on each one individually. Your tongue swishes back and forth trying to worm saliva underneath the toe nail to loosen up the grit. It is slow going but you manage to do it and soon even underneath the toenails is fully clean.

You realize it had taken you quite some time to do both feet and you were worried about achieving the 24 hour deadline. The next Bunny Girl presented her feet and you continue. You can but hope you will make it!

The smell... it was too much. You couldn't take it anymore.

You squirm underneath the feet pinning you down. You needed to breathe in clean air. Just one sip of something pure and toxin free. But every breath you take is just more of the foul stench that the Bunny Girl's feet were emitting. You longed for that one breath of air and then you could keep going. Just one sip...

You are delirious from the stench. You stop licking the filthy Bunny Girl Foot in your mouth. You try to speak and she withdraws her foot.

"Do you have something to say foot cleaner?"

"Please... I can't do it... please... no more..."

Your head strains to get away from the heavy musky stench of their feet. You wished you could move your arms and your legs but there were too many feet pressing you down.

"You were apologizing human. Continue or die."

"Please, you know I can't do it. At least turn off your stench. I don't want to die."

You were beginning to cry now. You realize you were helpless beneath the feet of the Monster Girls. You couldn't believe how arrogant you had been. You were just one man. How could you have ever expected to succeed? All you wanted to do was return home and live your life in peace.

"The clock is ticking human. Lick."

You let out another sob and turn away from the foot trying to worm its way into your mouth.

"I CAN'T. PLEASE HAVE MERCY!"

They aren't going to have mercy. They were Bunny Girls and cruelty was in their blood. What were they going to do to you?

"Mercy? Hahaha your fate will be decided and it will not be merciful!"

Feet are kept on your face constantly as you lay under the wretched smell of the Bunny Girls. After a hellish twenty minutes the leader's have decided your fate.

"Eternal bondage for as long as you shall live!"

You were halfway delirious from the nauseating smell that you didn't fully understand what was happening. All you knew is that you were being transported and soon you were in the Bunny Girl warren. Something pried into your mouth forcing it to remain open constantly. Your jaw ached fiercely as it was opened to a degree that wasn't natural. A tube was inserted into each nostril and you could see the tubes flowing underground, it was sealed with sort of glue to your nostrils.

Soon you began inhaling stench that was foul beyond belief.

"Yes human, those tubes lead to the resting area for when our hunters return. They leave their feet right next to the opening, you will be inhaling our stench day and night!"

You tried to get away but your limbs were tied down tight. You were spread eagle and there was no give. Your tongue was pulled out and they cut the bottom part of it so that it could be extended even further from your mouth. It was then glued to your chin so that it would be easy for a Bunny Girl to rest her foot on it. Or even rub her dirty feet clean using your tongue as a cloth.

What was even more maddening was the Bunny Girls seemed to enjoy taking the time to do this nearly constantly. You never had a moment of respite where you weren't sniffing concentrated foot stench or tasting their horrific feet.

There you lay, immobile and helpless for the next 30 years... a human completely owned and destroyed by the Monster Girls! When death finally came it was a mercy.

BAD END

No No No... HELL NO. You are sick and tired of feeling powerless. And to add insult to injury they want you to lick their feet. Who knows where those have been. You feel an extreme surge of anger well up inside of you.

"HELLL NO! I AIN'T LICKIN YOUR CRUSTY MUSTY DISGUSTING FEET!!!" You scream back at them. A resounding gasp is heard from the bunny girls. " First he rejects us, and now he's insulting our feet! SUCH INSOLENCE!" The bunny girls start shouting and cursing at you.

You suddenly hear the voice from before. "Your anger has restored my power." The voice says. " ''How does that work'' you say. "We have no time I need to tell you what my power is exactly." You nod and wait for the explanation.

" I'm a summoner so with my power you should be able to summon me." "How do I do it?" You ask. " You have to put your right hand on your head and fling it to your side. As you fling your hand say summon angel. You can only summon me as I'm the only soul you have in your possession."

With all this information in your head you decide the time is now. You do the technique the angel tells you. " Summon Angel!" When suddenly you feel a surge of power flow through you, a being appears behind you.

It's an angel! With wings and a halo and white robes. "It seems you've done it you might wanna look at yourself." You look at yourself and you see you have white robes and wings. It seems you resemble whatever you summon.

What happens next?

1333211.content:
By the tone of her voice and her assertive nature, you could tell she wasn't going to let you go. Not without getting something out of you first. You draw the long sword you've acquired and assume a fighting stance. Despite trying to look as dangerous as possible, the steel slime girl instead looked amused.

"Fine, if you want a fight..." the so called "Quicksilver" started. Her twin tails undid themselves, draping down her back, running all the way to her hips. A few strands lift upwards, pointing threateningly at you. She held her fists out in front of you, exaggeratedly waving them in a circle in front of her, as if this was a joke to her. "...then it's a pounding you'll get."
1333211.title: You have no choice but to fight.

choices: She decides to keep tormenting you
13332113.content:
Before you could react or even think of a plan, the Metal Slim was suddenly gone.

"Wha- AHH!"

Before you could even voice your confusion she reformed between your legs and engulfed your crotch with her mouth. Your pants did nothing to protect you as your manhood was assaulted by cool liquid metal.

Quicksilver pulled away, leaving behind a glob of herself on your groin. The "slime" squeezed your cock as it suddenly hardened. You fell to one knee and moaned in a mixture of pleasure and pain; your new penis prison was constantly vibrating and massaging your member, but was too tight for you to become fully erect.

The Metal Slime fell onto her back, and was pointing and laughing at you in an exaggerated manner.
13332113.title: She melts into a puddle

133322.content:
You escaped from the port by avoiding the patrolling soldiers and citizens alike so that they don't give you away. You made it out of the port unseen, but along the way, you see a group of soldiers ahead of you. This group is heading to the port and you slide deeper into the underbrush. They past by you without seeing you and you let out a relieved sigh. You didn't notice the dead branch above you and with a snap, it fell and hit you in the back of the head. You lost consciousness.

You woke up to somebody poking you and pushed the prodding finger away from you. "What happened?" you mumbled and looked at who was poking you. "You were laying on the ground." replied the girl. She was crouching over him and was completely naked. She had long red hair and eyes, with massive breast and a large ass giving her a hourglass figure
"Why are you naked?" was the first question that came out of your mouth, while trying not to stare.
"No need for clothes." she said without a hint of embarrassment.
"Okay, so what are you doing here?" You asked
"I could ask you the same human." She replied
"Why did you say human, aren't you a human too? Said Erik, backing away slightly from the strange girl.
"Well I'm a slime. Couldn't you tell?" she said.
"No matter how I look at you, you look like a human." you said, getting ready for a fight.
"Can a human do this." Her figure suddenly changed and turned into a exact replica of you.
"HOLY CRAP!" you stare in shock at the mirror image of yourself.
"You don't need to stare so hard." She turned back into a girl and fidgeted under your gaze.

What do I do? You try to think what to do against this unknown slime.
133322.title: Doppleganger

choices: Go to a town to the North (No trouble)
Go to a town to the South (Trouble)
1333221.content:
"Well, how about we introduce ourselves. I'm Erik." you said and held out your hand to her. She stared at your outstretch hand and asked "What are you doing?"
"Well, humans usually shake hands when they're introducing each other. It's a form of greeting." you explained.
"Okay." she grabbed your hand and you felt her hand flex like a piece of rubber inside your grip. Her massive breast jiggled hypnotically when you shook hands.
"So what's your name?" you asked her after shaking her hand.
"Don't have one." she said happily.
"Why didn't your parents give you a name?" you asked confused.
"I don't have parents, because slimes are born by a condensed core forming inside a medium like water or mud. Depending on the size of the core, it will determine a slime's strength and intelligence. I was born inside a recently dead body of a human that was near water, so I can be classified as a human slime since I was born from a human body." she explained this to you to clear up your confusion.
"I never knew a slime was born like that." you said to her and gestured for her to give you her hand. You grabbed her arm and give it a gentle poke. Her skin rippled like a wave and you watched it travel up her body.
"So since you were born by inside a body and by water, you were able to have a human-like body and be able to shift your body like a normal slime." told her your theory.
"You're very smart for a human." she said happily.
"But you said that all slimes have a core, but I have seen some and never seen a core." you said.
"Well slimes learn how to hide their core, so humans won't see them." she explained again.
"Okay, but why are you telling me all of this? I thought that slimes hunted humans." You asked.
"I was born a couple of weeks again and I haven't met any other slime. So I don't know what other slimes do, but some human boys came chasing after me. They had this repulsive look in their eyes, so I ran away and hid. I saw you on the ground and if you had that same look, I would have run away again."
"Well, thank you for not attacking me. So would you mind if I give you a name." you asked sincerely.
"Really! I would love it if you would." she answered excitedly and was jumping for joy. Her breast were mesmerizing as she jumped and you looked away to think of a name.
"Can my name be Erik?" she asked innocently
"Sorry, but that's my name. How about Erika?" you asked, thinking of no better name.
"YES, I finally have a name." Erika was so excited that you had to wait a few minutes before she calmed down.
"Erika, would you mind us going somewhere else to talk, because I don't want to be seen by soldiers right now." you asked her.
"Ok." she said.

You and Erika found a empty cave nearby and you both sat down to talk. You explained why you left your home and how you had to sneak out of the port town. Erika listened with rapt attention and asked questions every now and again, but mostly listened to your story. You had to stop yourself from staring at her nude body, which looked exactly like a normal human girl.

"So what are you going to do now Erik?" she asked after your story.
"Well I plan on heading to another town for supplies and information." You told her and looked down at the ill-fitting adventurers armor you got from the dead adventurers.
"Erik" you heard her say your name quietly. You saw that her face was slightly red, but she looked you in the eye and "Can I come with you?"
"Why?" you wonder.
"Well, there's nothing here holding me and I want to experience the things you told me." she said seriously.
"I don't see why not. Welcome to the team, Erika." you said.
"Thank you!" She cried and jumped to give you a hug. Your head got stuck between her massive breast and the sensation was heavenly.

Erika let go of your head and you snapped back to reality. You told her that she'll need to put on some of the extra adventurer clothes you had because she can't go around town naked (not that it wouldn't be enjoyable to you) and you gave her the clothes. She needed some help getting them on since she has never wore clothes before and after a couple of minutes she wearing decent fitting clothes. She was wearing basic leather armor with greaves and shin guards. You asked if she needed a weapon, but she declined and said she had her own way of fighting.

Which way do you go?
1333221.title: Meeting Erika

13333.content:
In your attempt to escape one knight, it seems you've ran into another.

What is she?
13333.title: Another Knight

choices: You, somehow, hold out against her
133332.content:
"Halt, human!"

Against your better judgement, you comply with the voice and stop dead in your tracks. Twisting your head towards it's source, you eventually spot a woman leaning against an old and broken wall.

"Where, exactly, do you think you're going?" Pushing herself off the stones, her long, red pigtails bounce slightly as she approaches.

Getting a better look at her as she drew nearer, you guessed she was a dragon like the one attacking the port. The scales decorating her hands and tail were a mixture of the darkest black and an extremely dull yellow, quite the contrast to both the other's shining silver. Her hair was a pure red and her blank, slanted pupils were incased within bloody crimson irises. She wore armour a combination of painted red and metallic grey, and a shield, proudly displaying the emblem of the Witch Queen for all her enemies to see, was tightly strapped to her right arm. A very simplistic short sword was sheathed on her back.

Escaping this time, while holding a knight of the Witch Queen's undivided attention, was a snowball's chance in hell. You shifted into a defensive stance and tried to ready yourself for anything as she ceased her advancement a few feet away from you.

"I'm... I'm just leaving..." You hold her gaze as you answer.

"Correction! You were just leaving, but now..." She drew her sword as her lips turned into a cocky smirk "Now, you're going to entertain me!"

You gulped at her words, and stammered desperately for a way to get out of it. "No! No, please, I just got away from one dragon, I don't want t-"

"WYVERN!" She roared at you, face suddenly flaring into anger "I'm a wyvern! Hera's a dragon, I'm a wyvern! THERE'S A DIFFERENCE, YOU IDIOTIC -" Her fists tightened, left hand threatening to snap the handle of her short sword off.

You reeled at her outburst, and took a small step back, pondering if facing the knight at the port would be better. The drag - wyvern girl shut her eyes and took a deep breath for second, before they snapped open and she glared at you.

"You know what? It doesn't matter right know. Draw your weapon and face me."

You barely had time to pull out your wooden sword as the wyvern knight charged.
133332.title: Mistakes are made

1333321.content:
"That's it? Bah..." The knight grunts with disappointment as she sheathes her sword.

Your wooden imitation of a sword snapped the second it came into contact with real thing, and every attempt to get some breathing room was thwarted by your opponent's insane speed and unrelenting attacks. Your few seconds of unarmed resistance were brought to a sudden - and painful - halt as she slammed her shield into your face, the force of metal slap flinging you into the dirt.

And so, there you lay: clothes shredded, most revealing little red cuts to the world, nose bleeding and bruised, desperately trying to push yourself up.

Your best attempt is thwarted by the wyvern girl bringing a foot down upon your back with a stomp.

"A wooden sword, really? You thought you could survive this world with a wooden sword? " She grips the bridge of her nose with two of her scaly fingers. You remain silent, doing your best to glare up at her with half your face pressed into the soil. "Humans always do the stupidest things, I swear..." She pulls her hand away and meets your half-glare, totally unfazed by it.

"Though, guess I should give you some credit. You're not mincemeat after my barrage, so maybe you have some
potential." She presses her foot down harder, causing some pain and forcing the air out of you "Just not enough to have me interested."

'But..." She leans forward, studying your face "You are kind of cute... when you remove the battle damage, of course." She kneels down, one foot still firm upon your back, and wipes away some of the nose-blood from your face "That, plus your decent potential, means I could probably get a good trade out of you back at her majesty's palace." She gives a cruel smile "Who knows! Maybe her majesty herself will want you!"

A mixture of anger and horror fills you at the idea of being sold like a toy. You grit your teeth and increase the intensity of your useless glare in an empty hope it helps you in anyway possible.

Your captor opens her mouth, probably to taunt you more, but something you can't see from your position grabs her attention, and she stands again, foot unfortunately still solid upon your back. Movement before you catches your own eye: an elf girl springs out from the forest and comes to a quiet stop just ahead. Her gaze falls on you, as if she is calculating your worth, but one glance at your captor destroys that idea, and she barrels onwards towards...

Towards the port. Your heart drops deeper.

"Scavengers already?! Damn, news must have spread faster than anticipated..." The wyvern bites her finger, obviously unpleased "Hera must have been louder than she was supposed to be, that stupid dragon!"

With various monster girls passing her by, a crossroad forms in her thoughts: does she spend time restraining and transporting you in the hopes of a good trade later, or does she leave you and reach the port quickly in the hopes the pickings at the port are better?
1333321.title: The Wyvern's Decision

13333211.content:
"You better be worth something, runt." The wyvern growled, pulling her foot from your back. Your new attempt to stand (and flee) was extinguished by her hand slamming your head back down into the dirt. "Be still!" She demands as she rummages through your pockets and pouches, confiscating your things.

After taking what was your's for herself, she forcefully begins to rip your shirt apart. You instantly start struggling.

"H-hey! No, no! Stop! Please st - MMPH!" She raps a cloth, formerly a piece of your shirt, roughly around your mouth and ties it tightly to silence you.

"Shush!" She barks as she rolls you onto your back, before forcing your wrists in front of you and wrapping them together with the remaining cloth. She gives them a sharp tug to check they are secure, giving a relieved sigh when it turns out they are, and then drags you to your feet.

"Here! Was that so bad?" She's teasing you, knowing you can't respond properly while gagged. You silently glare at her in return. She simply smiles a mocking smile at you. "Well... can't make everyone happy..."

Then she socks you in the gut, knocking what strength you had clean out of you, lifts you over her shoulders in a fireman's carry and begins walking to the port.

*TINK*

Her foot grazes against something metallic. She looks down, and, curious, you follow her sight, to see a steel sword.

The one you scavenged not that long ago. The one you completely forgot about. The one you just dropped when the wyvern came charging in favour of your wooden one. You squeezed your eyes shut and tightened your hands into fists at how stupid you'd been. You were so used to your little toy replica you complete disregarded the actual one you had found.

Your captor, seeing your response to the weapon, gave a small chuckle. " Yours, I take it?"

You opened eyes (and your fists) and glared at her. She took your useless glare with a click of her tongue, and, as if stomping a bug, brought a foot down open the sword, snapping it into two with the tiniest effort.

"Wouldn't have helped anyway." With that, she treks onwards to the port.

As the port draws closer, you see...
13333211.title: Bound and Gagged

133332111.content:
Soon, your captor had entered the port, with you still uncomfortably trapped upon her shoulders. The horrible smell of death and smoke, coupled with the nightmare-inducing images of blood and corpses decorating the docks, make you wish your weren't gagged so you could throw up. The knight seemed unaware or (most likely) uncaring to your little shimmers of discomfort and marched towards the end of the massacre-covered pier. She stops and looks around, clearly annoyed.

"Where are they? No way they just left without me. No way they forgot me!" You both hear and feel her blood start to boil "If they left without me I SWEAR I'M GONNA -"

"Lin, you know it's very rude to shout ~ " A playful voice causes the wyvern to turn rather violently in surprise, swinging you around around without the least bit of care. Once your brain clears from the sharp movement, you take in the new voice's owner now in your sights.

Her skin is a pale white, her hair is long enough to reach her waist and dull pink, and her exposed eye, as well as presumably the other one hidden behind the bang of hair, is a much brighter pink. A black cloak with it's hood down, somewhat similar to that of the dragon girl's from earlier, gives a teasing shot of her ample cleavage and the black tattoo decorating her collarbone. A number (you guess about ten) of large, squid-like tentacles, each hundreds of suckers, prod out from beneath her cloak, hovering around her body at various levels.

"And who, might I ask, is this lovely boy?" Her eye (well, eyes) locks onto you.

The wyvern girl, name now revealed, finally lifts you off her shoulders and stands you up, but keeps a hand tightly wrapped your arm. "A runaway from Hera's attack. Planning on trading him away back at her majesty's palace." Lin's grip loosen's slightly, and a scary grin dawns on her face "Speaking of that blasted dragon, is she on the ship already? I'd like to have some... words with her."

"Yes, she's on board, but if you two want to fight you can do it at the palace. I'm not letting either of you wreck my ship again." While answering Lin, the tentacle woman draws closer to you and stops just before you. The top of your head reaches her chin. Her hand, wrapped in a black leather glove, strokes your cheek before pulling down your gag. "What's your name, dear?"

You pause. Lin squeezes your arm in a silent threat, so you squeak out "E-Erik."

The woman's smile grows happily at your response. "Well Erik, I'm Calypso: kraken girl and mage of her majesty." She looks to Lin "A hundred bottles of my wine for Erik here."

Lin is taken aback, and you are as well, though more out of fear than Lin's surprise. The wyvern recovers faster than you do. "Cal, I want to see all the offers fir-"

"Two hundred."

"Cal -"

"Two hundred and fifty bottles of my wine and an enchanted weapon of your choosing."

Lin pauses, considering for a moment, then sighs. "If no good trades come within a month -"

"Week."

Lin sighs again. "If no good trades come within a week -"

"Half a week."

"Don't push it!" Lin snaps "If no good trades come within a week, I'll accept your trade, deal?"

Cal looks to you, and it's her turn to sigh, before she snaps back to Lin "And you can only accept offers from those of her majesty's court. Not from guards or merchants or whatever."

"Cal! -"

"Or I can challenge you for him." Lin pauses, and, you can't believe your eyes, shakes in fear at Cal's words "You and I both know that in her majesty's court challenges overrule trades. ~ " Cal shakes a finger at Lin teasingly, before the kraken's aura grows dark "So, think you can beat me Lin?"

"OKAY! Okay, okay, fine, deal, d-deal!" Lin, the mighty wyvern girl, who kicked your derriere with relative ease, was close to a breakdown at Cal's question. "N-now please, just sedate him so we can go!"

The mage's aura sprung from abysmally dark to sun bright at the knight's answer, and she turned, smile beaming, towards you. "Ah, yes, of course." She reached her right hand into her left hand's sleeve, and withdrew a small bottle of black liquid. "Sorry, Erik, but we need you to sleep for a little while, okay sweetie? ~" You, in fear, tried to pull away and run, but Lin still kept you firmly in place. "Transporting prisoners is just so much easier this way, you know."

Cal uncorks the bottle, and slips the wooden cork back into her sleeve. Seeing the black liquid, you guess it's some kind of ink, and you clamp your mouth shut as tightly as possible. Cal cups your chin with her free hand and presses the top of the glass bottle to your lips. She shows some disappointment when you don't open them for her.

"Please, Erik?" She looks you in the eyes, her pink irises begging you as well "Open up for me, sweetie." You feel Lin's grip tighten on your arm again. "Erik, open up or I'll have to hurt you. And I don't want to hurt you..." Cal voices gains a trace of sternness, and she quietly sighs when you silently refuse again. "Okay, dear..."

One of her larger tentacles whips you in the gut with incredible speed. You can't help but gasp in pain, and she takes the chance to shove the ink into your mouth, before she tilts your head back and forces you to swallow. The substance within your belly, Cal and Lin both release you, and you collapse slowly on the cold stones of the pier spluttering, the sedative taking effect quickly. You look up at your captors, and weakly protest. "N-no..."

Cal leans down to you. "Shush, shush... It's okay now, dear Erik..." She smiles at you lovingly, and strokes a hand gently through your hair. "Just go to sleep. Nothing bad will happen to you, we promise..." She continues to whisper to you as you grow weaker and sleep draws closer.

You want to be somewhere else: helping people, battling monster girls and training to defeat the Witch Queen. You don't want to be here: about to be put on display like a toy and sold to the highest bidder. You wanted the strength to get away, to run away, but all that you would get was a rest assaulted by nightmares of your slave future. Slowly, darkness came, and you were pushed into sleep with tears in your eyes, Cal's voice dancing on your ears.

"Sleep... That's it, Erik... Sleep... Good boy..."

-

When you wake, it's on the small bed of a cell. You push yourself up, and realise you're wearing a new piece of clothing: a small, brown robe now covers your once unguarded chest.

"Awake now?" You hear a voice call to you from the cell bars, and turn away from examining your new robe to see Lin staring at you.

"Where...?" You try to ask her, but you don't seem to have enough strength back yet.

"Palace of the Witch Queen." Lin takes a bite of a small bread roll "Capital city the Kingdom of Asun."

You eyes widen in surprise and horror. This was it: the capital city, the home of the Witch Queen. Most definitely guarded heavily, so there was no chance of escape.

"H-how long...?"

"Were you out? About a day." Lin doesn't talk with her mouth full, it seems "Cal's sedative kept you sustained, and all anyone did was move you and put the prisoner robes on you, so don't worry." She crammed the remainder of her food into her gob quickly.

You try to ask another question, but Lin, swallowing her food down, cuts you off. "Here's the rules, runt. Throughout the week, I'm gonna see what kind of offers I get for you. Cal's already got her's down, and it's an incredible one to be sure. I'm not gonna accept trades from anyone not in her majesty's court, so the guards won't try anything funny with you unless they want their heads caved in. I'm also not gonna accept from anyone I don't think can take Cal in a fight, else she'll just challenge them and win you from them anyway. So, honestly, Cal's probably who you're gonna end up with, 'less someone bigger in power gives a better deal for you."

"Who's bigger in power than Cal?" You find your strength, of voice at least, has returned.

"Her majesty or someone close to her."

You gulp. Your stomach growls.

"Your lunch'll be coming soon. It's decent grub for a prisoner." Lin stretches "Anyway, I'm off. Gotta crush a small rebellion before it goes out of control. I'll see you in a couple days." She waves before disappearing down the hallway.

You still feel quite tired, and there isn't anything to do in there, so you close your eyes and go to sleep again.

-

A week passes quickly, and Lin appears before your cell again, arms crossed. She opens her mouth to tell you your fate.
133332111.title: Release the Kraken

13333212.content:
She decides to take her chances with pickings at the port. After all, lots of aspiring heroes there: surely some will have more natural potential than you.

"Well human, it's been... somewhat disappointing, actually." She tilts her head down to address you, her smile a strange crossbreed of mockery and pity "But time's dripping and I must take my leave. So let me leave you with a small parting gift..." Her foot finally leaves it's comfortable spot on your back, and you give a small sigh of relief that the threat of snapping your spine is at least a little smaller.

Then it's sibling crashes into your side like a brick.

With a small "Ta Ta!" and wave, the wyvern knight dashes towards the port so fast you lose sight of her form near instantly. You reel from the pain in your side, but steer yourself to try to get up and away: a feat that right now, with the feeling that your ribs have pierced your lungs, is easier thought than done.

It's too late to not catch attention, however. A monster girl stalks through the forest, intent on raiding the port like the others, before her advancing eyes lock onto you.

If the rumours she heard floating around the forest were true, then the port would have an armoury and a large number of 'wanna be heroes'. A well-equipped boy with dreams of killing her would be a problem, even if they didn't have any training to speak of. But you are cute, unarmed, weakly trying to recover from defeat, clothes ruined and practically begging someone to rip them off. Your a gift waiting to be unwrapped.

Mind made up, she licks her lips, and slips from the trees towards you.
13333212.title: Target Acquired

133332121.content:
As you push yourself up, something presses into your back and pushes you back down.

You move to thrust your elbow into your literal oppressor's form, but their armoured hands grasp your wrists and slam them into your hips before a long, black-scaled tail wraps around your body. Arms now tightly trapped at your sides, the foreign hands release your's and begin a careful inspection of your back.

"Hey! HEY!" You yell and struggle harder as one of the hands gives a butt cheek a firm squeeze "Stop! Please, st-Mmmph!" The tip of your captor's tail forces itself into your open mouth, gagging you and barely letting you breath.

A few moments later, the tail turns you over, and you finally get a look at the Naga.

Her human body is guarded by black and silver armour, and where her tail connects to it is hidden under deep blue cloth. Two small swords, barely larger than daggers, are sheathed at both sides of her hips. Looking at her face, you find pale skin, platinum blonde hair and yellow eyes staring back at you. She's certainly beautiful physically.

Her golden orbs take in all of you, before they move up and she meets your gaze. A small smile comes to her lips as she presses closer, till your noses are almost touching, and she takes your face within her hands.

"You are mine, boy." She speaks firmly but gently "From now till the world's end, you are mine. Abandon all dreams that do not hold me within them, just as I will abandon all dreams of mine that do not hold you."

You give another futile struggle as she speaks, and when it inevitably proves futile, you begin crying. You're supposed to beat the Witch Queen and save the land, not end up like this!

You snap back to reality when the Naga's tongue makes contact with your face, her warm and wet muscle licking away your tears. After she laps up the last tear, her lips give your check a gently kiss, trying unsuccessfully to calm you.

She knows you will run if given the chance, and you struggling while on the move may very well give you an opportunity. So, she thinks, does she inject you with her paralysing venom to keep you still for a while and carry you back?

Or, she blushes at the thought, does she store you in her womb instead? Your struggling would definitely make the trip back more pleasurable...
133332121.title: Slithering Maiden

133332122.content:
"Mo?"

The sound catches your ear, and you quickly turn your head view it's source. First, you catch sight of dark-skinned feet advancing towards you, steps too delicate and soft to make any sound. Your eyes scale up and over this developed body: grasping the images of her juicy hips and large, plump breasts, before coming to her face.

Strands of her long, white hair separate her two gentle orange eyes. Her ears are long and elf-like, and you figure she is an elf, till you see the small black cow horns atop her head. She's a Cow Girl.

Finally standing after so many ruined attempts, your bid to run is smothered in it's crib as she suddenly tackles you back down to the ground. She plants her butt just above your crotch and pins both your hands with her own. You struggle, but both her weight and inhuman strength render them futile.

She leans forward, allowing some thin hairs to tickle your face as she examines it closely. Those orange orbs of her's take in everything before they meet your's, and the way she bites your lip tells you she likes what she sees.

"Please..." You start struggling again beneath her, regardless of how useless it is. You just have to get away "Please... Just let me go, please, I - Mmmph!"

Her lips consume your's, her tongue breaking through your doors and making itself at home in your mouth. Her passionate kiss leaves a string of saliva as she pulls back a little and licks her lips.

"Mine now..." She presses into your neck, taking in your scent, before her lips and tongue begin caressing it "Mine forever..."

Soon, she pulls up again, looking down at you with her loving and possessive eyes. Then she moves to...
133332122.title: Chocolate Milk

choices: You can't keep up and lose
You barely keep up; more knights appear
1333322.content:
For about five minutes, the knight came at you with the spirit of a storm: each movement held the unpredictability of a hurricane and each attack struck with the force of a lightning bolt.

And for about five minutes, you - somehow - held out against the storm. Your wooden sword snapped the instant her first blow made contact with it, and it was undoubtably through luck that you remember your other, better sword in time to block her second. After that, the fight is just a blur in your memory: everything went so fast your brain barely had time to even register it, let alone record it.

Dodging another blow, you quickly jab your sword at the wyvern girl, who throws it's course off with her shield and strikes at you again. You jump back to avoid it and instantly go into a defensive stance, awaiting the knight's follow up attack.

But none comes this time. Instead, she simply looks at you with a mad grin on her face.

"HAH! Not bad, human!" Faint smoke flows from the corners of her mouth as she speaks "Haven't had fun like this for far too long!" She points her sword towards you, but again she makes no effort to attack "What's your name?"

"What's it to you?" You shoot your reply back at her, hoping she doesn't notice how out of breath you are.

"I like knowing the names of entertaining foes!" She bellowed "Is there something wrong with such a thing, little pup? Is there something so vile and wrong about wanting to know the name of someone you respect?!"

You glance down in thought for a millisecond, then look back to your opponent "Erik."

The knight chuckles "Good, pup. I can smell your not lying."

The wyvern plants her sword into the earth, and uses her now free hand to unstrap the shield from the other arm. She tosses the metal protector to the side once it's free, and picks her sword back up by the blade.

"Names Lin!" She throws her sword, and it thuds into the dirt harmlessly a foot away from you "Use that to keep things fair, won't you Erik!"

You look to the sword, and move to quickly snatch it up as Lin removes her gauntlets. The moment you grasp it, you pull back into your defensive stance with a sword in each hand, just as the unwanted pieces of Lin's armour hit the ground.

A sickening snap rings as scaly wings burst outwards from her scaly arms, and again when they sink back in. With a little flexing of her wrists, Lin is finished stretching, and her grin grows full again with anticipation.

"Ready yourself, Erik!" Her feet dig deep into the earth and her claws prepare themselves "BECAUSE HERE I COME!!!"

The wyvern rushes forward, reborn once again as a storm.

1333322122.content:
You kept your head down as Lin led you through the camp. You could hear the whispers of other knights as you passed them, their comments varying from “He’s cute” to the likes of “I hope Lin lets me help break him”. You suppressed your fear and tried to appear calm, but the fact your hands were bound coupled with all hungry looks you spotted out the corners of your eyes wasn’t making that easy. Relief washed over you when you were guided into what you assumed was Lin’s tent.

“Sit.” She said, pointing to a simple wooden bed. You did as you were told, surveying the interior as you shuffle across the dirt floor. There wasn’t much to survey; besides the bed, there was only a wooden table in the center of the room, and a metal chest at the opposite end that Lin was tucking her weapons and armor into.

With a click of the lock, the wyvern finishes sealing her equipment safely away, and turns to you. Now down to lighter, more form-hugging clothes, she advances towards you. “That was quite the fight, boy.” Lin smiles sharply, lightly stretching in a way that helps show off her hourglass figure. She drops her rear on the unoccupied half of the bed to your left, then starts gently poking your bicep. “Who taught you?”

“I taught myself.” That wasn’t completely true, as you did learn a lot from a few Monster Girl-fighting books, but no physical person has taught you. You suppress a scowl as you remember every hero who passed through the village dismissing you as a lost cause.

“Self taught, huh?” The knight mulls over your answer. “That explains the rookie mistakes, but…” She trails her claw along your chest and leans her chin on your shoulder. You can’t help but shiver slightly as her hot breath washes over your neck. “You’ve got potential. Too much potential to just let go, I’m afraid.” Her other hand slips around your back and plants itself on your right hip. The uncomfortable situation makes you want to shove her and run, but you have no doubt that would end horribly for you.

“Normally, we’d either kill you or let everyone rape you till you’re an irreparable fuck-toy.” How casually she says it makes your skin crawl. How many people had these monsters inflicted such a fate upon? “But I like you, Erik. You gave me the best fight if had in Queen-knows how long.” Her smile widens as she recalls your battle. In your head, it’s all a blur except for a few moments. Like how she won by kicking you so hard you threw up both vomit and blood. Your gut remembers that quite well.

“So, here’s my deal: become my apprentice. I could help you realize that budding skill of yours, in exchange for serving under me.” Swiftly, the claw feeling up your chest cuts through the ropes binding your hands like they were butter. Checking your hands, you thankfully find them to be unharmed by the action. “What do you say?”

Become Lin’s apprentice? Serve a knight of the Witch Queen? Under normal circumstances, you would refuse outright. But right here and now, what other choice was there? You didn’t want to die, and you definitely didn’t want to be broken down into a sex-slave for Monster Girls. So, as much as it pains you, you decide you’ll play along for now, learning what you can until you get the chance to escape.

Swallowing down the bile in your throat, you look the wyvern dead in her searing eyes and utter those accursed words. “I accept.”

Lin’s smile grows sinister at your agreement. “Very well. Though I’ll need some...” Warm and wet flesh, accompanied by hot air, touches your neck as your ‘master’ gives your skin a teasing lick. “… payment up front. To be sure you really mean it.”

13333222.content:
It all happens quickly, adrenaline rushing through you mixing with an almost primal way of extreme swordsmanship. You let your body react for you,

- It's very quick. -

Lin lunges with a roar, you just barely managing to swerve around her as she sliced. Landing immediately, launching herself at you, she threw a powerful swing down. Able to somehow sidestep this you then jump at her, actually getting her to recoil & jump back as the two blades nearly cut down her face.

"COMEON!" Stomping & holding out her arms, the Wyvern taunts! Building intense rage from having to do this-!? You charge yelling!
Coming right back at you- the clash is like lightning, unreal strength rushing forth as you sliced up to stop her jumping-up-then-down-swing-

Thick red blood is drawn as the blade held back her clawed hand, Lin grunting in some messed-up way. She puts all her strength in her one claw, letting the blade dig deeper. A crooked smile comes forth with some smoke bellowing out.

"I've never seen a wel-"

"NO!" Screaming & slicing down her hand, then circling to the side, Lin trips forward some! - ! - The time she recovers in is enough to let you slice at her leg armor- with a sickening clang & force one sword slid through flexible platemail & through her scales, the Wyvern screaming & kneeling down from it- not before hitting you!

Her claw hit your upper-chest bone mostly but still drew blood, the stamina & adrenaline use taking its toll on you as getting up after being hit is fatiguing, some blood loss not helping..

... "Good! GOOD!" Heras voice.. it comes from the woods, the black cloak concealing her until now. Lin yanks the sword out from her leg, letting a deep huff out, two more Dragons & a Wyvern- armored & brutish- landing near you, another Wyvern near Lin. Shit. Their tall & intimidating & your out of roid rage energy. The closest crimson-haired Wyvern gives you a creepy, sharp-tooth smile.

Mera reached under her cloak, pulling out one of her blades, her expression one that gives you dread- "Warmblood, you fought well.." --the blade is brought down near your neck, one of the other dragons spoke, "Hera don't you thi-"

"I'm in charge! Don't speak!" She snaps at her, looking back down at you, "Erik was itt-? ..."

She stops.. surprised that you reach for the little potion you found on one dead adventurer. "Your not serious? Are you?"
There's some awe in her tone as she thinks your stupid. Hera moved the sword away, you- in great pain - popping the cork off of the bottle & pouring it down your shirt.

...

......Relief! Wounds closing enough to stop bleeding mostly, with the pain numbing well, you struggle to stand. By Hera's motion they step back.. you.. swing your fist at her weakly, she just backs away with a smile, "You.. you.. won't get away with killing those people.."

She looks slightly more serious, Lin being helped over by a Wyvern, Mera replying with some challenged annoyance, "And you- a small Warmblood, will stop me?"
"Count on it.. Lizard, for Nathaniel.. if not.. my people." Your talking crap & know it, going out with resistance is the best you can do.
"Lin-"

... ... ...
... ... ... Mera slit Lin's throat by the blade in one swoop, the Wyvern helping her sighing & throwing the Wyvern down near you.. god.. she flips over, gagging, trying to yell.. gods & goddesses no..

"Either you or her.. had to be." Mera bent down to you some, freakishly long tongue licking the blades fresh blood, "Get strong Warmblood. I'll get away with what I do as long as my Queen breathes.."

Lin didn't deserve that. As threatening as she was- she didn't deserve that. You just glare at Mera.
"Let's go! Fly!" All of them would jump & ascend, their way of flying scary enough, Mera staying behind- "We'll see if your as big of a threat as you want to be, Erik. Davausta." so she leaves to, massive wings unfurling out from under her cloak, her heavy jump pushing you back some.

... ... "Lin-" she's almost gone. She has one of her hands on her chest, staring right up in the sky. "Er-ik.. t..ha..n..k.."

She's gone- it's- emotional- even if your in pain. There's no honor in what Mera did. But, as much as you want to sit & wonder about what will happen in the future- about Lin's dishonorable end- you got to get better. You have to continue to message Molly. Get better. Get to the fallen Kingdom of Asun! Stop this brutality between the humanoid races!

Just having the glowy stone left.. you go off.. you'll need to try & give Lin a burial later.

133332221.content:
(It's Hera, not Mera, oops.)

...Back to the docktown you went with the two blades, still bleeding just slightly. After this ordeal your worn out past carrying them- using the blades as a support. No monster girls appeared at all on the way there, probably scared off. Hopefully she didn't burn down the town.

Walking out from the woods with blood stains on your clothes some wary villagers- having just now been left alone by the Witch Queen's forces- saw you & most were shocked.
The pain is returning very slowly, luckily the potion helped but wasn't enough to heal it fully. Looks like it'll scar, just a big skin wound now.

... The day continues on, Carpenter & several other warriors had died shortly after you ran ... You wanted to send Molly a message but are to worn out to do so, just needing rest, even the Innkeeper will let you stay for free. People are worried about you.
Lin's scar will forever be on you.. oddly you find yourself becoming teary thinking of how that encounter went. Only a true degenerate should die how she did.

'Hera will pay..' you thought as you took off your blood-stained clothes down to your leather trousers, feeling the wound closing quicker than expected. 'Carpenter & Lin.. honorable in the least. They'll both be avenged. I'll probably die but I'll make damn well sure she goes with me.' never had you been so angry before. Hera will dread letting you live!
...

As you go to rest rage fades into the blackness of unconsciousness, feeling your chest throb some as you go out.

... ... On a grassy hill is one lush tree, the wind pushing everything in one direction. It is beautiful.
You walked up the hill viewing the clear blue sky, breathing in the fresh air. Then a white-haired, pale young woman appeared, green dress covered in intricate swirls that flow with the wind.

"Find me Erik- Spirit- East- Please-!" She just began appearing panicked, the dream ending with Erik being yanked back hard, falling through grass like water- seeing the sky turn greenish- making him get up in slight worry.
... ... It may be some monster girls trap, but someone .. or something .. may need his help. East his dream said- the direction of the Isle's small grassland, overrun by colonies of Wasp Girls- vicious ones that fight with anyone who even looks at them in the wrong way, all headed by some sort-of pack of 'Alpha' Wasps.

There was a village near there before, the escapees told that they'd all kidnap the men & killed or wounded any woman. It's terrifying- maybe a death sentence- but what else do you have to lose?

At this point fighting for others feels right. Hopefully the wasps don't give you any trouble. Never seen one before anyhow.

His wound, having already healed & scarred well enough to allow stretch painlessly, is a surprise. So, readying to go find this dream lady.. food, a small backpack & new clothes is a first priority. First. Heh.

...
133332221.title: The Priority.

1333322211.content:
Your morning is painfully basic while preparing, all except for being shirtless with Lin's scar in the open. It being early in the morning there aren't many shops open, but one stand you find sells good-looking bread. Buying two, one for later, you'd eat the other as you went to find the tailor.

Unfortunately he is still closed. Sucks for you, so, slightly disappointed, you go back to the Inn to get your swords. As you walked back in it seemed the Innkeeper was just getting up, he looked at you as if feeling pity.

"Say- never got your name." He leans on the counter sighing, "Erik." You reply, "Thanks for letting me stay here, sir." As you go to the stairs he stops you, "Wait. Where are you planning to go?" He sounds very serious, the inquire helping you think-

"To the grassland, I have a hunch someone needs help." The Innkeepers expression is visibly one of slight surprise.

"Really?" He said with disbelief, "Where those wasp abominations are-? Erik- don't you know what they can do to one person?"

You nod. You never have seen one but have hope that they'd not bother with one shirtless adventurer- perhaps that is a bad mentality.
Innkeeper sighing again, "That scar. Your fight. Don't let it get to your ego, son. Go do what you have to." Before you go, you ask, "Hey, can you spare a small bag?" He smiles, chuckling some, "Sure."
Thinking as you continued in preparation- this may be a ticket to death, but the thought comes again- someone who really needs help may just be worth helping. Hope.

...

... ... The adventures sword is left outside the smithy, Lin's fine blade should be enough to ward off anything. Armed with it & the weird unknown glowy stone you set off on the East path, just a guy in worn leather trousers with a bag. It's a nice day.

On the way through the woods the path fades, overgrown after probably years of neglect. There is an eerie feeling in the woods that slowly began to fade to the tall grass fields, it is actually quite beautiful here.. ..
.. Then out of the sky, just out of your sight to the right comes a Wasp Woman- terrifying. There are no human eyes, just large black bug-eyes under two large, twitching antenna. Her mouth is just two sharp traps, likely able to bite into you with ease. The way her bodies hair flows down around her head & back is unsettling- one set of humanlike clawed arms comes out from her humanlike head, but apart from that, they don't look humanoid at all. Her lower torso has a large set of spiked mandibles & thick wings, her other half is just to disgusting to want to look at, the mandibles there larger than her midsections. Stinger is easily sharp & long enough to go through you.

Shivering in fear you shake some as she lands in-front of you, feet away. Why.. is the yellow monster more scary than Hera?
Twitching her head, her stinger half is turnt to you slightly, her looking at you intensely. She gets closer slowly, obviously cautious, you wonder if she can see your fear. "H-hey- I- don't want any trouble-"

Stuttering some.. she backed away some as you spoke. May she be a younger one?.. than she began to make a cackling noise, a loud one, with her mouth. Backing away from you.. the sound of flapping wings approached from around you quickly.


...

... ...An army, essentially, appears around you. Not knowing what to do you just dropped your sword & put your hands behind your neck, facing & crouching down to the ground, submitting. It's the only thing you think won't get you killed immediately.
Cackling sounds come from all around- maybe just a few feet from you- like they speak their own language. They all stop at the sound of one louder cackle, almost like a hiss. Looking up- - - a larger wasp, maybe the largest, more humanlike in her upper body- uses her mandibles to walk on her bottom half. Seeing her just maybe a foot away staring down at you, you freeze.

"Kkaann youu sayyy- whyy hh-eree?" The wasp woman backed up some, lowering her head down to you slightly.

A deep voice that seems to slither is freaky. But- you understand it-- you have to speak up. "U-uh- Erik- I'm Erik- I'm here- to- to go to the land. The grasses- there-" cautious, you move your hand to point at the grassland, being watched intently. She looks back at it, antenna twitching rapidly, she began to cackle when she turned back to you, a few other larger wasps joining in.

After maybe half a minute of cackling- she made then stop again. "Hhummanns.. knnoow landss nott sssaffee.. upp.. Eeriikk.. upp.."
Damn this is a bizzare-scary. You stood up, the eyes of all of the wasps trained on you, seeing this one- definitely the largest- grab the sword as she rose to. "Wwhyy..? In reference to the sword you can see they don't like it. At all. Body language tells alot.

"That- that- it is for threats. Bad people- humans-" trying to explain things simply is hard, especially since you have no clue how they'll react. She looks at you, & the sword, though not human, perhaps with an expression of deep thought.

Then she threw it to the ground, walking to you, bringing her humanlike arm to your chest. You don't move.
Her carapace-like hand ran over your (mostly) scar, the wasp staring at you with something you just can't identify. After a few seconds she cackles though lightly, looking to nod to you before moving back.

"Ppasss, Errikk.. Ggooodd.." Following this is her cackling loudly, many if not all others joining, before they take off. The sound of the horde flying is quite a spectacle, freaky as it is.
Off they go, most to the right of the path, their nest may be over there somewhere.

... ... ... ... whew.

Able to continue you grabbed the sword, shaking off that potentially deadly encounter the best you could. Through the grasslands.. it is beautiful, healthy trees are far in-between each other & varieties of flowers in patches gives the place some individuality..

The winds blows a hard gust.
No monster causes it. Nobody is around here- not even the wasps. A large tree catches your eye. Much like the one in the dream- small hill & all.
... Wait .. Why is .. the sky .. turning greenish?

The wind screams with high pitch literally almost human. But it is not. It is demonic. "I~ can't~ believe~ you came~"
A high pitched, singsong voice rides the wind, you take a defensive stance, but thinking this is a wind elemental.. swords cant do anything to kill air.

"Who are you? Your not that lady in the dream." A demonic eemental is less intimidating than a horde of wasps. You feel ready. Silence with calming air, but then another gust came- bringing with it abnormal heat & a light laugh- ! - ! - !

"The Queen~ she loves~ you'll see~"

The air?! yanks you back, ripping Lin's blade from your hand painfully. Something.. blurring the air in a humanlike shape wields it. It spins it around unnaturally, in twirls & flips. How are you supposed to fight this? Wind?

... Guess the glow stone is your best shot ... & The spirits in your favor, if any.

Bad End.
