" Arrrrghhhh !!! ", you scream caughting the Imp by surprise, you take this chance and dash forward with a swing of your wooden sword to her temple, shocked by your scream she was unable to block and takes the hit and falls in the ground out like a light.

You look at her immobile form in the ground and notice a line of glass bottles straped to her back, looking at then they add some nasty colors to then making you guess they were some kind of poison, " Good think i attacked first and asked later, who knows what kind of shit this his !".you thought as you tied the imp with a ivy and releaved her of the potions.

The only thing to do now was what to do with her ?
142.title: Go to hell !!

1422.content:
You dragged her inconscious body to a tree and tied her up good, you disliked killing, and you even knew of some adventurer´s that would take a monster girl as a servant since they tended to obey those who defeated then.

You weren´t interested in taking one as a slave, or atleast not one so weak, " It would be great if i could defeat a dragonkin, they are the strongest !", you thought with a smile, said to have the strenght of ten men, few were even brave enough to aproach one, least challenge one.

* * *


The next morning you released the imp and headed to town, she flashed her tongue at you and scampered off.

No other monster girl´s attacked you that day, so you managed to reach town, you money was short just enough to buy a steel weapon, or more precise a sword, there was a fisherman close by taking care of his catch of the day so you whet and asked, " Good morning sir, could you tell me the location of the weapons shop ? ", you asked in a cheerfull voice, the old fisherman turned arround to look at you, he said notting as he looked at you then smiled, " Ah !, a young adventurer looking for a good weapon ! ", he said more to confim than to ask.

" Indeed, i can´t go up against most of the monster girl´s out there with only a wooden sword ! ", you answered.

With his indications you found the only weapon store in town, there were adventures and normal people inside either looking to buy new weapons or to resharpen the ones they already possesed, you headed to the counter, the clerk at the table looked at you and smiled, " Good day young sir, is there something i can help you with ? ", he asked cheerfully.

You nodded and asked for a sword, his smile evaporated from his face, " My appologies but we are out of swords, since the mines are now filled with monster girl´s and for severall months now we add no ships coming to port ! ", he informed and your jaw droped , " Oh shit, now were am i going to get a weapon, i didn´t train with no other weapon ! ", you cursed.

With that you exited the store in a bad mood, a axe would look too big with you and you didn´t add enough money to buy a spear, and forget about a bow, it would take months to get used to it, wich left you with no other choice but find the remains of a unfortunate adventurer, the idea revolted you but you add no other choice.

You headed to the inn for the night, at the counter you asked for a drink, " If you don´t mind i will pay for it ! ", said a adventurer with only a eye that sited next to you, " You have the face of a person that wasn´t able to get what he wants ! " he said, you picked the drink and took a sip, " The weapon shop didn´t have sword´s, so now i´m stuck with this stick !, mister ... ? ", " Nick, just Nick will do ! " he answered.

" I´m Erik, a pleasure to meet you and thank you for the drink ! ", you thanked, " Don´t think me yeat, there his a interesting story that i would like to tell, you see there his a place in the deep woods where there his a very special type of monster girl ! ", he told while you listened wondering were that story would lead, " This monster girl as the power to grant any wish, but it his not as easy as it sounds, you have to resist her charm, because if you ask for a sexual wish, you ain´t coming back alive ! ", he finished, but you found the story interesting indead, " Sounds dangerous, but right now i would take anything to get a sword, can you tell me were i can find it ? ", you asked

* * *


You headed the next morning to the woods, the trees were dark and the vegetation was thick, Nick was nice enough to give you a old shortsword of his, when you tried to pay for it he refused saying that if you came back you could return it, and if you died atleast he add helped you as much as possible, the blade was somewhat blunt but it was easy enough to sharpen with your wedgestone.

A few hours passed and you add lunch on a small clearing hearing steps you turned arround while drawing the shortsword, you saw no one but the sound of steps was still heard, whatever it was aproaching was doing it steadly as it didn´t add a care in the world, a minute passed until it showed itself, you gasped as you faced a...
1422.title: Just leave her tied up to a tree !

14221.content:
A slender, six armed woman steps into the clearing. Long silver hair flows over her shoulders, draping over her breasts. At first glance, she appears to be wearing black thigh-high boots, on the second you realize that it is chitin (bug armor). Similar, glove-like chitin cover her arms and her torso seems to be covered in a corset. The black material contrasting with her pale kin and is her only covering. Her eyes are large black orbs that gleam in the sunlight. She carries a hooked staff in her upper right hands and her smile reveals long fangs.
You both stand there for a moment, examining each other. Finally, she turns as if to leave and you relax, thankful that you won't have to fight. Quickly she turns around and throws. A long white object spins in the air between you, forcing you to make a split second decision.
14221.title: Spider girl

142211.content:
Your sword strikes the center of the whirling object. However the blade does not cut it. Instead the spider silk wraps around your short blade and forearm, the weighted ends striking painfully. Your sword arm falls limp. The spider-girl lash out with her hook and you find your feet being swept out from underneath you. You lay on the ground stunned. The spider-girl stands over you smiles and brings her staff down on your head.

You come to in a darkened room. You try to move, only to discover your arms and legs have been affixed to the wall by the spider's web. Your sword is nowhere in sight and you seem to have been stripped of all your clothes. You decide to do what any sane man would d in your position. Panic.
You thrash desperately against the web, only for it to tighten further the harder you fight against it. You try screaming, only to notice the gag across your mouth. The sound of heeled boots approaching stops you. "Oh good your awake." The spider-girl smiled evilly, "I so prefer my toys to be awake when I start to play with them." She begins to play with herself, demonstrating the advantages of six arms, as she manages to fondle both her breasts and another hand moves between her legs. A fourth arm moves forward and runs a finger down your chest while another grabs your unresponsive package. "To scared to preform? Well I can fix that." Swiftly she moves forward and buries her fangs in your neck.
Liquid fire surges through your veins. Your member leaps to attention, to the spider's delight. She mounts, you crying in pleasure as you stretch her tight hole. She starts to move whispering in you ear that she won't eat you until she fucks you dry. Whimpering, you wonder if it will better or worse if your stamina holds out.
Bad End
142211.title: Mistake

142212.content:
You duck under whatever the spider threw at you. The back of your mind registers a loud crack behind you, but the rest of it is focused on throwing yourself into a forward roll that carries you across the clearing towards the monster. Finishing your roll, you spring to your feet in front of the astonished spider-girl. Whatever she had expected to happen, a direct attack wasn't it.
Moving quickly, you bring your sword down on her head faster than you thought was possible. Just as quickly she brings her staff up to block the blow. Your sword bites into the wood of her weapon, locking them together. The two of you struggle for control, you trying to use our height and weight to your advantage, the spider-girl gripping her weapon in four of her six arms, the other two scrabbling behind her back for something. You know if she gets whatever she's reaching for, she'll gain the upper hand.
Desperately, you twist to the side. The move puts both of you of balance, and your weapons go flying across the clearing. Stumbling, you spin around, looking for your opponent. Spotting her just regaining her balance, you lunge for her, despite to end the fight quickly. You grab her by the head and slam your's against hers in the time honored tradition of brawlers everywhere.
Apparently, you manage to do it just right. You barely felt anything, but the monster drops and doesn't get back up. You walk over to the weapons and manage to pry your sword out of her staff. Looking around you spot the object she threw at you hanging from a tree branch. It appeared to be a braided spider silk rope that had been weighted at the ends. If it had hit you it would have hurt. A lot.
You turn to look at the spider-girl and see that she hasn't moved an inch. You step closer. She doesn't appear to be breathing.
"Crap, did I kill her?"
142212.title: Duck and Roll

choices: It's nice to see friendly faces
1422121.content:
"Crap, crap, crap." You run over, to the limp form and frantically search for a pulse. Nothing. "Damn it!" If the monster had decided to follow you, she would have been an invaluable guide to an area you knew too little about. And you had to go and kill her.
Suddenly, you notice the straps on her shoulders. Rolling the body over you find a rather large pack. Opening it you gawk at the treasure inside. Stuffing the bag to the point of over flowing is spider-silk rope. Fire-proof, never frays, nearly indestructible. Each one of those lengths of rope is worth a fortune, and you have a whole bag full. You suddenly feel exposed, sitting in the middle of a clearing over this fortune.
You drag the body to the edge of the clearing and transfer as much of the rope as you can from her pack to yours. Even if you keep some for yourself, the rest of the rope would pay for quite a bit of gear. You then cover up the body with some leaves. Look around the clearing one last time nervously, and head of through the woods.

Despite your initial nerves the rest of the day goes by quickly. You sleep in a tree for the night and the next day soon find a path. You follow it and see a cleared field and a small town in the distance. Relieved you pick up your pace and hope to reach the town by noon.
1422121.title: She's Dead

14221212.content:
You step out of the woods and pause to look around. Immediately you jump back into the forest, swearing. There was a worker in the field and it wasn't human.
Still swearing, you look carefully at the town. It looked human made, but had clearly been overrun quite some time ago by the monsters that now lived in it. You turn your attention back to the figure standing in the field.
14221212.title: Here there be monsters

choices: No, too risky. Go around the village
142212121.content:
As you watch, the monster takes a buzzing hop from one end of the field to the other. A bee. You search your memories for every thing you can remember about bee-girls. They lived in hives. The majority of them aren't very bright, with the exception of the queen. And the honey they produced had amazing healing properties. Supposedly the queen's honey was the best, and could even strengthened someone who ate it for a long time. Of course to get the queen's honey you had to get into a hive that was guarded by warrior drones. Speaking of warrior drones, you're pretty sure the bee in the field was a worker. So where were the guards?
Suddenly a dark figure darts out of the woods on the far side of the field. Startled, the worker leaps into the air just a little to slow. The dark one grabs the worker by the leg and drags her to the ground. With a scream a warrior bee dove out of the sky and slammed into the attacker. Knife like protrusions on the warrior's arm stab repeatedly into her prey. The figure struggles to its feet and manages to throw the bee off. It stands there for a moment, trying to choose to fight or flee. The decision is made by the bees as a second and third warrior dive down, and the first gets back up and rejoins the fray.
Getting up, the warriors go to the injured worker. For a moment, you think they might just kill the injured creature. To your relief, they assist the worker to her feet and carry her back towards the village.
You wait. Then wait some more. After what feels like hours, (but judging by the sun was only minutes) you run into the field, cursing yourself for being such a fool. You stoop to examine the clearly dead assailant of the bees. Despite the multiple stab wounds, you can see that it was a werewolf. One of the Witch Queen's shock troopers, they amazonian fighter were infamous for breaking infantry with reckless charges backed by immense strength and tough hides. This one was looking fairly unhealthy, even for a corpse. The skeletal arms and matted fur seemed to indicate that she had either been separated with, or more likely thrown out of, her pack and had had trouble fending for herself.
Out of the corner of your eye, you see a flash of leather. Turning you spy a small satchel laying in the grass. It obviously didn't belong to the dead werewolf. You pick it, holding it close to your face you get a whiff of something sweet. Honey sweet. You freeze. Gears turn in your head making you wonder just how easily the warrior's guarding the bee village could be fooled. If they relied mostly on smell, than this satchel might just be enough to get you into the village and steal some honey. Is it worth the risk?
142212121.title: It's a bee-girl

1422121211.content:
No it wasn't worth it. There was no way the bee's were that stupid. You put the pouch back on the ground were you found it and resolve to go the long way around the village.
The forest thickened quickly not far from the village. You kept up an even pace determined to put as much distance between yourself and the bee village as possible. You were sure that nothing could keep you from that goal, nothing except...
You stop. Was that crying you heard? Cautiously you move towards the sound. Yes, it was definitely crying. You move through the trees ready for anything. Anything except what you found.
Leaning against a tree was a werewolf child. She appeared to be wearing a simple leather vest and nothing else. And her leg was caught in a gleaming bear trap. The sight of a child trapped in such a state caused you to take an involuntary step forward.
"Careful." A gruff voice warned. You look to see a man step out of the trees. "The bitches are vicious even when young. Only way to stop them is with traps. They always see me coming." Personally you thought his problems had more to do with the horrible smell emanating from the man. He looked like he went out of his way to smell vile. "But once they're in the trap all you have to do is..." He raised a crossbow leveling it at the girl.
"Wait!" You stepped froward and pushed the crossbow down. "She's just a child!"
"And soon enough she'll be a grown bitch." The man snarled and raised the bow again. "Better to kill her now when she can't fight back." He shouldered you aside to stand in between you and the girl.
You looked at the little werewolf, her muzzled wet as she sniffed back tears. You could tell she knew exactly what the man was saying.
1422121211.title: Go around the village

14221212111.content:
You listen to the sharp twang of the crossbow. With a heavy heart you open your eyes and stare at the werewolf child. The bolt protruding from her eye socket all you need to know. "Well," the man said with obvious satisfaction. "One less wolf bitch to worry about."
A howl sounds out through the forest. The man raised a brow. "Must have noticed the kid missing. Best move on before the get here."
You stare dumbfounded at the man. "Those sound close."
"There not as close as you think." The man scoffs. "Its just the fear talking lad, so grow a URPH!" A fully grown werewolf flies into the man and takes him to the ground. The man barely gets out a cry of pain before she begins to tear him apart. Something slams into you from behind. There is a terrible wrenching pain. You barely retain consciousness long enough to see your arm flung into a tree. Then everything goes black.

Bad End
14221212111.title: You close your eyes

14221212112.content:
The crossbow drops from the man's hands. You pull your sword out of his body and watch as he drops to the ground. "She's just a child."
You step over the dead man and approach the girl. You carefully place your sword on the ground behind you and hold out your hands. "Hi , my name is Erik. What's yours?"
"M-Mi-mizzie." She sniffled. "Why, why did you do that?"
"You don't get to be a hero by murdering children." You take the trap key from the dead hunter and pry open the trap. Mizzie whimpers with pain as you toss the trap aside. You hiss in sympathy, the trap had broken her leg and her supernatural healing had tried to repair the break while still in the trap. The result was a limb twisted in on itself. Mizzie wouldn't be walking anytime soon. You take a deep breath. "I'm going to have to carry you. If I put you on my back, do you think you can help me find your pack?"
"Uh-uh." It takes only takes a moment for you to get situated. Mara on your back, sword at your side. A small furry limb jabs into view "That way." She says.

You follow Mizzie's instructions deeper into the woods. You are slightly nervous about going into werewolf territory alone, but hopefully Mizzie would engineer enough goodwill for you to pass through unscathed. Of course you almost jump out of your skin when a snarling werewolf steps in front of you. She is clad in the same kind of leather vest as Mizzie, but were Mizzie was obviously a child the newcomer was taller than you, with full breasts and an obvious musculature underneath her dark fur. and in one hand she was carrying the biggest war hammer you've ever seen. And she looks pissed. "WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE?"
"Mara!" Mizzie shouted in your ear. "Mara, Mara, Mara!"
"Mizzie?!" The werewolf looked shocked. "What have you been doing? Mom has been worried sick! Are you all right?"
"I'm fine." Mizzie assured her...sister? "Mr. Erik took care of me."
Mara looked at you. "Mr. Erik?"
"Pleased to meet you ma'am." You nod in greeting. "And Mizzie here could use some help. Her leg got got in a steel jaw trap and her bones tried to mend while still inside."
"A jaw trap!" Mara switched from cautiously pleasant to angry in a flash. "Those are vile, who would even use one? They cripple unwary humans just as often as other creatures. When I get a hold of the bastard who set that thing..."
"He's been taken care of." You interrupt. "We should probably get Mara some help though."Mizzie looked at you speculatively. You don't meet her eyes. You're not proud of having killed another human like that.
"Follow me." Mara said. She lead you into a clearing with tents, or possibly cloth coverings for dens in the ground, line the edges.
"Mara you're back already?" One of the wolves called out. Were Mara was tall and athletic, this werewolf was shorter than you and dangerously curved. Her every step lent a hypnotic sway to her hips and her standard leather vest stretched over an ample chest. So entranced by her appearance you almost missed the worried look in her eye. "Have you found your sister?"
"Here I am Mama." Mizzie called out.
"Mizzie!" You barely had enough time to drop to one knee as the wolf mother rushed you. You grunted as the surprisingly heavy woman crashed on top of you and Mizzie pulling her daughter, and extension you. into an embrace. "Mizzie you're all right. I was so worried when I couldn't find you, You should know better than to disappear on me like that. Never do it again."
"I'm okay Mama, I'm okay."
"This is a touching heartfelt reunion and all, but can we please get OFF THE HUMAN!" Oh crap did you say that out loud? A muffled snort from Mara suggested that you did. Fortunately the wolves didn't seem offended. In fact the mother laughed openly as she got off of you carrying her daughter.
"I apologize." She held a hand in front of her mouth, smothering a giggle. "My name is Miranda, I'm Mizzie and Mira's mother. Thank you so much for bringing my baby home."
"It was no problem ma'am."
"So polite." Miranda murmured as she walked away.
Mara sighed as her mother walked away. Glancing up at the sky she turned to Erik. "The sun is heading down. If you like I can ask the Alpha if you can stay the night in our camp. It's the least I can do after you helped Mizzie get back."
"I would appreciate that thank you."

The Alpha, a scar covered and particularly scary looking wolf, agreed to let you spend the night with her pack. So as the camp quieted down for the night you found yourself stretching out in a tent provided by the pack. You feel yourself starting to drift of when you hear a rustling at the entrance of your shelter. Propping yourself up on your elbows you watch as a familiar curved figure crawled into the tent. "Miranda? What are you doing?"
"Shhh." The wolf mother held a clawed finger in front of her mouth. "I never got the chance to thank you properly for saving my baby girl." Miranda crawled over to you and dragged her breasts across your bare chest. Your eyes widen as you realize what the naked wolf had in mind. You start to stammer excuses but the wolf woman would have nothing of it. With a groan you watch helplessly as she lowers herself onto you.

In the morning you groan and stretch as a satisfied Miranda leads you out of your tent. You almost immediately run into a bouncing Mizzie. "Mr. Erik, Mr. Erik! Did you sleep with my Mama last night?" unsure how to respond to the blunt question from a child you cautiously say yes. Mizzie then turned to her mother and asked. "Am I going to have a new sister Mama?"
Miranda, smothering a laugh at your crimson cheeks, replies, "Almost certainly, Mizzie."
"Yeah! Thank you, Mr. Erik."
Embarrassed beyond all belief you make your goodbyes. The werewolf camp is barely out of sight when you are intercepted by Mara. "I'm coming with you." The offer was surprising if not unwelcome. A werewolf with a giant hammer would certainly be a welcome addition to your quest. But why? "How much do you know about werewolves?"
"Not much," you admit.
"Alright there are three kinds. Most are your average wolf. Strong and fierce, fighters that get pregnant now and then. Then there are wolves like my mother." You wince at the mention of Miranda. "Breeders. Not the strongest fighters but with the highest fertility of any wolf. You probably did get her pregnant, by the way. And then there are wolves like me. Alphas, or future Alphas," Mara belonging to that second category. "Stronger than any other wolf and almost never get pregnant. The problem is that there is only one Alpha per pack. So I was starting to overstay my welcome."
You nodded in understanding. "So any suggestions on which way we should go?"
Mara nodded. "You came from the direction of the bee village, so we should go that direction. We'll reach a road that heads straight for a port town. Or we could detour through some caves that are rumored to contain a magic spring. Your choice."
"Alright, let's go."
"Say," Mara asked curiously, "How many times did my mother milk you last night anyway?"
"Six."
14221212112.title: You say "I'm sorry."

1422121212.content:
This crazy, this is crazy, you chant to yourself as you walk up the village, the bee-girl's satchel slung over your shoulder. You can't believe you're actually doing this. Where had all this reckless bravery come from?
As you walk up to the entrance, you get your first clear look at a warrior bee. Two of them stand at either side of the village gates. They are slender, about a head shorter than you. Twin antennae are perched on the forehead over dark eyes. That is all you can really see of their face, as the rest is covered in shiny black armor. The rest of their bodies are similarly covered, with bright yellow stripes on their sides You suppose their small breasts are well supported by the materiel. They stand at attention, heeled boots together, their arms along their sides, wings flat against their backs. You look uneasily at the long knifes extending from their wrists. Thinking about it you realize that they would be the stingers of a more mundane bee.
As you step between the guards their antennae twitch, but the don't even look in your direction. You walk cleanly through the gate. You're in.
You look around the monster-infested village. It appears the buildings were more or less intact. They had just been covered in what looks like beeswax. Bee workers move quickly around the town, each at least a head shorter than the warriors. In contrast to their warrior's black armor, the workers are covered in soft black and yellow fuzz. On the roofs, warriors land and take off, ending and beginning patrols of the area. Glancing inside one building, you see a wagon being repaired, while another is being carefully loaded with jars full of thick golden honey. Another building had been gutted, the walls lined with hexagonal cells, each with a bee warrior asleep in it. Oddly two of the buildings look completely unaltered, while another appears to be entirely covered in beeswax.
Stepping up to the first of the unaltered buildings, what appears to have once been the local inn, and look inside. What you see shocks you. Apparently the workers are not without stings of their own. Right in front of you is a warrior bee, face armor gone, on all fours with a look of ecstasy on her black face. behind her is a worker bee who is ramming her cock-like sting into the bigger bee. Looking around the room you see a number of other bees in doing the same thing, in every conceivable position. You look at a warrior, just in time to see her pull her mouth off of her partners sting, only for the worker to spray a thick golden-yellow fluid all over her face.
You apparently just found out how bee-girl is made.
You walk away from the inn, stunned and slightly aroused by what you just saw. You look over at the remaining two buildings.
Which one should you investigate.
1422121212.title: Going in

14221212121.content:
As you approach the was covered building you her a buzzing that gets louder the closer you get. The main doors had been removed and a number of worker bees move in and out freely. Cautiously you look inside. And stifle a gasp. Not even the sight at the tavern could have prepared you for this.
Standing at attention along the walls, are warrior guards. Worker bees fly around the room, accounting for the buzzing you heard. And in the center of the room being tended to by the workers is a giant. Superficially she has the same coloration as the workers, but she appears to be nearly ten feet tall. And fat. Massive mounds of flesh sag from every part of her body. Workers continually move. around the massive creature adjusting cushions, and insuring her comfort. From her groin extends a two foot long honey-sting, that workers are using their whole bodies to stimulate, licking greedily at the golden-brown fluid that leaks from the tip. You have found the queen.
You keep watching and the queen tilts her head back and opens her mouth. A worker fly up plants her feet on the queens shoulders, and gently lowers her honey sting into the queens mouth. The queen closes your lips around the shaft and the worker quickly pistons in and out, fucking her queens face.
The movement reaches the peak and the worker flies off leaving the queen with a mouth full of honey.
You have a descicion to make. Do you go inside the queen's room or Go Back and search the other building
14221212121.title: Wax covered building

142212121211.content:
As soon as you step forward into the room, the queen's head swivels to look at. You both freeze as you register the look of astonishment on her face. The queen is not fooled by your scent disguise! You backpedal out of the room reaching for your sword too late. Every warrior in the room takes flight, knife-stings extended. You turn to run but their is no way you can make it. A warrior slams into using the same tactics as on the werewolf. Another and another hit you all stabbing your torso. Everything goes black.

Bad End
142212121211.title: You Idiot

14221212122.content:
The clean building appears to have once been the local temple. You walk inside and are surprised too see nothing. There are no bees on sight. It looks to be a perfectly normal, empty temple. Instantly suspicious, you draw your sword and advance.
The building had been cleaned. The windows gleamed and the pews looked freshly painted. You didn't see dust or a single cobweb anywhere. Yet as you looked closer, you saw signs that the bees had been in there. Small repairs had been done in beeswax. One pew had almost a quarter of its length replaced with wax. You find a door that you are pretty sure leads to the priest's rooms. Pressing your ear against the wood, you hear buzzing.
Cautiously you open the door and peek inside. Like the rest of the building it is clean but with a definite sign that the bees had been in here. In this case a bee was still in the room. She has the same physical characteristics of the worker bee, but much taller, being only slightly shorter than you and a lot curvier. She was buzzing to herself, much like a human might hum or sing.
Most surprising was the fact that she was wearing a skirt. All the bees you had seen so far were mostly covered in armor or soft fuzz, mostly. None of them were wearing clothes.
You must have made some noise because she turns around and looks right at you. Her eyes widen in surprise. "Who are you?"
She knows you're not a bee! What do you do?
14221212122.title: Empty temple

142212121221.content:
You lunge forward, sword extended aiming for her exposed face. Only to have the blade slide of the black armor that materializes on her face. You recover and take a second look at your opponent. Suddenly she looks like a warrior bee, head to toe black armor, knife-stings extended. You only have a moment to ponder the sudden change before she attacks. You manage to get a few blows in, but your sword bounces right off her hard armor. All the while her knife-stings slice your arms and chest.
Finally your sword falls from your hand, the tendons in your wrist severed by a particularly savage blow. Blood drips to the floor as you sink to your knees. The bee-girl grips your hair and pulls your head back, exposing it to the descending knife-sting.

Bad End
142212121221.title: Not so Helpless

choices: It might not be as safe as you think
142212121222.content:
You drop your sword, it clangs loudly on the floor, as you throw up hands palms out. The bee stares at you eyes narrowed and you notice that knife-stings that have appeared on her wrists. "Who are you?" She repeats the question.
You've managed to back yourself into a corner. Your only weapon is on the ground, and you know that those wings could propel her across the room, easily killing you before you could reach the sword. You decide that the best policy is to answer honestly. "My name is Erik."
"Why are you here?"
Again the truth seems the best reply. "I'm an adventurer and I was passing through when I saw your village. I decided to take a look around."
She just stares at you, until apparently she decides you are trustworthy. Her knife-stings retract with a soft click, and she extends a glossy black hand, "My name is Miranda."
You cautiously take her hand in yours, despite the polished look it feels soft. You grasp it firmly but carefully, not yet sure how you stand in the eyes of this bee. Shes looking you up and down critically, but you can't tell if she likes what sees or is disappointed. "How did you even get in her?" Maybe she is just a little disbelieving. In response you hold out the satchel, you had picked up earlier. She takes it and her antennae twitch. "This shouldn't have worked. Clearly it did, but... Damn you Mother."
"Excuse me?" You didn't quite understand what she was saying. She obviously wasn't another dumb bee. In fact you are pretty sure she's a queen bee. She immediately confirms your thoughts.

info.brief_description: You are a young adventurer about to embark on a quest in a world full of Monster Girls.
info.description:
Several years ago in the Kingdom of Asun, an evil Witch attacked the capital city with her army of Monster Girls. The evil Witch was successful in killing the King, and crowned herself the new queen of Asun. Since that day, many adventurers and warriors have taken up arms against the evil Witch Queen and her army of Monster Girls.

You are one such Hero. You are Erik, a young boy that just turned 16 and has decided to go on a quest to defeat the Witch Queen or die trying.

Rules

1. Keep it readable.
2. No one liners. Seriously, I don't want this to be one of those stories where there is like ten chapters where nothing happens because they where all devoted to one decision. No "X or or something else." "Then how about Y, or something else" stuff.
2b. I will except one liners like "Take a look around town" where it was clarifying something and all options are guaranteed to move the story along.
3. All battles with a Monster Girl must have at least one Bad End.
